Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Us

We at Lumion make beautiful, high-performance desktop software for architectural visualization. Think: gorgeous buildings, smooth lighting, slick renders ‚Äî the works. Now, we‚Äôre on a mission to develop some AI enhancements on top.

We're not trying to build the next ChatGPT or reinvent neural networks. We just want to make our app smarter ‚Äî with clever, useful, jaw-droppingly cool features ‚Äî using the powerful AI models already out there in the wild. That‚Äôs where you come in.

What You‚Äôll Actually Do

You're not a lab researcher. You're a feature whisperer who knows how to make AI do things. You'll use open-source models (diffusion, GANs, vision transformers, etc.), evaluate a few APIs, glue things together, and help our users get magical results with minimal clicks.

Here are some things we‚Äôre dreaming about:

Turn a crappy photo into a stunning material.

Auto-generate textures or assets with zero human suffering.

Help users get better renders faster with upscaling, denoising, smart defaults.

Integrate AI into creative workflows without making it feel like AI is taking over the world (yet).

We‚Äôre Looking for Someone Who:

Has experience working with AI/ML in real-world, non-academic settings

Knows how to wrangle pre-trained models (PyTorch, ONNX, Hugging Face, etc.)

Loves building things, not just running experiments

Can work in Python, and ideally isn‚Äôt afraid of C++ (or people who use it)

Understands that ‚ÄúAI-enhanced‚Äù should never mean ‚Äúmysteriously broken‚Äù

Bonus: You‚Äôve played with 3D software, graphics pipelines, or materials/textures

Why You Might Like It Here

No infra-heavy LLM nonsense ‚Äî just real features for real users

Small team, high trust, low politics

Ownership from day one: prototype, iterate, ship

We‚Äôre allergic to buzzwords, but not allergic to shipping cool stuff

¬†An attractive salary and bonus structure.

¬†Full-time contract.

¬†Flexible working hours (including working from home Wednesdays).

¬†30 vacation days per year.

¬†20 wor-cation schemes per year.

¬†Local Office Benefits: Free lunch and free office gym.

¬†The opportunity to work in an enthusiastic, international team, in a creative environment, focused on people, growth, and collaboration.

Friendly note:

Please do not make use of this vacancy as an acquisition opportunity.

Show more
HTML:
About Us

We at Lumion make beautiful, high-performance desktop software for architectural visualization. Think: gorgeous buildings, smooth lighting, slick renders ‚Äî the works. Now, we‚Äôre on a mission to develop some AI enhancements on top.

We're not trying to build the next ChatGPT or reinvent neural networks. We just want to make our app smarter ‚Äî with clever, useful, jaw-droppingly cool features ‚Äî using the powerful AI models already out there in the wild. That‚Äôs where you come in.

What You‚Äôll Actually Do

You're not a lab researcher. You're a feature whisperer who knows how to make AI do things. You'll use open-source models (diffusion, GANs, vision transformers, etc.), evaluate a few APIs, glue things together, and help our users get magical results with minimal clicks.

Here are some things we‚Äôre dreaming about:

  • Turn a crappy photo into a stunning material.

  • Auto-generate textures or assets with zero human suffering.

  • Help users get better renders faster with upscaling, denoising, smart defaults.

  • Integrate AI into creative workflows without making it feel like AI is taking over the world (yet).

We‚Äôre Looking for Someone Who:

  • Has experience working with AI/ML in real-world, non-academic settings

  • Knows how to wrangle pre-trained models (PyTorch, ONNX, Hugging Face, etc.)

  • Loves building things, not just running experiments

  • Can work in Python, and ideally isn‚Äôt afraid of C++ (or people who use it)

  • Understands that ‚ÄúAI-enhanced‚Äù should never mean ‚Äúmysteriously broken‚Äù

  • Bonus: You‚Äôve played with 3D software, graphics pipelines, or materials/textures

Why You Might Like It Here

  • No infra-heavy LLM nonsense ‚Äî just real features for real users

  • Small team, high trust, low politics

  • Ownership from day one: prototype, iterate, ship

  • We‚Äôre allergic to buzzwords, but not allergic to shipping cool stuff

  •  An attractive salary and bonus structure.

  •  Full-time contract.

  •  Flexible working hours (including working from home Wednesdays).

  •  30 vacation days per year.

  •  20 wor-cation schemes per year.

  •  Local Office Benefits: Free lunch and free office gym.

  •  The opportunity to work in an enthusiastic, international team, in a creative environment, focused on people, growth, and collaboration.

Friendly note:

Please do not make use of this vacancy as an acquisition opportunity.

Title: Data Analytics Specialist (Data Analist / Data Scientist)
HTML:
Als Data Analytics Specialist / Data Analist / Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van data om inzichten te verkrijgen en te gebruiken voor datagedreven besluitvorming bij of voor onze gerenommerde klanten waaronder Belastingdienst, Gemeente Den Haag, diverse ministeries, Centraal Justitieel Incassobureau of VGZ. Afhankelijk van het ervaringsniveau ligt de focus op verschillende aspecten van data-analyse en data science.


Waarom past deze vacature bij jou?

Je bent analytisch, nieuwsgierig en gedreven om maatschappelijke impact te maken met data. Je schakelt gemakkelijk tussen techniek en beleid en weet abstracte analyses te vertalen naar concrete inzichten. Je draagt graag bij aan kennisdeling, continu verbeteren en datagedreven werken binnen onze klanten. Je vindt het leuk om kennis te delen met collega‚Äôs, klanten en vakgenoten. Je voelt je thuis in een informele, collegiale en professionele omgeving, waar de aandacht voor de klant en voor de medewerker centraal staan.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Verzamelen, opschonen, transformeren en valideren van data uit verschillende bronnen.
  • Toepassen van statistische methoden en data-analyse technieken om patronen, trends en inzichten uit data te halen.
  • Ontwikkelen van geavanceerde machine learning modellen.
  • Resultaten van analyses visualiseren en presenteren in heldere dashboards, rapporten en presentaties.
  • Adviseren over datagedreven besluitvorming aan management en stakeholders.
  • Coachen en (bege)leiden van medior en junior Data Specialisten.
  • Effectief samenwerken met Data Engineers, Data Stewards, business analisten en andere stakeholders.


Wat kun jij van ons verwachten?

  • Een vast dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van ‚Ç¨ 8.000,- bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • Opdrachtkeuzevrijheid: Jij bepaalt in overleg waar je aan werkt, met de begeleiding van een personal coach;
  • Per jaar ‚Ç¨ 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast ook nog eens 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met vakgenoten en inhoudelijke events;
  • Minimaal 25 vakantiedagen, met de mogelijkheid om extra dagen op te bouwen of te verkopen;
  • Sociale events zoals sportdagen, weekend weg en gezellige borrels;
  • Een vestiging bij jou in de buurt.


Jouw ontwikkeling, onze prioriteit

CIMSOLUTIONS biedt jou een omgeving waarin je kunt doorgroeien naar Data Architect / Data Consultant. Je krijgt ruimte, ondersteuning en middelen om je te specialiseren en te excelleren. We bieden toegang tot diverse opleidingen en ondersteunen je met ervaren collega's. Onze slogan "Learn, create and make it work" is niet zomaar een zin ‚Äì het is de kern van hoe wij werken en ontwikkelen.


CIMSOLUTIONS heeft een actief diversiteitsbeleid en streeft naar een evenwichtige verdeling van professionals naar o.a. leeftijd, gender, etnische achtergrond en cultuur, arbeidsvermogen, kennis en competenties. Hierbij benadrukken wij dat wij gelijke kansen belangrijk vinden in de selectie.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • WO-diploma in een relevante richting.
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren van data-analyses.
  • Diepgaande kennis van statistische methoden, machine learning technieken en algoritmen.
  • Ervaring met het ontwikkelen en trainen van machine learning modellen.
  • Ervaring met data-analyse tools en programmeertalen (bijv. Python of R).
  • Kennis van actuele ontwikkelingen op het gebied van data-analyse, data-ethiek en relevante wet- en regelgeving.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
  • Voor senior functies ervaring met het leiden van data science projecten en kennisdeling.
  • Minimaal 3 jaar relevante werkervaring, bij voorkeur in een Agile omgeving.


Waarom CIMSOLUTIONS?

15 keer Top Employer!

  • Uitstekend salaris;
  • Vrije keuze leaseauto;
  • ‚Ç¨ 5000,- opleidingsbudget;
  • Aantrekkelijke bonussen;
  • Veel sociale evenementen;
  • Uitdagende projecten;
  • Gevarieerde opdrachten;
  • Gerenommeerde klanten.


Heb je interesse?

Wij vinden het leuk om op ons hoofdkantoor of √©√©n van onze lokale vestigingen of online kennis te maken. Solliciteer via onderstaande button of neem voor meer informatie contact op met ons recruitment team via:

  • Mail: recruitment@cimsolutions.nl;
  • Telefoon: 0499-366 000;
  • of bezoek onze website: www.cimsolutions.nl/werken-bij/

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist | Schiphol area | Hybrid way of working | ASAP| Contract until the end of the year




*Only candidates living in the Netherlands are considered for this position*

*Only people being on payroll or ZZP can be considered for this position*







üéØ Hiring: Senior Data Scientist (AI & LLMs)

üìç Location: Netherlands | üó£ Language: Dutch (C2) & English (C1)

Are you an experienced Data Scientist who can bridge the gap between complex AI solutions and real business value? We‚Äôre looking for someone who thrives at the intersection of technical expertise and stakeholder engagement.




‚úÖ 5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist

‚úÖ Strong communicator ‚Äî able to clearly explain AI concepts to non-technical audiences

‚úÖ Skilled in Python, Docker, Git, Azure, FastAPI, Langchain (or similar)

‚úÖ Hands-on experience with LLM-driven backends (e.g. chatbot architecture)

‚úÖ Solid understanding of machine learning, statistical models & DevOps (CI/CD)

‚úÖ Proactive in identifying valuable AI use cases within business domains

You‚Äôll work closely with the Product Owner, support integration with a third-party front-end, and ensure your solutions are secure, scalable, and compliant. Future projects may include churn prediction models or AI-powered analytics for service teams.







Are you the Data Scientist that we are looking for? Send your CV (in Dutch) and contact details to meel.polkki@amoriabond.com and I will contact you as soon as I can!




We will endeavour to respond to your application ASAP. However, there may be times when it is not possible to reply to all applications, due to high volumes of enquiries. This is sometimes the case for unsuccessful applications to one of our vacancies. We apologise for this and can reassure you that we will keep your details and contact you in the future should any suitable positions arise.




Amoria Bond operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Good afternoon Network,




A client of mine within the technology and Printing sector are seeking a mid to senior level Agentic Ai consultant based near the Eindhoven area.

We‚Äôre looking for an experienced Agentic AI Engineer to design and implement systems that generate structured manual prompts through agentic task decomposition. You will work at the intersection of prompt engineering, task automation, and autonomous agent orchestration, building workflows that translate high level objectives into step-by-step, human-readable prompt instructions.

This role is ideal for someone who understands how to build agentic systems and wants to enable scalable prompt workflows that can be human-reviewed, improved, or reused in downstream models.




Required skills:

background in Agentic Ai
Data Science OR ML background
Azure knowledge Nice to Have
Producing Manual AI Prompts
English Speaking
Able to Commute x2 days a week to Eindhoven area




If you are interested to know more about this role then please send me your most up to date CV and we can arrange a call.




Kind regards,

Owen

Title: Python AI Engineer
Description:
Role Overview




We‚Äôre looking for an AI Engineer with strong Python expertise to help design and deliver intelligent, scalable AI solutions across our healthcare systems. You'll work with cross-functional teams to develop ML models, implement data pipelines, and contribute to the deployment and monitoring of AI-powered features.




Key Responsibilities

Develop machine learning and deep learning models in Python using frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Write modular, testable, and production-ready Python code for data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model training.
Build and maintain scalable Python-based data pipelines using tools like Airflow and Pandas.
Deploy AI models in production using Python microservices and container technologies (e.g., Docker, FastAPI, Flask).
Collaborate with MLOps engineers to automate CI/CD pipelines for model training, testing, and deployment.
Implement monitoring, logging, and model performance tracking using Python tools and libraries.
Collaborate with data scientists to interpret data and ensure clinical relevance of AI solutions.
Adhere to software development best practices, version control (e.g., Git), and regulatory and quality standards.




Required Qualifications

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or a related technical field.
3+ years of professional experience in AI/ML development using Python.
Strong knowledge of the Python ecosystem for machine learning (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas, NumPy, FastAPI).
Experience deploying Python-based ML models in production environments (on cloud platforms like Azure or AWS).
Familiar with MLOps concepts, data versioning (DVC), and model lifecycle management using tools like MLflow or Weights & Biases.
Understanding of software testing in Python (e.g., pytest) and experience with performance optimization.

Role Overview


We‚Äôre looking for an AI Engineer with strong Python expertise to help design and deliver intelligent, scalable AI solutions across our healthcare systems. You'll work with cross-functional teams to develop ML models, implement data pipelines, and contribute to the deployment and monitoring of AI-powered features.


Key Responsibilities

  • Develop machine learning and deep learning models in Python using frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Write modular, testable, and production-ready Python code for data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model training.
  • Build and maintain scalable Python-based data pipelines using tools like Airflow and Pandas.

Title: Internship AI & Data Science
Description:
What are you going to do as an AI & Data Science intern at Highberg?

Do you want to use your AI and data skills to optimize Employee Experience while helping well-known companies with their business performance? We are looking for people who enjoy turning complex data into understandable insights, are passionate about AI & data science and want to contribute to the development of HR technology.

Your work as an AI & Data Science intern at #Highberg

As an intern, you will work on exploring and prototyping an innovative AI solution that helps non-technical HR users work with complex HR data in a simple and intuitive way.

The core of the assignment: you will research and build a chat interface that allows users to query structured HR data from a data warehouse, without having to write SQL or needing technical prior knowledge.

In your research, you will explore questions such as:


How can we enable natural language queries on HR datasets using generative AI?
Which tools and technologies (e.g. Copilot, Azure OpenAI, LangChain, FastAPI) are best suited for this use case?
What are the options for integrating this solution into Power BI, including security aspects such as row-level security?
What does a reliable, explainable, and user-friendly solution look like in practice?


Although we already have ideas about possible tools and architectures, we deliberately keep the technology choice open. Together with colleagues, you will research and document various design options. The ultimate goal is integration of the assistant into Power BI, but your MVP may start as a stand-alone prototype.

With your work, you will contribute directly to our mission to make data-driven HR smarter, more accessible and future-proof.

What are we asking?


You are in the final year of a study at university level
You have experience with Python and SQL, and preferably a visualisation tool such as Power BI
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and oral
You are available for ‚â•4 days a week for at least 6 months and within 1 hour travel from our office in Amsterdam RAI


Who are you?


You have a passion for data, AI, programming, statistics/machine learning and research
You are enterprising, creative, flexible, results-oriented, accurate and socially adept
You get the best out of yourself in an environment where you are challenged to go outside your comfort zone and learn new things


What are we offering?


A good internship allowance (EUR 550 per month) and training courses worth several thousand euros
12.5 days' holiday (for a six-month full-time employment)
Starting from September or by mutual agreement
Supervision by an experienced data scientist
A pleasant working environment, short communication lines, focus on performance as a team and plenty of social activities such as get-togethers, sports activities and team meetings
Our office is located at the Zuidas in Amsterdam and is easily accessible by public transport. We ask you to work at the office a minimum of two days a week, but you are always welcome, whether it is for the good coffee, a game of table tennis or just for your colleagues


About The Team

You will join the People, Analytics & Research team, which is part of the Organisational & Sustainability Transformation Hub. The team consists of around 25 colleagues: consultants, researchers, data scientists and data engineers. A great team of smart and driven professionals, who are always there for you with a helping hand! We not only work hard together, but also have a lot of fun together - we organise social events and we do lots of fun activities, such as outings, Friday afternoon drinks and sports events.

We are happy to help

If you have any questions or would like to discuss this vacancy further about opportunities within Highberg, please contact Kevin O'Driscoll (Data Scientist), via kevin.odriscoll@highberg.comvalue:

About Highberg

Highberg originated from nine boutique consulting firms, each with best-in-class expertise in organizational, digital, and sustainability transformations. As a collective of multidisciplinary and talented boutique consulting companies, we combine our strengths to pursue one ambition: to become the leading transformation consulting group in Europe. We are proud to be a B Corp certified company, as we strive to care for our planet, society, and our employees.

Working at Highberg

At Highberg, we foster a supportive and collaborative culture. This culture is built on our three core values: Be Committed, Be Better, and Be You.
In ‚ÄôBe Committed,‚Äô colleagues tirelessly strive for a lasting positive impact on our clients, society, and the environment. We are characterized by our entrepreneurial spirit and our collective commitment to the overall success of the company.
‚ÄôBe Better‚Äô is all about our belief in continuous learning and improvement, and we provide you with opportunities to grow and develop both personally and professionally. We strive for the highest standards of quality and professionalism in everything we do.
And last but definitely not least, ‚ÄôBe You‚Äô is about encouraging you to bring your whole self to work, have fun, and embrace diversity and inclusion. We seek to establish personal connections with our clients and colleagues, building long-term, trust-based relationships.
Show more

Title: Freelance Data Scientist
Description:
Join a cross-functional team to develop and maintain machine learning solutions that drive customer satisfaction, operational efficiency, and personalized services.




Responsibilities

Build scalable, production-ready ML pipelines
Collaborate with domain experts to align models with business logic
Support roadmap execution and perform ad hoc analysis
Maintain code quality, testing, and monitoring standards
Work in an agile team focused on clarity, impact, and maintainability




Qualifications




3-5 years of experience
Knowledge in Python, PySpark, GitLab (CI/CD), MLflow, Databricks

  • Support roadmap execution and perform ad hoc analysis
  • Maintain code quality, testing, and monitoring standards
  • Work in an agile team focused on clarity, impact, and maintainability


Qualifications


  • 3-5 years of experience
  • Knowledge in Python, PySpark, GitLab (CI/CD), MLflow, Databricks

Title: AI Specialist
Description:
Ben jij degene die kansen ziet om werkprocessen slimmer in te richten en weet hoe je dat aanpakt? Snap je hoe je saaie, herhalende klusjes omtovert tot smooth workflows met tools als Zapier, Make, Power Automate en n8n? En ben je ook thuis in AI-tools zoals ChatGPT, Copilot, Perplexity en Gemini? Dan zoeken wij jou om ons AI-team te versterken!


Taken


Als AI specialist help je lokale bedrijven ontdekken wat AI voor hen kan betekenen, en zet je idee√´n om in werkende oplossingen. Je gaat:





Slimme processen bouwen en automatiseren bij verschillende ondernemers (ja, lekker afwisselend en op locatie).


Actief, samen met het bedrijf, naar laaghangend fruit zoeken waar AI direct iets kan betekenen.


Niet alleen techniek, maar juist de mensen meenemen in verandering (want dat vinden wij minstens zo belangrijk).


Meehelpen om de tofste scale-up in Almkerk n√≥g beter te maken.


Gewoon lekker samenwerken, niet de hele dag thuis achter je scherm.



Vereisten


Wie ben jij?

Je bent praktisch met passie voor techniek en innovatie. Je snapt bedrijfsprocessen en je stroopt samen met klanten de mouwen op. Je denkt mee, vraagt door en maakt dingen echt.




Wat je in elk geval moet kunnen:





Processen analyseren en structureren om vervolgens te automatiseren.


Makkelijk schakelen tussen klantvraag en technische oplossingen.


Goed kunt uitleggen wat AI is, ook aan mensen zonder technische achtergrond.


Je bent zelfstandig, maar je zoekt ook zeker de samenwerking op.


Actief werken met LLM‚Äôs (zoals OpenAI, Anthropic, of andere bestaande modellen).





Bonuspunten als je:





Verder kijkt dan alleen ChatGPT en ervaring hebt met andere LLM‚Äôs.


Al eens gewerkt hebt aan automatiseringsoplossingen voor bedrijven


Weet hoe je eigen modellen kunt trainen en finetunen.



Benefits



Een energiek team van bijna 20 collega‚Äôs die net zo enthousiast zijn als jij.


Werken voor gave klanten met uitdagende projecten.


Veel kansen om te leren, te groeien en jezelf te ontwikkelen.


Prima arbeidsvoorwaarden (maar dat vind je logisch, toch?).





Stuur je cv en een korte video waarin je jezelf voorstelt. Niet verplicht, wel leuk. Geen regisseur nodig, geen script, gewoon wie jij bent. Past dit niet bij je? Dan mag je natuurlijk ook gewoon iets anders insturen. Zolang het maar √©cht van jou is, niet van ChatGPT of een andere LLMüòâ

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Adaptfy is a turnkey data & analytics solution for the SHV family of companies. We support multiple SHV Groups with advanced Data & Analytics in all areas, elevating their operations in diverse industries across international markets and throughout entire value chains.

Adaptfy is a joint venture formed by SHV and Metyis. Metyis embodies visionary thinking in the digital world, while SHV is a globally established family of companies built on the values of integrity, trust, curiosity, passion, and inclusivity.

SHV has a presence across four continents, with businesses spanning energy, heavy lifting and transport, animal nutrition & aquaculture, testing, inspection & certification, and more. The organisation‚Äôs history reflects its courage to care‚Äîfor people, for performance, and for future generations. Their success is a testament to constant reinvention through innovation.

At Adaptfy, we play a pivotal role in bringing SHV‚Äôs digital vision to life. From optimising supply chains across Europe to enhancing operational efficiency in South America, we connect the dots for SHV, shaping a data-driven future for the entire family of companies.

What We Offer


Interact with our clients on regular basis, to drive their business towards impactful change.
Work in multidisciplinary teams and learn from motivated colleagues.
A chance to take responsibility for your work, develop yourself every day and take full ownership of your career.
Become part of a fast growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Perform data analysis in the field of Growth Revenue Management, Marketing Analytics, CLM/CRM Analytics and/or Risk Analytics.
Conduct analyses in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations.
Solve problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis
Prepare and facilitating workshops
Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives
Coach and mentor team members



What You Will Bring


1-3 years of professional experience in the analytics domain.
An advanced degree in quantitative field (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, etc.).
An ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses and recommendations from data analysis.
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, and programming. Strong working knowledge of SQL, Python, R, and/or Matlab.
Ability to talk the language of statistics, finance, and economics.
Profound knowledge of the English language.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.

As a trusted voice for many of the world‚Äôs most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.

About Business Assurance

We help companies ensure compliance, build high-performing management systems, and meet competence needs within a wide range of industries. DNV helps companies understand Working with us, you can be involved in technically challenging and innovative projects worldwide demanding a broad variety of expertise. Our strong focus on research and innovation opens an array of opportunities, and allows you to engage in projects which develop next generation solutions. and manage their risk picture through our management system certification and training portfolios.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist, you play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to inform business decisions. Your work will involve developing and deploying data-driven solutions, bringing them into production, and ensuring they continue to add value. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, design statistical models, and use your coding skills to extract meaningful insights from large datasets. This position allows you to be an internal entrepreneur within Business Assurance, building AI systems and team up in the broader AI community at DNV.

Engaging with process and product owners, understanding business workflows, data, and needs before shaping AI projects is essential to ensure the development of useful and impactful AI systems. Additionally, you will follow up on AI systems in production to ensure their adoption and ongoing value. Leveraging generative AI technologies, you will create innovative solutions that further enhance business capabilities.

Your Daily Activities Will Cover Following Areas


Data Collection and Preprocessing:
Collect and analyze business results or set up and manage new studies to gather relevant data.
Transform data into a suitable format for analysis.
Model Development and Deployment:
Build AI systems using generative AI technologies to create innovative solutions that enhance business capabilities.
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms.
Design and implement frameworks for data collection and automation.
Likewise, following up systems in production to make sure they are adopted and continue to add value.
Reporting and Communication:
Create reports, demonstrators‚ÄØand presentations outlining business predictions, proposals, and findings.
Communicate insights to stakeholders effectively.‚ÄØ‚ÄØIt is important to create something tangible, that is ‚Äúalive‚Äù to boost understanding and relevance.
Continuous Learning and Innovation:
Stay current with technical advancements, industry trends, and best practices.
Enable smarter business processes by using analytics for meaningful insights.
Explore and experiment with emerging generative AI tools and frameworks to drive innovation and maintain a competitive edge


What we offer


Career and development. The possibilities to grow and develop your competencies and ambitions within DNV are extensive. We have a strong company culture with emphasis on growth mindset, competence sharing and professional and personal development.
Work/life balance. We offer flexible working and have a focus on work/life balance for our employees.
Supportive and caring culture. Our international culture embodies diverse colleagues who value teamwork and inclusion across business areas and borders. You may also join employee associations to establish networks through social and professional activities. Our largest society CONNECT throws after-works and informal meetings all year long for you to join.
Attractive rewards. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, health services, and competitive pension, insurance, in addition to a global profit share scheme.
By joining DNV you become part of a world-leading company whose purpose is to safeguard life, property, and the environment. You will also be part of a culture where our values ‚Äúwe care, we share, we dare‚Äù characterize how we act towards each other, our customers and how we perform our work.


DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.

About You

To be successful in the role you should :


You hold a master‚Äôs degree or higher in data science, computer science, statistics or another related field
You have deep experience and knowledge with practical AI development for integration in business applications
You have strong experience in building and maintaining Python packages, including structuring, testing, and publishing reusable modules.
Experience with LLMs, prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).
You have working knowledge of git and docker
You are eager to learn about new technologies and trends
You enjoy working in cross-domain teams
You are result-oriented and like to solve problems
You are curious and eager to understand customer needs
You have good verbal and written communication skills in English

Please send us your CV and Cover Letter written in English.

Title: Intern Machine Learning Engineer Reinforcement Learning
Description:
Intern Machine Learning Engineer

In this position, you will join the loadmaster.ai ML team which is focused on developing, implementing and integrating state-of-the-art Reinforcement Learning (RL) models to optimise container terminal operations. We use RL algorithms to enhance efficiency and decision-making across a variety container terminal scenarios. As part of this journey, you‚Äôll help tackle the unique challenges involved in building, training, and deploying RL models, the simulation environment used to train the RL models and how to demo this to clients.




What will you do?¬†

Your primary responsibility will be to support the development and optimization of our simulation and training platform including the development of a demo pipeline for potential clients. Our RL agents train within a simulator (a digital twin of the container terminal), exploring millions of scenarios to learn optimal container management strategies. The simulator is a central part of our training infrastructure and therefore has to be faithful to reality and fast to train on. You will be working on a range of tasks, including, but not limited to:

Developing simulator components: contribute to building modules in our container terminal simulator to ensure fast and realistic training runs for our agents
Optimising infrastructure: Working on optimisations to our simulators and broader training infrastructure to make training faster and improve our experiment tracking
Working with real-world datasets to improve our domain understanding¬†
Train state-of-the-art algorithms to improve the performance of the RL model
Explore alternative approaches to optimising container terminals (e.g., Offline RL or Supervised learning)¬†
Design and implement a demo/POC pipeline for our products

Since our solutions are actively deployed, you‚Äôll also participate in brainstorming sessions and collaborate with our team to ensure that we implement the most efficient and impactful solutions.Being a team player with strong communication skills is critical, as you‚Äôll work closely with both your colleagues and our clients to develop practical, performance-driven models. You‚Äôll be working in a small team so initiative and proactiveness are essential. You‚Äôll be encouraged to try new ideas, and steer the internship toward topics that interest you most.




What do we require?

Pursuing or completing an MSc in a technical subject, with a focus on ML, Operations Research, or computer science
Demonstrated knowledge in Al. Knowledge of Reinforcement Learning is a big plus
Development experience in Python and familiarity with best practices in software engineering
An knack for writing clean and optimised code
Experience with popular machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch/Tensorflow) and data science tools (e.g., Numpy and Pandas)
Excellent communication skills
Available for at least 4 months




What do we have to offer?

Being a small team, we still have the special start up/scale up vibe. However, we are growing fast, and with this growth, we face many challenges. This also gives you the opportunity to be part of that growth through your internship to kick-start your career.

At loadmaster, we believe that our customers will need a long term partnership for their digitization and process optimization. That results in a variety of problems thrown at us, and thus a very dynamic environment. No two weeks will be the same.

The start of the internship can be flexible. It can be done full time or 4 days a week part-time, combined with your thesis or studies. The place of work will be Marconiplein 16 Rotterdam in the Netherlands and has to be physical for at least 2 days a week. We will pay you a monthly stipend. If we‚Äôre a good match, we‚Äôll consider you for a full-time role following the internship.




About us

loadmaster.ai is part of frontiergroup.ai frontiergroup.ai is a holding company which includes initiatives like loadmaster. While each initiative is its independent company we all share resources. Expect to interact with people working on completely different projects to you. In general, we have a relaxed and friendly culture and strive for continual growth as individuals and as a company, together.

We hope to see you soon!

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
Senior AI Research Engineer




Innovation ‚Äì Nijmegen, Gelderland (Hybrid)




SciPro is exclusively partnered with a pioneering medical imaging innovator seeking a Senior AI Research Engineer to revolutionize cancer detection through advanced AI technologies. This opportunity offers the chance to drive meaningful healthcare impact in a cutting-edge environment.




You'll develop sophisticated AI solutions‚Äîincluding foundation models, vision transformers, multimodal systems, and large language models‚Äîto tackle critical breast cancer diagnostic challenges. Working alongside clinical experts, you'll transform groundbreaking research into solutions that directly improve patient outcomes.




Key Responsibilities:




‚Ä¢ Architect next-generation AI models that enhance cancer detection accuracy

‚Ä¢ Apply deep learning and self-supervised methodologies to complex medical imaging datasets

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to translate AI research into clinical applications

‚Ä¢ Mentor junior team members and foster knowledge sharing across the organization




Your Qualifications:




‚Ä¢ Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related field

‚Ä¢ 4+ years building AI applications in radiology using large-scale datasets and GPU clusters

‚Ä¢ Proven expertise in neural networks, self-supervised learning, and medical imaging AI

‚Ä¢ Strong Python skills with experience in PyTorch, TensorBoard, and Slurm frameworks




Submit your application today to join this mission-driven team making life-changing impact through AI innovation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What it‚Äôs about

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to develop scalable, production-ready applications powered by data and AI. You are a Scientist or Engineer who embraces mathematics and understands the process of taking models from development to production. You possess the necessary skills and courage to bring ideas from your laptop to a cluster.




How you will help in creating value with Data & AI

At Xebia, we establish robust Data & AI practices to bring value to our clients and their customers. Our team of data professionals has successfully predicted daily bread demand, implemented energy-saving algorithms at a national scale, and established data innovation labs in large multinational corporations. By joining our team, you can contribute to even greater achievements in making top companies AI-driven.

As a machine learning engineer, your responsibility is to take AI solutions into production to generate value. You ensure that applications are scalable, testable, robust, and extendable through your expertise in engineering and machine learning.




What you will do to make AI-driven applications

You collaborate closely with data scientists on your team to understand the problem being addressed and their approach. You review their code, modularise it, identify areas for testing, and even challenge their solutions to enhance their effectiveness. Your proficiency in Python enables you to improve code quality or potentially translate it to other languages like Scala or Java.

During on-site client engagements, you may encounter challenging problems. Fortunately, Xebia organizes regular remote work sessions where you can discuss and find solutions with the collective intelligence of the entire team. If immediate assistance is needed, every Xebia member is just a quick message away, always ready to provide support.




THIS IS YOUR DREAM JOB IF‚Ä¶

‚úÖ You like working on the overlap between AI and software or data engineering.

‚úÖ You like building your solutions with services on public clouds or want to learn how to do that.

‚úÖ You like working for different clients and enjoy the excitement of regularly getting to learn new environments and know new people.

‚úÖ You speak Dutch fluently.




THIS IS NOT YOUR DREAM JOB IF‚Ä¶

‚ùå You only want to build models from data and are not interested in doing the work involved in taking these models into production.

‚ùå You are just fine with spaghetti code or do not understand what that is.

‚ùå You do not like coding, scripting, or templating.




WHAT IT IS LIKE TO BE A CONSULTANT AT XEBIA DATA

As a consultant at Xebia Data, you will have projects of varying lengths. Some are 2 weeks, some are 1 year, most are in between. Every project is different, as is every client. We, however, always deliver the best quality possible. It is not always easy, but it is always rewarding. You will be exposed to different companies, problems, systems, and solutions. Join our dynamic team and collaborate with industry leaders such as Ahold, ASML, Sligro, and Vattenfall! Explore the exciting projects we've undertaken by diving into our inspiring customer stories.




You will be surrounded by experts in different fields, and you will learn so many new things in a short time. Xebia Data offers the perfect environment to shine as a data professional.

You will never be alone on this journey. We have all experienced imposter syndrome, had a difficult project, or felt down at times. We know what it takes, we know it is difficult sometimes, and we will be there for you when you need it. We say People First, and we mean it.




Xebia Data offers you great benefits too, of course!

You can enjoy, for free, healthy lunches and not-so-healthy drinks/snacks at our offices.
You can use the great benefits we offer for your physical and mental well-being.
You get a generous tech budget.
You can build/test/experiment anything you want in our sandbox environments in GCP, AWS and Azure.
You can work on that innovative idea of yours during the monthly Xebia Data Fridays.
You have 5.000 Euros and 6 days of development budget per year which you can spend on anything that will make you a better data professional.
You also have a monthly mobility budget to spend on leasing a car, leasing the e-bike of your dreams, or getting an NS Business Card.

Title: Data/Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Ga jij met ons de uitdaging aan om met onze data de resultaten van melkveehouders wereldwijd te verbeteren √©n bij te dragen aan de gezondheid van koeien? Sluit je aan bij het meest innovatieve bedrijf in de sector en werk mee aan oplossingen die √©cht impact maken! Met jou als onze nieuwe MLOps engineer blijven we bouwen aan onze ambitie en zetten we de snelle groei van de afgelopen jaren voort.

Samen met je team draai je projecten die met onze data nieuwe inzichten voor melkveehouders moeten opleveren. Inzichten die helpen om je als melkveehouder nog succesvoller te maken. CowManager loopt hiermee voorop in de markt. Als eerste koe-monitoringsysteem heeft CowManager een model beschikbaar voor haar klanten dat voorspelt welke koeien ziek gaan worden, nog voordat er klinische symptomen zijn. Hoe gaaf is dat!? Dit is pas het begin, er liggen nog talloze idee√´n te wachten om uitgewerkt te worden. Wat ons betreft een rol om van te dromen; We krijgen deze rol niet vaak vrij dus maak hier gebruik van!

Samen met de Data Engineers en Scientisten werk je aan de data en machine learning pipelines om het model in productie te kunnen zetten in onze Microsoft Azure cloud omgeving. Met andere woorden, je werkt aan de AI/ML oplossingen van begin tot eind: van concept, ontwikkeling en implementatie tot beheer en monitoring van de tools in productie.

Wat ga je doen?

  • Het bouwen van data pipelines voor data analyse en machine learning producten.
  • Het in productie brengen van machine learning modellen, met bijbehorende monitoring
  • Verzamelen van data uit verschillende bronnen en deze ontsluiten voor collega‚Äôs.
  • Transformeren van data naar een bruikbaar formaat.
  • Bouw en onderhoud van data infrastructuur en oplossingen.
  • Werken in een Agile team met DevOps verantwoordelijkheid.

Over CowManager

CowManager is een innovatief en wereldwijd opererend bedrijf in de agrarische sector, gedreven door big data en het welzijn van koeien. Als uitvinders van de eerste oorsensortechnologie voor melkvee blijven we continu innoveren met geavanceerde software en systemen. Door de hoeveelheid aan (sensor)data en complexiteit van het monitoren zijn we voorloper en constant op zoek naar super schaalbare en robuuste oplossingen. We vragen veel van je gedrevenheid, zijn ambitieus maar vinden het belangrijk dat je resultaten samen met je collega‚Äôs worden behaald.


Wat neem je mee?

  • Je hebt minimaal een HBO of WO werk- en denkniveau aangevuld met 3 jaar werkervaring als Data Scientist, Data engineer of Machine Learning engineer;
  • Je hebt ervaring met Python, met een focus op object-oriented programming en PySpark.;
  • Tevens sterke SQL kennis met betrekking tot data manipulatie en analyse;
  • Je hebt ervaring op het gebied van data-analyse en machine learning;
  • Je hebt ervaring met Azure cloud platform;
  • Je hebt ervaring met deployment pipelines en Infrastructure as Code;
  • Je hebt ervaring met source control systemen zoals GIT;
  • Je bent bekend met werken in een Agile omgeving;
  • Je heb ML pipelines successvol in productie gebracht;
  • Als persoon ben je klantgericht, teamplayer en creatief in het bedenken van oplossingen en verbeteringen.

Herken je jezelf niet in alle punten maar denk je toch een goede match te zijn? Overtuig ons met jouw motivatie!

Wat bieden wij?

  • Een moderne werkomgeving met de nieuwste technologie√´n;
  • Een salarisrange tussen de ‚Ç¨4.000-‚Ç¨5.500,-
  • Variabele eindejaarsbonus tot 10% van je jaarsalaris;
  • 25 verlofdagen, met de optie om extra dagen bij te kopen;
  • Werken aan innovatieve technologie met direct zichtbare impact;
  • Maandelijks ‚Ç¨50,- thuiswerkbudget (o.b.v. 40 uur);
  • ‚Ç¨500,- budget voor een ergonomische thuiswerkplek;
  • Jaarlijks vitaliteitsbudget van ‚Ç¨250,- (o.b.v. 40 uur);
  • Dagelijks gratis en vers fruit op kantoor.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde ontwikkelaar met kennis van AI om ons team te versterken. Als AI engineer bij Blinqx ben je verantwoordelijk voor het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en implementeren van softwareoplossingen die gebruik maken van AI-technologie√´n (zoals ChatGPT).




Wat ga je doen?

Als AI Engineer speel je een cruciale rol bij Blinqx in het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde softwareoplossingen die gebruik maken van AI-technologie√´n.




Je werkzaamheden bestaan onder andere uit:

Samenwerken met collega‚Äôs zoals ontwikkelaars, data scientists en business analisten om projectvereisten te begrijpen.
Ontwikkelen van passende AI-oplossingen die aansluiten op de behoeften van onze klanten.
Testen en debuggen van softwareoplossingen om de kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid te waarborgen, zodat onze producten voldoen aan de hoogste normen.
Werken met de nieuwste technologie√´n op het gebied van kunstmatige intelligentie.




Over het team

Binnen Blinqx hebben we een centraal AI-team waar je een belangrijke spil in bent. We werken aan casussen die in de verschillende applicaties ingezet worden. Jullie team werkt ‚Äòout of the box‚Äô idee√´n uit en door jullie gecombineerde expertise kun je snel en goed een proof of concept maken, finetunen en uiteindelijk overdragen aan de ontwikkelteams van de applicaties waar het ingezet gaat worden.




Wat breng jij?

Minimaal een Bachelor diploma in Computer Science, Software Engineering of een gerelateerd vakgebied.
Kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python, R, C# en/of andere relevante talen.
Ervaring met het werken met large language models.
Ervaring met het werken in een Agile/Scrum omgeving.
Ervaring met CI/CD.
Goede communicatie- en samenwerkingsvaardigheden.
Ervaring met het ontwikkelen van softwareoplossingen met behulp van AI-technologie√´n zoals machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, computer vision, etc.
Ervaring met Azure is een pr√©.




Wat bieden wij?

Een supermooie kans bij een snelgroeiende organisatie met een ondernemende en informele werksfeer.
Een goed salaris op basis van jouw ervaring.
Groei en ontwikkeling: we investeren in jouw groei zodat jij je kunt ontwikkelen.
Flexibel werken vanuit ons kantoor in Barendrecht, op onze andere locaties in Nederland of gedeeltelijk thuis.
26 vakantiedagen en 4 Blinqx BreaQX dagen, extra vrije dagen verspreid over het jaar.
Een laptop voor zakelijk gebruik.
Een telefoonvergoeding.
Een thuiswerkvergoeding, voor de dagen dat je vanuit huis werkt.
Een pensioenvergoeding.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Amsterdam - Bereik 91% van alle Nederlanders met jouw werk! Als Senior Data Analist/Data Scientist maak jij elke dag impact door middel van onze nieuwsmedia, magazines, online services, radio en TV. Of je nu voor of achter de schermen werkt. Wil jij jezelf ook verder ontwikkelen en zo onze mediaproducties versterken? Lees dan snel verder!

"Data is niet alleen cijfers en feiten, het vertelt het verhaal van onze business en biedt nieuwe kansen." Wil je het hele verhaal weten van onze medewerkers, klik dan hier. .

Wat ga je doen?

Jij bent een expert in querying, data-analyse en AI-innovatie en ziet direct hoe jij met data-oplossingen waarde kunt toevoegen aan ons toonaangevende mediabedrijf. Binnen het Nederland/Belgi√´ B2B Business Intelligence team ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het ontwikkelen van innovatieve data-oplossingen, het optimaliseren van onze data back-end en front-end √©n het realiseren van toonaangevende AI-projecten. Je maakt een verschil met jouw scherpe analytische blik, sterke technische expertise en strategische toegevoegde waarde.

Dit Doe Je Door


Het ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van data-oplossingen, zowel back-end als front-end.
Het implementeren van BI- en dashboard-methodieken voor Nederland en Belgi√´.
Een actieve rol te spelen bij het inrichten en onderhouden van ons data warehouse en cloud-omgeving.
AI en machine learning integreren in bestaande workflows.
Intensieve samenwerking met collega‚Äôs binnen BI, Data Engineering en IT-teams.


Wie zijn wij?

Wij zijn DPG Media, h√©t toonaangevende mediabedrijf van Nederland en Belgi√´. Met sterke merken zoals NU.nl, Qmusic, Tweakers, Libelle, de Volkskrant en meer.

Binnen het B2B Business Intelligence-team werk je samen met een gemotiveerde en deskundige groep professionals. Onze missie is om op een uniforme en visueel krachtige manier de juiste businessinzichten te bieden, die bijdragen aan de best mogelijke beslissingen.

We streven naar structurele en effici√´nte oplossingen met maximale impact op de bedrijfsdoelstellingen. Daarbij ligt de nadruk op het automatiseren van handmatige processen en het ontwikkelen van data-intelligentie die zowel operationeel als strategisch betere sturing mogelijk maakt.

Om dit te realiseren, werken we nauw samen met verschillende teams binnen DPG Media, waaronder het IT Data Area Team, het Data Fundament Team, onze Data Engineers en collega-BI-teams. Binnen deze samenwerkingen staat kennisdeling, innovatie en continue verbetering centraal.

Wat maakt jou de ideale kandidaat?

Voor Deze Rol Zoeken Wij Een Gedreven Data Scientist Met Een Passie Voor Data En Innovatie. Jij Bent Analytisch, Communicatief Sterk En Hebt Een Proactieve Houding. Daarnaast Bezit Jij


Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist / Data Scientist.
Sterke vaardigheden in SQL, Qlik, DBT, Snowflake en/of AWS (is een pre).
Ruime ervaring in het zelfstandig oplossen van complexe data-vraagstukken.
Ervaring met AI/ML-tools zoals SageMaker Studio en Airflow.
Affiniteit met zowel de technische als de business-kant van data.
Bereidheid om ongeveer 1 keer per maand te werken op kantoor in Antwerpen of Vilvoorde.


Bij DPG Media staan we open voor alle talent in de maatschappij. Ongeacht je achtergrond nodigen we je uit om te solliciteren op deze functie. Juist door verschillen tussen collega‚Äôs ontstaan verrassende inzichten en vernieuwende oplossingen. Wil je meer weten over onze inclusieve werkomgeving, klik dan hier!

Wat krijg je van ons?

Bij Ons Krijg Je Een Inspirerende Werkomgeving Die Continu In Beweging Is, Met Collega‚Äôs Die Denken In Mogelijkheden En Jou De Kans Bieden Om Jezelf Dagelijks Te Ontwikkelen. Dit Doen We Onder Andere Door Onze DPG Academy. Verder Krijg Je

üí∞ Een salaris passend bij jouw werkervaring.

üìù Een 36-urige werkweek.

üí∞ 8% vakantiegeld en 4% persoonlijk keuzebudget.

üí∞ Jaarlijkse winstdeling op basis van de prestaties van DPG Media.

üéì Ruimte om je te ontwikkelen, zowel on-the-job als online via onze DPG Academy/DPG Campus.

üéâ Mogelijkheid om je eigen culturele feestdagen af te stemmen!

üè¢ Een geweldig nieuw kantoor in Amsterdam (Mediavaert). Van (spontane) borrels tot teamuitjes en ons legendarische personeelsfeest; hier voel je je meteen thuis!

Nog meer redenen om bij DPG Media te willen werken

Bij DPG Media werken we voor meer dan 90 sterke nieuwsmerken, magazines, televisieprogramma‚Äôs, radiostations en online services zoals Qmusic, NU.nl, Tweakers, Libelle, VTM en meer. We bereiken maandelijks ruim 90% van de Nederlanders en 8 op de 10 Vlamingen. We bieden je een professionele werkomgeving waarin vrijheid enorm belangrijk is. Voel je vrij om bij ons ondernemer, leerling en teamspeler te zijn en vooral om jezelf te zijn. Bij DPG Media is iedereen welkom. Solliciteer, wat je achtergrond ook is.

Solliciteren, en dan?

Heb je direct zin om aan de slag te gaan? Solliciteer dan direct ! Je krijgt binnen 10 werkdagen een reactie op je sollicitatie en te horen of je bij de eerste selectie zit. Meer weten? Neem dan contact op met leonie.lugtenberg@dpgmedia.nl

Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working
Be part of a fast-growing company that helps businesses leverage data analytics for better decision-making.
Collaborate with a highly skilled, dynamic, and supportive team.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning in analytics and consulting.
Competitive salary and benefits package, including training, mentorship, and travel opportunities.



What you will do


Conduct analyses using advanced analytical tools such as Python, R, SQL, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations and interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Looker.
Solve complex problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses, and create actionable recommendations from data and analysis.
Prepare and facilitate workshops and training sessions for clients and team members.
Manage stakeholders and communicate effectively with executives.
Coach and mentor junior team members, fostering their growth and development.



What you‚Äôll bring


3+ years of professional work experience in the analytics domain.
An advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
Ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses, and derive recommendations from data analysis.
Strong technical skills in data analysis, machine learning, and programming. Proficiency in Python, SQL, R, and cloud computing platforms.
Experience with Python data tools (e.g., Jupyter, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Ability to communicate complex statistical and analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent command of the English language.
Experience in consulting is a plus.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you a proactive, focused on accuracy, and an amiable communicator? Once you have identified your area(s) of expertise, you excel in the knowledge of those subjects. Those who know you well would say that you tend to be more book smart than street smart, and that you can become relentless in the pursuit of factual information. Your communication style is reasonably social and full of data. You don‚Äôt like being wrong, and tend to err on the side of caution to avoid failure.




If this resonates with you, then this Data Scientist role is for you




We're seeking a Data Scientist with 3+ years of experience (required) to help us transform data into actionable insights and scalable solutions that drive global impact.




What You'll Do:

Workflow Automation & Optimization: Help build useful automations using Python to make data workflow smoother and more efficient. Work alongside data quality and engineering teams to set meaningful goals, improve processes, and support scalable solutions.
Machine Learning: Design and implement machine learning models that automate core analytical tasks‚Äîsuch as scoring, ranking, or prediction‚Äîusing cloud-based infrastructure and modern AI tools.
Transform Data into Insights: Analyze diverse data sets from multiple sources, interpret the results, and provide insights to guide business decisions.
Stay Ahead of the Curve: Stay ahead of AI trends, by applying techniques like named entity recognition and few-shot learning.
Advanced Data Extraction: Develop models for advanced data processing, including entity linking and dense passage retrieval.




What We‚Äôre Looking For:

Strong Python Programming Expertise: Demonstrated ability to write clean, efficient, and production-ready code. Skilled in building data pipelines, training models, and automating workflows using Python.
Orchestration Skills: Experience with workflow orchestrators such as Apache Airflow (or similar tools), with an understanding of how to design, deploy, and maintain DAGs for managing data and model pipelines.
Analytical Mindset: Your analytical skills are top-notch. Bring curiosity, critical thinking, and a methodical approach to problem-solving. Adept at turning raw or messy data into structured, actionable insights.
Cloud Proficiency: Hands-on experience working with Microsoft Azure, particularly in deploying machine learning models and managing services like Azure Data Factory and Blob Storage. Comfortable working in cloud-native environments and designing scalable solutions.
Communication Pro: You can distill complex concepts into clear, compelling presentations and thrive in collaborative settings.




Compensation & Benefits:

Private Health Insurance.
Office Exchange Option: you will be able to work from our offices in New York or Amsterdam without taking vacations.
Innovative Environment: We foster a culture of innovation where your ideas can become reality.
Growth Opportunities: We support continuous learning and professional development to help you reach new heights in your career.




Location: Netherlands
