Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About Acast

Since 2014, Acast has been building the world‚Äôs most valuable podcast marketplace, creating the technology that connects podcast creators, advertisers, and listeners. Its marketplace spans more than 140,000 podcasts, 3,300 advertisers, and one billion quarterly listens. Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen‚Äîacross any podcast app or listening platform.

About The Role

We are looking for a Software Engineer for the Acast Intelligence team. The ideal candidate would be able to build things like a modern recommendation engine, truly understanding it instead of just piecing it together, probably thanks to a solid background in statistics or related fields. We‚Äôre after someone who can cut through the hype, focus on real value that LLMs and related tech can bring, and always keep their eyes on the prize: driving growth for our company and our marketplace‚Äôs users.

Team‚Äôs scope

The team is focused on recommendation systems and intelligent automation. Our product vision is a set of connected systems that turn deep and broad data into decisions and reduce friction, helping one person achieve as much as five would. We build to enable podcast creators to grow their audience, advertisers to be matched to creators, and internal teams to focus on what matters most instead of getting bogged down in chasing data.

This work has a company-wide impact.

Team composition and tools

The team is small but made up of seasoned engineers. We deploy on AWS, and most of our company‚Äôs code is in TypeScript, including the infrastructure, but some of this particular team‚Äôs code is in Python for the reasons you‚Äôd expect. We collaborate on our projects and keep the work process light. Our PM knows the space in and out. We‚Äôve shipped the first version of a recommendation engine, and there‚Äôs plenty more in the pipeline. There aren‚Äôt many established best practices or ready answers in this field, so the work is a lot about experimentation and learning.

Experience we‚Äôre looking for


Background and interest in some of the following: statistics, machine learning, LLMs, recommendation systems, RAG systems (experience with their evaluation is a plus)
Proficiency in Python, familiarity with TypeScript (or the other way around)
Familiarity with vector databases
A habit of staying up to date in a seriously evolving field
Experience with or interest in learning AWS
Experience building software that‚Äôs actually delightful for the users
A pragmatic mindset for making sensible trade-offs
Interest in podcasts is really optional, but if you have it, this job will be so much more fun


Logistics

We are remote-first but prefer to have teams in similar timezones; for this team, this means an overlap of at least 4 hours with CET (UTC+1).


For this role we‚Äôre hiring within Sweden or UK, and therefore applicants will need to have the right to work in one of these locations.


Culture

Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.

Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We‚Äôre global and have remote teams, so it‚Äôs even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome.

We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.

We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!

Title: AI Developer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


Python (including packaging), (Rust), js, vibe coding, front-end solutions
Kubernetes, Docker, Containerization, REST API
MLFlow, Airflow, Windmill
Hopsworks, Palantir Foundry
Pytorch, pandas, scikit-learn, tensorflow
GMM, HMM, LSTM, Transformers, CNN, RNN
Excellent collaboration skills
Excellent customer presentation skills
Experienced in devops


Application deadline: 16-09-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company‚Äîand we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that‚Äôs just the beginning. With us, you‚Äôll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig f√∂ljande, Valet √§r ditt!

üöÄ Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

üåü A secure monthly salary ‚Äì together we‚Äôll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

üöó Company car ‚Äì we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

üíº Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

üå¥ Vacation ‚Äì Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

üè• Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

üìö Skills development ‚Äì you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

üïë Quality of life ‚Äì Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Mynt

Mynt is an all-in-one corporate card and spend management solution, on a mission to fundamentally change business banking forever. Our digital software, coupled with corporate cards and payments infrastructure, eradicates manual administrative tasks relating to spending for businesses. Mynt is experiencing huge growth in the Nordic markets, serving over 16,000 business customers. We have recently secured substantial funding to support our continued expansion in Sweden and internationally.




Mynt is a tech-first company with a product oriented mindset, empowering teams to be their best in ideating and creating innovative solutions to complex problems. In 2021, Mynt obtained financial license as an E-money institution, card issuer, and payment processor from the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority.




Since 2022, we‚Äôve launched several strategic partnerships, starting with Fortnox where we integrated corporate cards directly into their platform. In early 2023, we announced a similar partnership with Accountor Group in Finland. Since then, additional integrations have gone live ‚Äî including Kleer and Wint. Additional partnerships are in progress and under development.




Joining Mynt means contributing to creating an exceptional product and company. We seek passionate individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing customer value. With around 70 employees (and growing fast), we plan to further expand our team to support our growth.




About the Role

Mynt is now looking for a top performer with a strong drive and creative goal-oriented mindset to work with business data analytics. You will be expected to work closely with the CPO and leadership team to analyze and visualize a multitude of data, building on our existing ETL and analytics pipeline.




You need to have a strong interest in working in a dynamic and ambitious startup environment and have strong analytical and technical skills. You should have solid experience of data analytics.




What you‚Äôll be diving into:

Work extensively with our internal customer and marketing data to deliver sharp and actionable insight to several functions at Mynt
Work closely with senior leaders in business areas to understand the mechanics of each area
Pro-actively develop business hypotheses and be prepared to test these with data
Develop machine learning models for predictive analyses




What you bring to the table:

Experience in SQL and python or similar languages
Bachelor's or Master's degree
Fluent in Swedish and English




What we can offer you:

Be part of an amazing team in a fast-growing scale-up.
Work closely with a fun, high-performing team.
Enjoy a flexible working environment with a great office location in central Stockholm.
Shape your own development and responsibilities based on your passion and interest.

The position will be filled as soon as we find a suitable candidate. Please reach out to us as soon as possible if you believe this for you!

Since 2022, we‚Äôve launched several strategic partnerships, starting with Fortnox where we integrated corporate cards directly into their platform. In early 2023, we announced a similar partnership with Accountor Group in Finland. Since then, additional integrations have gone live ‚Äî including Kleer and Wint. Additional partnerships are in progress and under development.


Joining Mynt means contributing to creating an exceptional product and company. We seek passionate individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing customer value. With around 70 employees (and growing fast), we plan to further expand our team to support our growth.


About the Role

Mynt is now looking for a top performer with a strong drive and creative goal-oriented mindset to work with business data analytics. You will be expected to work closely with the CPO and leadership team to analyze and visualize a multitude of data, building on our existing ETL and analytics pipeline.


You need to have a strong interest in working in a dynamic and ambitious startup environment and have strong analytical and technical skills. You should have solid experience of data analytics.


What you‚Äôll be diving into:

  • Work extensively with our internal customer and marketing data to deliver sharp and actionable insight to several functions at Mynt
  • Work closely with senior leaders in business areas to understand the mechanics of each area
  • Pro-actively develop business hypotheses and be prepared to test these with data
  • Develop machine learning models for predictive analyses


What you bring to the table:

  • Experience in SQL and python or similar languages
  • Bachelor's or Master's degree
  • Fluent in Swedish and English


What we can offer you:

  • Be part of an amazing team in a fast-growing scale-up.
  • Work closely with a fun, high-performing team.
  • Enjoy a flexible working environment with a great office location in central Stockholm.
  • Shape your own development and responsibilities based on your passion and interest.

The position will be filled as soon as we find a suitable candidate. Please reach out to us as soon as possible if you believe this for you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a driven and skilled Data Scientist to design, deploy, and optimize ML models that drive automation and impact key areas like credit risk and fraud detection. Join us to shape the future of ML at Froda!

About Froda

Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear mission ‚Äì to democratize the access to financing and provide small businesses the same opportunities to grow as large ones. Through digital processes and technological innovation, we have shortened the loan process from months to minutes, making it easy and affordable for business owners to invest in their ideas. Our objective approach champions diversity, ensures fair terms, and ultimately enables more small businesses to make a positive impact on society.

Join our team and contribute to giving small businesses the opportunity to invest in their ideas to the best possible terms.

Your Impact

Design, build, and deploy machine learning models to drive automation and efficiency across areas like credit risk, fraud detection, AML, customer service, and business analytics. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build scalable, robust solutions that support Froda‚Äôs strategic goals of scalability, standardization, and reliability.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with product, engineering, and analytics teams to deliver scalable and impactful AI and ML solutions.
Design, build, and deploy ML models and pipelines for critical business areas.
Implement and optimize ML-Ops workflows (data processing, model training, deployment, and monitoring).


What You'll Bring


Experience of working as a Data Scientist or ML Engineer in tech, fintech, or a similar product-driven company.
Hands-on experience with production ML pipelines, ML-Ops frameworks, and cloud platforms (e.g., KubeFlow, Azure).
Proven skills in Python, SQL, and ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT APIs, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG).
Knowledge of credit risk, fraud detection, or AML is a clear plus.


Who You Are


Results-driven problem solver with a passion for impact through data and AI and that thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Collaborative team player, contributing to innovation and knowledge-sharing in the team and across the business.
Strong communicator, able to break down complex ideas into clear insights.


What‚Äôs in it for you?

Working at Froda means working at a company that combines the best of both worlds ‚Äì fun and fast-paced culture, yet stable and structured. We are 90+ ambitious self-starters who genuinely care for each other and the work we do, while having fun together. You will have the ability to impact your own work and that the only thing standing between you and your goals is going to be your own ambitions.

Furthermore, you‚Äôll get:


Fabulous office overlooking Stockholm and a friendly culture that values work/life balance
We prioritize working in the office to maximize the positive impact of in-person collaboration, but we offer flexibility with work hours and remote work
Competitive compensation package
Insurance and pension plan


Be part of a growing team where your work directly impacts the company‚Äôs success. Join us in driving meaningful change through AI and machine learning.

Please note that due to summer vacations, our response time may be delayed.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)

GCP requirements:


Familiar with BigQuery, can code SQL
Familiar with Cloud composer / airflow
Familiar with IAM, service account
Familiar with Data catalog
Understand Infrastructure as Code
Good to have knowledge with Dataflow, K8s, Vertex AI pipeline, Kubeflow pipeline


Cloud agnostic skills:


Python:
Deep knowledge about python programing, practice OOP, following coding best practice, know how to use flake8, mypy, black, SonarQube and pre-commit
Deep knowledge in unit test and end to end test, familiar with Pytest, fixtures, unittest etc
Unix:
Familiar with popular Unix system, know how to install sth in docker.
Familiar with shell
Git:
Know how to create PR and solve merge conflict.
Can create CI/CD pipeline in Github Actions using best practice
Docker
Deep understanding with Docker
DBT
Deep Knowledge in DBT, preferably with GCP
SQL
Deep knowledge of SQL
Deep understanding with Data modeling, system design


Application deadline: 31-08-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company‚Äîand we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that‚Äôs just the beginning. With us, you‚Äôll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig f√∂ljande, Valet √§r ditt!

We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)

GCP requirements:

  • Familiar with BigQuery, can code SQL
  • Familiar with Cloud composer / airflow
  • Familiar with IAM, service account
  • Familiar with Data catalog
  • Understand Infrastructure as Code
  • Good to have knowledge with Dataflow, K8s, Vertex AI pipeline, Kubeflow pipeline

Cloud agnostic skills:

  • Python:
  • Deep knowledge about python programing, practice OOP, following coding best practice, know how to use flake8, mypy, black, SonarQube and pre-commit
  • Deep knowledge in unit test and end to end test, familiar with Pytest, fixtures, unittest etc
  • Unix:
  • Familiar with popular Unix system, know how to install sth in docker.
  • Familiar with shell
  • Git:
  • Know how to create PR and solve merge conflict.
  • Can create CI/CD pipeline in Github Actions using best practice
  • Docker
  • Deep understanding with Docker
  • DBT
  • Deep Knowledge in DBT, preferably with GCP
  • SQL
  • Deep knowledge of SQL
  • Deep understanding with Data modeling, system design

Application deadline: 31-08-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company‚Äîand we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that‚Äôs just the beginning. With us, you‚Äôll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
More independence, freedom, and better pay

Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.

It's not rocket science.

Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.

The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.

Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.

Why Coody

At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?

Maximized Compensation - Typically a +40% salary increase.

Freedom & Flexibility - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.

Employment Security - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.

Shaping the Future - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.

This is Coody

We‚Äôre a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.

Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.

Explore our Employee Handbook and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.

What you‚Äôll be doing

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Coody, you‚Äôll dive into exciting and challenging AI projects to build and optimize machine learning models for production use cases, ensuring they are highly efficient and scalable. You‚Äôll also design and build machine learning infrastructure, often in cloud environments, to support large-scale deployments for our customers. Here‚Äôs what your day-to-day will look like:


Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning products
Build and maintain infrastructure and tooling as a platform for data scientists
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems
Monitor and maintain the performance and reliability of ML models post-deployment
Stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies
Collaborate with clients, support colleagues, contribute to knowledge sharing


Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for Machine Learning Engineers with at least 3-4 years of experience and a proven track record of delivering real results. If you‚Äôve got the following, you‚Äôre probably a great fit:


A track-record of delivering machine learning models in production
Cloud experience (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud, Kubernetes)
Experience with distributed data tools (e.g., Spark, Dask, PySpark, Apache Beam)
Expertise in Python and modern ML/AI libraries (PyTorch/TensorFlow, Transformers, LangChain, LangGraph, Vertex AI)
Strong understanding of ML infrastructure: deployment, monitoring, debugging, optimization
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or something related
Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
Fluent in English (spoken and written)


How to apply

Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
At Vattenfall, we don‚Äôt just ‚Äúdo energy‚Äù, we exist to help our customers power their lives in ever climate smarter ways and enable a fossil free future. If you are looking for interesting challenges and the opportunity to be part of this change, then join our diverse and talented team and make a difference!

At Business Area Markets, business decisions are made around the clock with high frequency, creating vast potential for intelligent automation.

As our new Data Scientist in the Data Science team, you will join a collaborative and skilled team that drives automation of real business cases through data-driven and Machine Learning-based intelligence. We work in a Scrum setup and have in the past years been very successful in forecasting both electricity prices and electricity consumption. Your work will have direct and measurable impact!

We offer a strong work-life balance in an organisation known for its deep competence in math, tech, and business - where innovation and improvements often stem from our specialists and business experts

What You Will Do

Join a team where your models don‚Äôt just sit in notebooks - They power real-time decisions in the energy markets.


Machine Learning: Build and operate machine learning models that forecast prices, optimize trading strategies, and drive smarter decisions in volatile energy markets.
Automation: Enable intelligent automation of trading and asset optimization by embedding ML into operational systems.
Analytics: Combine business understanding with analytical and technical skills to understand and solve real-world challenges.
Collaboration: Work closely with team members, stakeholders and domain experts to ensure models are aligned with business needs and continuously improved.
Data & Infrastructure: Ensure data is ML-ready and leverage tools like Databricks, Kafka, and Azure ML to support robust model operation.


F√∂retagsbeskrivning

Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 21 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people‚Äôs homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We now want to enable the fossil freedom that drives society forward. To be able to reach this ambitious goal we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.‚ÄØ

Within Vattenfall, Business Area (BA) Markets optimizes assets and effectively sources and trades commodities, thus ensuring best value for both Vattenfall and our customers. BA Markets is active across Europe with around 450 professionals working from Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, and the UK.

In BA Markets the‚ÄØmission of the Unit OU Operations is to drive the digital transformation. OU Operations consists of diverse and highly skilled employees from more than 20 countries. We work internationally from our locations in Stockholm, Hamburg, and Amsterdam.

Kvalifikationer

What We Are Looking For

We are after a curious mind who wants to make an impact ‚Äì Someone who is excited to build end-to-end data science solutions that truly make a difference.


A strong interest in learning about the‚ÄØenergy markets‚ÄØand how Machine Learning can be used solve the real-world problems we face.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative spirit.
Python‚ÄØexpertise paired with an interest in attaining a software-developer-mindset where you care about good code and stable operation of models.
Experience building Machine Learning models - ideally forecasting of time series.
Experience, or eager to learn how to bring Machine Learning Models into real world production.
An academic degree in‚ÄØData Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar.
Fluency in‚ÄØEnglish; Swedish is a bonus.


Ytterligare information

We Offer


A welcoming work climate with flat hierarchies, appreciation for own initiative, open discussion culture and zero-tolerance for harassment.
An International and multi-cultural work environment with energetic colleagues
Being part of the wider Analysis community, where we eagerly share knowledge and ideas regarding a wide range analytical topics relevant to the energy market
Opportunities and support for professional growth. For example, the encouragement to do internal rotations to other teams and to visit conferences and trainings
Flexible working hours, an annual 72 hours reduction of working time and free access to gym and training classes in our Stockholm office and top that off, with the opportunity to work 50% from home.‚ÄØ


At Vattenfall we are convinced that striving for diversity helps to build a more profitable, efficient, and attractive company. Therefore we seek a harmonious balance of employees in terms of age, religion, gender identity & expression, sexual identity, disability and ethnic background. Read more on how we work with diversity and inclusion here: https://careers.vattenfall.com/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion/

Location: Stockholm/Solna

For more information about the position you are welcome to contact recruiting manager Erik Svensson, erik.svensson@vattenfall.com For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Peter Blixter, +46 722 37 32 02.

Trade union representatives Trade union representatives: Simon Salomonsson (Unionen) and Sven Gunnar Gremlin (Akademikerna). To get in contact with the representatives, please call Vattenfall switchboard +46 8 739 50 00.

We welcome your application no later than 8 September 2025, including CV along with a short motivation (max 100 words) explaining why you are interested in this position.

Since Vattenfall is part of the Swedish critical infrastructure many of our positions are security classed. If this position is security classed the final candidates can be subject to a security vetting process, according to the Swedish legislation.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Gilion:

Our mission is clear: We are accelerating founders in their growth journey through our Gilion platform. As a growing product company leveraging AI, we are creating an innovative, technically challenging platform revolutionizing how businesses grow - with the key of the platform being analytics, unique AI forecasting, ultimately enabling access to financing and non-dillutive funding, - in a way never done before. Watch our platform here: gilion.com/platform

Our team is made up of experts who have been part of leading companies like Spotify, Google, King, Sinch, bringing a wealth of experience and a passion for pushing boundaries. At Gilion, you‚Äôll be part of a fast-moving, dynamic environment where your work will have a tangible impact on both our product and the industry as a whole. If you‚Äôre excited about working with challenging technology and making a real difference, Gilion is the place for you.

About the role:

You‚Äôll join our data team to build the backbone that powers Gilion‚Äôs AI-driven financial analysis. Your mission: make customer data analysis-ready and accessible to AI agents in a scalable, automated way. This means building services, data models, and integrations.


Design, build, and maintain backend services that process and serve customer data for AI agent analysis.
Define and implement semantic layers and metrics (e.g., lifetime value) to standardize analysis across customers.
Collaborate with AI orchestration systems to ensure agents have the right tools (MCPs) and data for their tasks.
Continuously refine automated analysis workflows to improve accuracy, scalability, and robustness.
Work closely with product and engineering teams to expand data capabilities and handle new data types or sources.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines and services.


Background/Profile:


Experience in analytics engineering or data engineering roles.
Backend development skills (Python or similar), with ability to build services and APIs.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with data modeling and data warehouses.
Understanding of data quality principles and automated data validation.
Interest in or exposure to AI-driven data analysis - comfortable working in an environment where AI agents consume your data pipelines.


What we offer:


Work-life balance, hybrid-remote model
Diverse, inclusive and knowledge-sharing culture
Experienced founders, backed by top investors
A growth journey with tons of development opportunities
AI product that impacts how companies grow, disrupting the industry

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

We‚Äôre looking for a talented Data Scientist‚ÄØto join our dynamic team and help drive value for our clients. You‚Äôll work with data from various digital channels (online, email, commerce), analyzing and modelling this data to optimize customer experiences and enhance digital performance. You‚Äôre passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you‚Äôll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You‚Äôre always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

As part of a small, supportive team, you‚Äôll collaborate on various tasks and occasionally assist with dashboard building. While you bring valuable experience, we support your continuous growth and development in the ever-evolving fields of data science and digital marketing.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyse datasets to generate actionable insights and optimize digital channels
Conduct marketing mix modelling projects together with a team of data scientists
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Stay updated on the latest data science and digital marketing trends



Qualifications:


1-3 years Experience as a Data Scientist
Understanding of digital marketing data (online, email, commerce)
Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Fluent in Swedish and English and living in Sweden



What would make you really stand-out:


Documented experience in conducting MMMs (marketing mix modelling) projects
Hands-on experience with AI and machine learning
Experience with digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.



What We Offer:


An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
A challenging role in a fast-growing market
Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
Competitive salary and great benefits
Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
Collective agreements
30 days holiday entitlement



About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence.‚ÄØOur vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centered transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings.‚ÄØ

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, SeniorTalent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Machine Learning Engineer Intern
Description:
Skills

As a Machine Learning Engineer Intern, you will play a key role in designing and building machine learning models for our edge ML product. You will tackle challenges that let you apply your skills across software engineering, data science, computer vision and machine learning. By joining our team, you‚Äôll help enhance the reliability and safety of our vehicles, directly contributing to their performance on the road. This is an opportunity to join the team during 6 months in a part-time internship. To put it into specifics you will:


Build a cutting-edge machine learning product and see your model deployed on Voi vehicles worldwide.
Build a machine learning product end-to-end, from dataset creation, PoC model development, edge ML optimisation, to model deployment and business impact measurement.
Support production-grade models with a focus on reliability and scalability, and high performance.
Collaborate with a world-class, cross-functional product team, learning from and supporting each other while aligning on priorities and business outcomes.


What You Need To Embark

We are looking for an ambitious and curious student looking to build a career in Machine Learning. In addition to being collaborative and fluent in English we believe the right person has:


1 year or less remaining on a Masters degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Robotics, or related field
Strong programming skills in Python and experience using Git
Knowledge in common machine learning techniques such as convolutional neural networks, transfer learning, object detection, has been applying models in frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or scikit-learn
Experience with edge computing or embedded coding is a plus.


WHY VOI?

Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You‚Äôll Have The Opportunity To


Join Europes #1 micromobility company
Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Title: Data Scientist - Sweden Operations
Description:
Shape the Future of Data Science in Life-Saving Medicine Production at AstraZeneca!

Are you passionate about leveraging AI, machine learning, and advanced analytics to drive innovation and impact in healthcare? At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being ambitious, thinking big, and working together to make the impossible a reality. Join us as we harness the power of science and technology to truly change the course of medicine and bring bold new ideas to life.

As a Data Scientist within Sweden Operations in S√∂dert√§lje, you will play a pivotal role in transforming our operations through cutting-edge analytics and advanced data science solutions. You will join a highly collaborative and cross-disciplinary environment, working alongside expert teams across the company to fuel fact-based decision-making and empower process optimization throughout our value chain.

What You'll Do

The Data, Analytics & AI team is integral to the Strategy & Performance function in Sweden Operations. You will work side by side with other data scientists, analysts, and technology experts, delivering insights and developing innovative data-driven solutions that optimize business processes and support strategic projects. Our analytics initiatives span Inbound, Manufacturing, Quality, Outbound, and critical support functions such as Maintenance, Supply, and Production Planning.


In this role, you will: Coordinate the implementation of innovative modelling solutions, integrating complex data from multiple sources and modalities to generate actionable insights.
Translate unstructured business challenges into analytically tractable problems, applying state-of-the-art machine learning and statistical models.
Develop and deploy predictive models and computational methods that guide decision-making and operational improvements.
Act as a subject-matter expert by providing training and advisory services, and ensuring best practices in data science and analytics across Sweden Operations.
Communicate data-driven insights clearly and objectively, influencing partners and shaping impactful solutions.
Maintain robust, production-grade data science workflows, ensuring compliance, quality, and sustained business value.
Leverage generative AI, large language models, and advanced ML to automate processes, enhance data insights, and solve complex business problems.


What We're Looking For


Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent experience) in operations research, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or a related quantitative field
Proven experience with Python and advanced machine learning methods, including supervised and unsupervised learning, neural networks, generative AI such as large language models, and computer vision models
Demonstrated proficiency across the full data science workflow
Strong skills in manipulating and analyzing high-dimensional datasets, drawing actionable conclusions, and communicating technical results or requirements to business stakeholders in business-friendly language
Hands-on experience with SQL databases
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage effectively with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders
Fluency in English, both spoken and written


Desirable Experience


Experience with AWS cloud platform & Snowflake
Familiarity with software development tools, including Git, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, and agile methodologies
Experience working in multinational or digitally mature organizations
Proficiency in Power BI, Dash, Tableau
Swedish language skills


Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to truly make an impact, contributing to the production of life-saving medicines while developing your career in a forward-thinking, global organization. We offer an extraordinary international working environment with excellent opportunities for collaboration, innovation, and professional growth. Diversity and inclusion are at our core, ensuring everyone can thrive.

What‚Äôs Next?

Are you ready to help lead the digital transformation of medicine production? Apply now, submit your CV and cover letter no later than August 27th 2025.

By the way: If you have publicly available repositories or a portfolio showcasing data science or analytics projects (deep learning, ensemble methods, AI, optimization, etc.), include a link with your application.

Join us, and together we‚Äôll turn big data into bold ideas that change patients‚Äô lives.

Title: Data Scientist, Commercial Excellence - Denmark, Sweden, Netherlands, Finland, Germany or UK
Description:
Location

Viby J, DK Solna, SE Soederkulla, FI Leeds, GB Utrecht, NL Duesseldorf, DE

At Arla Foods, we are committed to creating the future of dairy through innovation, sustainability, and collaboration. As a farmer-owned cooperative and one of the world‚Äôs leading dairy companies, we produce household-favourite brands while striving to make a positive impact on people and the planet.

We are now looking for a data-driven, curious, and growth-minded Data Scientist to join our Commercial Excellence Team. If you are passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights and want to make a real business impact, this is your opportunity.

How You Will Make An Impact

As a Data Scientist in the NRM Centre of Excellence organisation, you will play a key role in supporting Arla‚Äôs growth and profitability ambitions across our European markets. This is a hands-on, operational role where you will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyse commercial data, develop advanced analytics tools, and translate insights into strategic decisions.

You will be the go-to expert for understanding our data landscape - identifying opportunities, addressing challenges, and helping shape the future of data science at Arla within the commercial space. Your key responsibilities will be to


Translate business objectives into data science problems and develop solutions that drive commercial value
Design, optimise, and deploy advanced analytics models to support NRM strategies
Continuously improve existing models and develop new ones to meet evolving business needs
Visualise insights using tools like Power BI and communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear, compelling way
Conduct exploratory data analysis, test hypotheses, and uncover trends and patterns
Ensure high-quality code, documentation, and scalable, stable solutions


What Will Make You Successful

We are looking for a Data Scientist who is not only technically skilled but also driven by curiosity and a passion for creating value. You are proactive and thrive on identifying opportunities for improvement, always ready to share new ideas and perspectives on how data can be leveraged to drive the business forward. Besides this, we imagine that you bring


A University degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, econometrics, mathematics, or data science
2-5 years of hands-on experience, where you have applied advanced analytics to real-world business problems
An analytical mindset with the ability to synthesize data from multiple sources
Proficiency in Python and/or R, and SQL
Experience working with large, complex datasets (e.g., Nielsen, SAP, retailer ePOS)
Strong understanding of relational databases (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server)
Advanced Excel skills and strong data visualization capabilities (PowerBI or similar)
Preferably experience with Databricks


What do we offer?

We are committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. You will join a market leader who produces nutritious household-favorite brands in a way that make things better for our customers, the farmers who own us, and the whole world.

Application and contact

Please apply as soon as possible as we process applications on an ongoing basis. If you have any specific questions about the role, please reach out to Harri H√§rk√∂nen, ‚ÄéHead of Commercial Digital Transformation, at +358 40 5534945.

Shape the Future of Dairy

Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to producing high-quality products while championing sustainability and innovation. We're passionate about people and our planet, striving to unleash the full potential in each of us. Our goal is to make healthy dairy nutrition and good food habits accessible to all. Join us at Arla Foods and become part of a worldwide cooperative dedicated to making a significant impact on the planet and steering the dairy industry towards a sustainable future.

We are devoted to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Diversity and collaboration are key to our success, propelling us to new heights in the dairy industry.

Title: AI Developer for R&D Team
Description:
Mindset & Approach

We are looking for a solution-oriented AI Developer who can take full ownership of bringing models from concept to MVP stage. The role requires someone who thrives in teamwork, quickly understands challenges, and can prioritize what creates the most value. You will be expected to contribute with smart, efficient solutions that drive the project forward as fast as possible. Since resources are limited, focusing on high-impact results is essential.

You should have strong programming expertise and a proven track record of delivering working solutions in large-scale projects.

Skills & Experience


Excellent knowledge of Python (including packaging), and ideally also Rust and JavaScript
Experience in UI/UX and frontend solutions
Proficiency with Kubernetes, Docker, containerization, and REST APIs
Familiarity with MLFlow, Airflow, and Windmill
Experience with platforms such as Hopsworks and Palantir Foundry
Strong background in PyTorch, pandas, scikit-learn, and TensorFlow
Understanding of models such as GMM, HMM, LSTM, Transformers, CNN, and RNN
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, including presenting results to stakeholders
Experience in DevOps practices


About Rasulson Consulting

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you‚Äôll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
At Rillion, we're looking for a hands-on Machine Learning Engineer to join our AI product team. You'll help us improve and expand the machine learning components that power our Accounts Payable (AP) automation. From idea to deployment, you'll work closely with others across the company to bring smart, ML-driven features into our product. If you enjoy solving real problems with data and want to be part of a collaborative, fast-moving team, we‚Äôd love to have you on board!




Responsibilities:

You‚Äôll play a key role in building and integrating custom Machine Learning functionalities into our SaaS products, with a focus on developing our ML platform and creating data-driven solutions tailored to our needs:

Develop and scale our machine learning platform using Databricks.
Design and implement custom ML models tailored to real-world AP automation challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify user needs and integrate ML solutions seamlessly into our SaaS platform.
Stay informed on the latest ML advancements and contribute to shaping our ML strategy and solution design.




What You'll Bring:

Proven experience delivering ML solutions in SaaS or digital product environments.
Solid experience with ML / Data frameworks such as PyTorch, PySpark or similar.
Hands-on experience in production ML pipelines, including batch and real-time inference.
Experience working with both generic and customer tailored models.
A problem-solving mindset with a collaborative, proactive approach, and a curiosity to explore new solutions while staying up to date.
M.Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.




Bonus skills:

Experience working with Databricks in a production environment.
Experience with software development and microservices.




What we offer:

Opportunity to work in a dynamic growth company.
Join a collaborative and supportive product team that will be responsible for the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to production.
Talented colleagues ready to support the success in your career path.
Social events with your colleagues (breakfast, candy-time, afterwork etc.)
A collection of different benefits, including a generous pension and insurance package.
Hybrid working model, 2 days per week in the office.
Come and enjoy our beautiful office in central Stockholm (on the 14th floor, with amazing views).




The recruitment process:

We review applications and invite for interviews continuously. A background check will be conducted on final candidates, pre-employment. If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact recruiter Victoria Stjernstr√∂m at victoria.stjernstrom@rillion.com




About Rillion:

We are a global company founded in Sweden with 30 years‚Äô experience in the AP Automation industry. We help finance professionals transform how they manage invoices by digitalizing and automating the entire process.

By removing the manual steps of invoice handling, we enable finance teams to save time and effort, reducing the possibility of human error. Because we‚Äôre AP professionals ourselves, we understand how to give our customers everything they need, and nothing they don‚Äôt.

Together with our owners at Altor, we¬¥re on a journey to expand in our home markets, while entering new territories. To complete our mission, we need more talented people!

Rillion is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We‚Äôre looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we‚Äôre searching for a Data Scientist in our Stockholm office ‚Äì‚ÄØare you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?‚ÄØ

The Role‚ÄØ

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist who‚Äôs passionate about using data to shape how millions of people experience entertainment. At Viaplay, our data science team works at the heart of personalization, customer engagement, and product innovation.

In this role, you‚Äôll help design and evaluate models, uncover insights, and collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and content teams to bring ideas to life. From improving recommendations to understanding user behavior, your work will directly impact how our audiences connect with Viaplay.

This is a great opportunity if you enjoy problem-solving, experimentation, and storytelling with data and want to grow your skills in a supportive, collaborative environment.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Design, train, and deploy machine learning and statistical models for recommendations, predictions, and classifications
Translate business questions into data-driven problems and deliver clear, actionable insights
Collaborate with product, engineering, content, commercial, and marketing teams to shape data-informed decisions
Analyze large datasets to understand user behavior, content performance, and platform trends
Work with engineers to bring models into production and monitor their performance
Share knowledge, learn from others, and contribute to a culture of curiosity and experimentation


What We‚Äôre Looking For‚ÄØ

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that‚Äôs why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you‚Äôll have at least some experience in the following:‚ÄØ


3+ years of hands-on experience in applied Data Science or Machine Learning
Experience running projects end-to-end: framing problems, prototyping models, and analyzing performance
Proficiency in Python and SQL, experience with data transformation using Spark
Strong analytical and statistical skills, with experience designing experiments or A/B tests
Knowledge of data pipeline tools such as Airflow or similar
Clear communication skills, able to translate complex results into simple, actionable insights
A background in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or another quantitative field (or equivalent practical experience)


It‚Äôs a bonus if you have:‚ÄØ


Experience with recommender systems, personalization, or content optimization
Familiarity with causal inference methods
Understanding of MLOps practices and collaboration with ML Engineers
Experience in media, streaming, or e-commerce


What we offer you


We‚Äôve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with three days a week in the office and the rest remote, giving you the best of collaboration and focus time.
A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver‚Äôs seat of your own development.
An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product ‚Äì‚ÄØincluding serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.‚ÄØ


Hit play today‚ÄØ

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here ‚Äì‚ÄØyou may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don‚Äôt send us your application via email because we won‚Äôt be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.‚ÄØ

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We‚Äôre only ever a few clicks away.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

HTML:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We‚Äôre looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we‚Äôre searching for a Data Scientist in our Stockholm office ‚Äì‚ÄØare you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?‚ÄØ

The Role‚ÄØ

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist who‚Äôs passionate about using data to shape how millions of people experience entertainment. At Viaplay, our data science team works at the heart of personalization, customer engagement, and product innovation.

In this role, you‚Äôll help design and evaluate models, uncover insights, and collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and content teams to bring ideas to life. From improving recommendations to understanding user behavior, your work will directly impact how our audiences connect with Viaplay.

This is a great opportunity if you enjoy problem-solving, experimentation, and storytelling with data and want to grow your skills in a supportive, collaborative environment.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Design, train, and deploy machine learning and statistical models for recommendations, predictions, and classifications
  • Translate business questions into data-driven problems and deliver clear, actionable insights
  • Collaborate with product, engineering, content, commercial, and marketing teams to shape data-informed decisions
  • Analyze large datasets to understand user behavior, content performance, and platform trends
  • Work with engineers to bring models into production and monitor their performance
  • Share knowledge, learn from others, and contribute to a culture of curiosity and experimentation

What We‚Äôre Looking For‚ÄØ

We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that‚Äôs why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you‚Äôll have at least some experience in the following:‚ÄØ

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience in applied Data Science or Machine Learning
  • Experience running projects end-to-end: framing problems, prototyping models, and analyzing performance
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL, experience with data transformation using Spark
  • Strong analytical and statistical skills, with experience designing experiments or A/B tests
  • Knowledge of data pipeline tools such as Airflow or similar
  • Clear communication skills, able to translate complex results into simple, actionable insights
  • A background in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or another quantitative field (or equivalent practical experience)

It‚Äôs a bonus if you have:‚ÄØ

  • Experience with recommender systems, personalization, or content optimization
  • Familiarity with causal inference methods
  • Understanding of MLOps practices and collaboration with ML Engineers
  • Experience in media, streaming, or e-commerce

What we offer you

  • We‚Äôve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
  • Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
  • Flexibility that works. We follow a hybrid model with three days a week in the office and the rest remote, giving you the best of collaboration and focus time.
  • A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver‚Äôs seat of your own development.
  • An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
  • Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product ‚Äì‚ÄØincluding serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.‚ÄØ

Hit play today‚ÄØ

If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here ‚Äì‚ÄØyou may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don‚Äôt send us your application via email because we won‚Äôt be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.‚ÄØ

Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We‚Äôre only ever a few clicks away.‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
üöÄ Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer ‚Äì Stockholm (Hybrid)




Be the First. Build the Future.




Our client - a fast-growing SaaS innovator used by global enterprises - is launching a brand-new AI initiative. They‚Äôre looking for a Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer to be the founding member of this team and lead the charge in embedding cutting-edge AI into their product suite.




üß† What You‚Äôll Do

As the first dedicated AI engineer, you‚Äôll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of AI within the company. This is a hands-on, high-impact role where you‚Äôll:




Architect and build AI-powered features and infrastructure from the ground up.
Design and implement GenAI tools and agentic workflows - think chatbots, LLMs, RAG pipelines, and more.
Collaborate closely with product and engineering leadership to define the AI roadmap and long-term vision.
Prototype and productionise AI features that enhance user experience and drive product innovation.
Evaluate and integrate technologies like AWS Bedrock and other GenAI platforms to accelerate development.
Influence architectural decisions in a microservices-based environment, ensuring scalability and performance.
Mentor and guide future hires as the AI team grows around you.




üõ†Ô∏è What You Bring

This isn‚Äôt a role for a pure data scientist or MLOps specialist. We‚Äôre looking for a well-rounded software engineer with a passion for AI and a track record of building real-world products. You‚Äôll need:




A strong background in software engineering - beneficial if this is full-stack exp.
Experience building and integrating GenAI solutions into production environments.
Proficiency in Node.js/TypeScript, with additional experience in Python, Go, or PHP.
Familiarity with AWS (especially Bedrock); GCP experience is also welcome.
Solid understanding of LLMs, RAG, and agentic AI workflows.
Experience working in microservice architectures.
A proactive, collaborative mindset and the ability to thrive in a fast-moving, startup-style environment.




üåç Why Join?

Greenfield opportunity: Be the first hire in a brand-new AI team with huge growth potential.
Impact: Your work will directly shape the future of the product and the company‚Äôs AI capabilities.
Flexibility: Hybrid working model in Stockholm - on-site a few days a week for collaboration.
Compensation: Competitive salary.
Benefits: 30 days‚Äô holiday, wellness and home office allowances, ITP1 pension, and more.
Culture: A supportive, people-first environment with a flat structure and strong engineering culture.




This is a rare opportunity to join a company at the start of its AI journey and make a lasting impact. If you're excited by the idea of building something from scratch and leading the way in GenAI innovation - this is your moment.




Apply now and help our client shape the future of AI.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer to Apotea
Description:
We at fika ai are helping Apotea hire a Machine Learning Engineer!




Why apply to Apotea via fika ai?

Take our 20-minute AI interview to stand out. Instead of just a CV, you‚Äôll show who you really are - how you reason, communicate, and solve problems. It's the best way to stand out in a sea of CVs. Your video interview will be shared with the hiring team at Apotea!




AI + Apotea =¬†<heart/>




Apotea is Sweden‚Äôs leading online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare accessible and efficient for everyone. Our Data and AI team is at the heart of innovation, building AI and ML applications that enhance customer experience, streamline operations, and create a foundation for future innovations.¬†We are seeking passionate and driven individuals¬†who are¬†eager to make a significant impact and be part of a small technical team.¬†By following industry best practices, we develop end to end AI applications on top of modern data and AI architectures, making sure our AI products don't¬†end up just being a POC and drive sustainable value in production.¬†The AI organization sits right under CEO P√§r Sv√§rdson, ensuring that your work has high visibility and significant influence.




Your role as a¬†Machine Learning Engineer at Apotea:

Build, deploy, and own end-to-end ML systems¬†‚Äì from prototyping to maintaining production models, ensuring scalability, reliability, and alignment with team strategy.
Turn models into real-world solutions¬†‚Äì integrate ML into products that deliver measurable business value.
Apply MLOps and¬†DevOps best practices¬†‚Äì use CI/CD, IaC, and cloud native solutions¬†to deploy and monitor models.
Collaborate across teams¬†‚Äì work with Data Engineers, Software Engineers,¬†Tech Lead, and Product Owner to align on data, integrations, architecture, and goals.
Define metrics and evaluation processes¬†- establish performance metrics, evaluation and validation frameworks aligned with business logic and requirements
Take proactive initiatives¬†- continuously identify and implement improvements to boost team productivity and solution quality
Mentor junior engineers¬†- provide technical guidance, code reviews, and care for the junior engineers in the team.




Who you are?

We‚Äôre seeking Machine Learning Engineers with diverse skills and a passion for solving complex problems and business impact.




You‚Äôre an ML EXPERT who:

‚Ä¢¬†Ships models to production, not just notebooks

‚Ä¢ Speaks the language of both algorithms and business KPIs

‚Ä¢ Stays ahead of the curve on AI/ML breakthroughs

‚Ä¢ Is proficient in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.




You‚Äôre an ENGINEER who:

‚Ä¢ Writes code that outlasts the current project

‚Ä¢ Thinks in systems, not just scripts

‚Ä¢ Tests obsessively (A/B testing solutions, End-to-End testing softwares) and documents proactively

‚Ä¢ Knows cloud infra like the back of your hand (AWS preferred)




Bonus points for experience with:

‚Ä¢ Implementing CI/CD pipelines, MLOps practices, and infrastructure-as-code for robust and repeatable deployments

‚Ä¢ Feature stores and real-time inference pipelines

‚Ä¢ Open data formats like Delta Lake or Iceberg

‚Ä¢ Swedish language skills (not required, but a plus)




What Apotea Offer You

The chance to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that impact millions of customers.
Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics
Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
Own projects from concept to deployment
A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.




About Apotea

Apotea.se¬†is Sweden‚Äôs largest online pharmacy, with the country‚Äôs broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden‚Äôs most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Liding√∂, and Morgong√•va.




Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.




Location:¬†Sveav√§gen 168, Stockholm, Sweden

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.




Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world‚Äôs #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.




As a Staff Data Scientist for the Search team, you‚Äôll lead high-impact initiatives that directly shape user experiences across core features like Caller ID, Spam & Fraud Protection, and Name Resolution. Your work will drive innovation in spam detection, name accuracy, and large-scale experimentation. Ideal for someone who excels at the crossroads of data science, product, and engineering, leveraging ML, stats, and data engineering to solve meaningful, real-world problems.




The impact you will create:

Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.




What you bring in:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field.
At least 7 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
Excellent programming skills in Python, SQL
Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
Customer obsession
Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time




It would be great if you also have:

Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
Experience with data from mobile applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.




We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:

A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There‚Äôs something for everyone!




Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that‚Äôs why we would love to meet you.
