Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Google Cloud Journey as a Senior Data Scientist at Codento

Do you want to be among the best of Google Cloud technology and be an integral part of growing new business in Sweden, as well as our Nordic growth journey? Do you thrive in an empathetic, low-hierarchical, self-directed, and entrepreneurial work environment? If so, Codento might have the perfect opportunity for you!

At Codento, we are dedicated to delivering exceptional value to customers across diverse industries through the power of cloud technology, software solutions, and AI.

Google Cloud stands out as the fastest-growing cloud platform, and the demand for expertise in this domain is soaring. As our Swedish team expands, we're on the lookout for a talented Senior Data Scientist to tackle complex consulting projects.





Your tasks during our growth journey:

As a Senior Data Scientist at Codento, you work in responsible consultant positions by planning and utilizing the opportunities brought by cloud technologies to help our customers.

This means you‚Äôll be challenged with different problems within the AI and Cloud landscape, which you solve with the help of other Codento experts.

You work with cloud technology tools that deepen and expand your already possessed know-how. You will learn a lot, especially about Google Cloud, and that is also expected of you in this position.

You will also be working closely with our friends at Google Cloud as well as our Codento Nordic teams.


Read the next section to learn what this means technology-wise.





When you join us, we expect you to have:

Must-haves

Strong proficiency in Python and SQL
Machine learning and understanding the whole data science flow
Data handling and integrations know-how
Cloud and deployments skills (preferably in Google Cloud)
Skills in data visualization
Good skills in working with different stakeholders and a desire to understand the customer‚Äôs business
Excellent communication skills

Nice-to-haves

Having a strong understanding of the consulting/service business
Track record of leading projects/teams
Data warehouse and vector database experience
MLOps know-how
Valid GCP Certification
Growth / entrepreneurial mindset
Swedish language capabilities





Why should you choose Codento?

We provide a vibrant and exciting work environment where you can grow and boost your personal development by using cutting-edge technologies while working on helping our customers solve complex business challenges. We have a small but growing enthusiastic team located in the city of Stockholm.


What we expect from everyone (our values):


Pioneering: The ability to confidently navigate change and a strong hunger for learning new skills.
Perseverance: Determination and a shared commitment to achieving our common objectives.
Empathy: The capacity to empathize and collaborate effectively with others.

When you join Codento, you join a brilliant team of technology experts who are also welcoming and empathetic.





Interested? Wondering about something?

Apply via the link to our recruitment system! The form is easy and quick to fill. At least leave either your CV or/and LinkedIn profile and answer the multiple choice questions. You can also write a short cover letter if you want.

If you want to know more about us, please visit our website. There you will find many customer cases and blogs from which you can reflect on whether we‚Äôre a good fit for you. :)


Show more

Title: R&D Senior Data Scientist : Bioinformatics
Description:
Pelago Bioscience is growing and we have an exciting opportunity for an experienced and motivated Senior Data Scientist within our R&D department. This role is ideal for you who thrives at the intersection of science, data, and business impact.

In this role you will advance the expansion of our data science function by driving innovation to connect biology and data in ways that support strategic decision-making and customer value.

You will be leveraging your knowledge within bioinformatics to identify and generate insights and relationships from proteomics based CETSA experiments with other methodologies. You will also develop and evaluate machine learning (ML) algorithms, perform statistical analysis to resolve data set problems, and keep ahead of the latest developments in data utilization methods.

You will work closely with stakeholders across different functions within the business including lab experimentalists and data focused colleagues with an ambition to inform and contribute future strategies in both the experimental and data science themes at Pelago Bioscience. More specifically, this role will provide computational analysis and solutions to enable and improve the output from our technical platforms with a biology-centric focus.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with the research teams to develop CETSA methodologies and new products.
Analyse, integrate and visualize CETSA data generated internally and with external collaborators.
Develop and implement algorithms and statistical models to analyse and integrate large-scale data sets.
Apply machine learning techniques to complex data.
Interpret and present results to cross-functional teams, including biologists, drug discovery scientists, and computational scientists.
Lead the development of novel data analysis pipelines and tools to streamline the data analysis process and incorporate new technologies and methodologies into the research.
Working closely with our other new role of Data engineer to establish fit for purpose data management and applications for internal and external use.


Qualifications


Ph.D. in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in analysing proteomics, other omics or imaging data.
Strong and documented proficiency in Python and familiarity with machine learning libraries and framework.
Industry experience with understanding of data‚Äôs role in product or service delivery is highly desirable.


Please submit your application with a CV no later than 18th of September 2025. Please note that we interview candidates continuously and the positions may be filled before last application date, so please do not hesitate with your application!

About working at Pelago Bioscience:

At Pelago Bioscience, we aim to attract the best talent from around the world and across multiple scientific disciplines. We provide a dynamic and stimulating environment for our staff to excel and‚ÄØdrive innovation with the customers in focus. We are committed to developing our employees and believe their satisfaction translates into the best experience for our customers.

At Pelago we are scaling up our business to continue to be a sustainable company where curiosity about science is at our core. We work together with our worldwide customers, with the aim of being the preferred partner of choice in our field. Since December 2021 we are located in the Campus Solna area. We have a beautifully designed activity based office area and a lab floor with a view!

Apply via our career page by following the link: https://pelagobio.careers.haileyhr.app/en-GB/job/b28cf643-04a8-4a16-8f06-b35ac7286c4a/91d50ded-63f0-42dd-9d20-1781124eed60/321a7ed6-ecbd-42f2-93e4-10a51fe12923

Find out more about Pelago Bioscience at https://www.pelagobio.com/About-CETSA/

Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.


Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world‚Äôs #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.

A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


As a Senior Data Scientist, you will drive critical initiatives focused on spam prevention, name election, and experimentation. This role requires a very strong foundation in advanced statistics, machine learning, and engineering, along with a passion for delivering measurable impact at a mega scale. Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Pricing Recommendations

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team working with pricing recommendation models, focused on optimizing price strategies during online sales events. In this role, you will work directly with machine learning solutions that guide pricing decisions across the product lifecycle.

Main Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and refine ML models that generate data-driven price recommendations aligned with business objectives.
Partner with ML engineers and data engineers to ensure seamless operations, quickly resolving technical issues and challenges.
Monitor system performance throughout sales cycles, continuously improving models to maximize business impact.


Qualifications:


Strong programming background with solid expertise in machine learning, including forecasting and mathematical optimization.
Business-oriented mindset with the ability to interpret system behavior and connect insights to measurable outcomes.
Experience solving open-ended problems and driving improvements in collaboration with both technical teams and stakeholders.


About You:


An experienced data scientist with a proven track record of working in cross-functional teams.
Skilled at turning hypotheses into practical solutions and taking ownership of initiatives from concept to delivery.
Comfortable in fast-paced settings, with a passion for building data-driven solutions that deliver real business value.


About Rasulson Consulting

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you‚Äôll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

  • Comfortable in fast-paced settings, with a passion for building data-driven solutions that deliver real business value.

About Rasulson Consulting

Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you‚Äôll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Mynt

Mynt is an all-in-one corporate card and spend management solution, on a mission to fundamentally change business banking forever. Our digital software, coupled with corporate cards and payments infrastructure, eradicates manual administrative tasks relating to spending for businesses. Mynt is experiencing huge growth in the Nordic markets, serving over 16,000 business customers with year-over-year growth exceeding 100%. We have recently secured substantial funding to support our continued expansion in Sweden and internationally.




Mynt is a tech-first company with a product oriented mindset, empowering teams to be their best in ideating and creating innovative solutions to complex problems. In 2021, Mynt obtained financial license as an E-money institution, card issuer, and payment processor from the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority.




Since 2022, we‚Äôve launched several strategic partnerships, starting with Fortnox where we integrated corporate cards directly into their platform. In early 2023, we announced a similar partnership with Accountor Group in Finland. Since then, additional integrations have gone live ‚Äî including Kleer and Wint. Additional partnerships are in progress and under development.




Joining Mynt means contributing to creating an exceptional product and company. We seek passionate individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing customer value. With around 70 employees (and growing fast), we plan to further expand our team to support our growth.




About the Role

We are looking for top developers who have a passion for development and a deep interest in AI technologies, particularly in designing and building autonomous agents and agentic workflows. You'll thrive in our entrepreneurial environment where there's great opportunity to influence results and the company's progress. With us, you'll work in a modern codebase using the latest technologies, experiment with cutting-edge AI frameworks, and take on significant personal responsibility in shaping how intelligent agents transform our products.




What you bring to the table:

Bachelor/Engineering degree or equivalent
At least 1+ years of relevant work experience, preferably using Java or Python
Ability to write well-documented, clean code
You truly enjoy finding innovative solutions together with your team
Fluent in Swedish and English




What we can offer you:

Be part of an amazing team in a fast-growing scale-up.
Work closely with a fun, high-performing team.
Enjoy a flexible working environment with a great office location in central Stockholm.
Shape your own development and responsibilities based on your passion and interest.




The position will be filled as soon as we find a suitable candidate. Please reach out to us as soon as possible if you believe this for you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer ‚Äì Energy Optimisation
Description:
10% of Europe‚Äôs CO‚ÇÇ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.

With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we‚Äôre making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.

Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions, and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.

About The Role‚ÄØ

Join our growing Energy Optimisation team as a Machine Learning Engineer (full-time, in-house) and help build and maintain the models that make up Aira‚Äôs intelligent home energy management system. By connecting our customers‚Äô Aira devices - solar, batteries, heat pumps, and EV chargers - our system personalises energy management, adapts to customer preferences, usage patterns, and external factors like weather forecasts and energy tariffs, all with the mission to reduce energy bills and cut CO‚ÇÇ emissions.

This role combines technical work with a product mindset. You'll dive into the details of machine learning models and energy optimisation, while also shaping the customer experience: how do we balance cost and comfort, how do we build trust in our intelligence, and how do we make our models understandable and explainable to our customers?

You‚Äôll be joining a fast-moving, small team with high ownership. We‚Äôre looking for an ML Engineer comfortable working across the full data stack, who brings a product mindset, strong collaboration skills, and a drive to turn complex models into everyday value for our customers.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing



Apply your mathematical and ML knowledge to solve real-world energy problems.
Develop optimisation models balancing dynamic tariffs, weather forecasts, customer behaviour, and preferences to achieve the perfect balance between cost savings and comfort for each individual customer and home.
Design, build, productionise, and iterate on Aira‚Äôs energy optimisation models
Collaborate with product designers, software, and hardware engineers to co-create features that will make our customers love their Aira products and save more money on their energy bills.
Test new approaches quickly, learn from results, and scale up the ones that make a difference



What You‚Äôll Bring To The Role



You‚Äôre energized by fast-moving, product-driven environments where progress matters and the customer perspective guides our decisions.
You‚Äôre motivated by impact - what matters is not the perfect model, but the value it gives to the customer.
You have a background in machine learning, enjoy applying theory to develop real-world applications, with experience in reinforcement learning, general neural networks, and/or other methods relevant to personalisation and optimisation problems.
You have strong coding skills and have built ML systems in production, ideally using Python, Java, or similar. Familiarity with tools like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Scikit-learn is beneficial but not required.
You‚Äôre comfortable working with large-scale data pipelines, orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow), stream processing (e.g., Kafka), and cloud platforms (e.g., GCP or AWS).
You're ready to take initiative and accountability, and you're able to lead or contribute to high-stakes technical discussions.
You're open to working primarily from our Stockholm office



What is in it for you?



Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away.



At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

Vill du vara med i en start-up som utvecklar sina egna AI-modeller?

P√• Preventai AB utvecklar vi v√•ra egna datorseende-modeller och AI-system f√∂r att f√∂rst√• butiksmilj√∂er i realtid. V√•r teknologi anv√§nds f√∂r att analysera kundfl√∂den, uppt√§cka m√∂nster och stoppa st√∂lder - direkt n√§r de sker. Med partners som RISE och EU EuroHPC, samt kunder som ICA butiker, arbetar vi p√• att f√∂r√§ndra hur retailbranschen ser p√• s√§kerhet och effektivitet. Vi har nyligen st√§ngt en investeringsrunda och planerar att skala v√•r teknik mot den bredare marknaden under h√∂sten 2025.


Nu s√∂ker vi en AI Rsearch Engineer som ska bli en del av v√•rt datorseendeteam samt arbeta n√§ra v√•r CTO. Rollen inneb√§r att du analyserar forskningsartiklar, experimenterar med nya arkitekturer och bidrar till att v√•ra modeller h√•ller absolut toppniv√•. Du kommer att vara en central del i att driva v√•r teknologi fram√•t.


Dina uppgifter

  • L√§sa och utv√§rdera forskningsartiklar inom datorseende, AI och ML.
  • Implementera och experimentera med nya algoritmer och arkitekturer.
  • Utveckla, tr√§na och optimera datorseendemodeller (t.ex. YOLO, transformerbaserade modeller, reID).
  • Arbeta med datainsamling, annotering och preprocessing f√∂r modelltr√§ning.
  • Bidra till att f√∂rb√§ttra v√•r pipeline f√∂r modellutveckling och deployment.


Krav

  • Masterexamen eller h√∂gre inom datavetenskap, matematik, maskininl√§rning, teknisk fysik eller motsvarande.
  • Starkt matematisk grund (linj√§√•r algebra, sannolikhet, statistik, optimering).
  • Goda kunskaper i Python och PyTorch eller Tensorflow.
  • Erfarenhet av att tr√§na och utv√§rdera datorseendemodeller.
  • F√∂rm√•ga att l√§sa och oms√§tta forskningsartiklar till fungerande kod.
  • Flytande svenska och engelska, tal & skrift.


Meriterande

  • Erfarenhet av transformer-baserade modeller (VLMs, Vision transformers)
  • Kunskap inom videoanalys, tracking, activity recognition eller re-identification.
  • Erfarenhet av storskalig modelltr√§ning p√• GPU/cluster.
  • Publikationer, projekt eller bidrag till open-source inom AI/ML.


Varf√∂r oss

Hos oss bygger vi inte bara ett f√∂retag, vi bygger en ny standard f√∂r hur AI anv√§nds i retail. Vi √§r ett team med r√∂tter i forskning och avancerad ingenj√∂rskonst, men ocks√• med en entrepren√∂riell kultur d√§r alla f√•r ta ansvar samt v√§xa snabbt. H√§r kommer du inte att fastna i en liten box - du kommer att f√• arbeta brett, utvecklas tillsammans och bredvid dina kollegor samt se hur din insats direkt p√•verkar b√•de v√•ra kunder samt bolagets framtid.


Vad vi erbjuder

  • Trygg och tydlig ers√§ttning, fastl√∂n.
  • Friskv√•rdsbidrag
  • M√∂jlighet till hybridarbete
  • M√∂jlighet till teckningsoptioner


√Ñr du redo att ta n√§sta steg i din karri√§r och vill vara med p√• v√•r resa? Vi √§r ivriga p√• att kunna f√• prata och l√§ra k√§nna dig. Skicka din ans√∂kan redan idag, vi intervjuar l√∂pande och tj√§nsten kan komma att tills√§ttas snabbt.


Vi ser fram emot att h√∂ra fr√•n dig! :)

Title: Staff ML Engineer
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description


Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning products with a focus on online prediction.
Build and maintain infrastructure and tooling as a platform for data scientists.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into production systems.
Monitor and maintain the performance and reliability of ML models post-Fdeployment.
Stay current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.





Qualifications



Required:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

Comfortable work with multi-cloud setup and experience with AWS or/and GCP and containerized environment like Kubernetes.

Solid understanding of machine learning lifecycle and fundamentals.

Expertise in Python.

Familiarity with Terraform, GitHub and GitHub Actions.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.



Bonus Qualifications:

Experience with Vertex AI, specifically in online prediction.

Experience with Cloud Run and Workload Identity Federation.

Experience with kubeflow pipelines

Experience with Triton inference server and TensorRT

Understanding of data security and privacy regulations.





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Mycket goda kunskaper i Python, R eller motsvarande

Erfarenhet av att arbeta med on-prem-l√∂sningar, g√§rna i kombination med molnmilj√∂er
Vana att ta ett helhetsansvar fr√•n analys till produktion

Teknisk milj√∂

Du f√•r tillg√•ng till den lokala infrastruktur och de verktyg som idag anv√§nds inom BI och dataplattform. Organisation och placering

Hos oss √§r v√•ra v√§rderingar, Professionella & Empatiska samt Ansvarstagande & Samverkande, n√•got som genomsyrar hela kulturen p√• SOS Alarm och att du kan relatera till dessa √§r en f√∂ruts√§ttning f√∂r att trivas hos oss!

Title: Generative AI Engineer
Description:
Title - AI Engineer

Location - Stockholm (Flexible Hybrid Model)




Due to the urgency of these requirements, our client is only accepting applications from applicants who have the right to work and live in Europe.




The Role

Our client, a fast-growing AI startup based in Stockholm, is looking for an experienced AI Engineer to join their ambitious team and help shape the next generation of intelligent products.




You‚Äôll help build intelligent systems powered by modern language models, focusing on real-world applications like search, content generation, and automation. Your work will include building agentic workflows, designing scalable pipelines, and bringing AI prototypes into production.

Develop systems based on LLMs, including retrieval-augmented generation, prompt chaining, and autonomous flows.
Evaluate and fine-tune both open-source models and commercial LLM APIs (e.g., GPT-4o, Claude, Gemini).
Design pipelines that combine knowledge graphs, embeddings, and vector search to surface structured information.
Work closely with product and data teams to define and build meaningful user-facing features.
Contribute to best practices around working with LLMs and help shape a future-forward engineering culture.




About You

A few years of experience (3+) building real-world AI/ML systems, especially those using LLMs.
Strong coding ability, particularly in Python, and comfort working with modern ML libraries (PyTorch, HuggingFace, etc.).
Experience designing or deploying vector search and embedding-based systems.
You've deployed models into production and understand how to monitor and iterate in live environments.




Bonus If You‚Äôve...

Contributed to open-source tooling or published in the AI/ML space.
Explored agent-like systems or feedback-driven model training.




Why It‚Äôs Interesting

You‚Äôll get access to cutting-edge LLM APIs and infrastructure for experimentation.
There‚Äôs plenty of room to shape direction and drive forward an AI-first mindset.
You‚Äôll be part of a small, experienced team that values autonomy and product thinking.
Competitive pay and equity, with flexible working built in.




We would love to hear from you!




Please apply now by sending your CV to Ronnie at ronnie.wilson@teletechpartners.com or contact teletech Partners on +44 203 640 7429.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Do you find yourself constantly building new features with generative models? Do you like the challenge of taking something that works in theory and making it useful in practice? At Framna, we‚Äôre looking for an AI Engineer who‚Äôs as curious as they are collaborative. Someone who can dive into supporting structures, such as evaluation frameworks and models, but also explain their findings in a way that makes sense to the rest of us. If that sounds like you, we‚Äôd love to have you on the team!




Become part of the team




Framna partners with some of the world‚Äôs most ambitious brands, like Swish, SJ, Essity, and SEB, to create digital products that define markets and deliver real-world impact. We‚Äôre now more than 500 people across eight studios, building apps used by millions every day.

As an AI Engineer here, you‚Äôll sit in the middle of it all. Some days you‚Äôll be prototyping new ideas with colleagues. Other days you‚Äôll be building the services that take those ideas into production. Sometimes you‚Äôll be the one explaining to a partner what‚Äôs actually possible with AI right now. And throughout it all, you‚Äôll have a network of other AI enthusiasts across Framna to share, test, and learn with.




What you will do




This is a role for someone who likes variety. It‚Äôs about figuring out where AI actually adds value and then building it into products that people can trust and enjoy.




More specifically, you‚Äôll:

Explore and apply LLMs and Generative AI, including multi-modal capabilities.
Build pipelines for training, testing, deployment, monitoring, and scaling models.
Decide when to go custom and when to use existing tools.
Fine-tune models and design data pipelines to keep them running smoothly.
Share your discoveries with colleagues and partners so everyone levels up.
Contribute to pitches and presentations when we explore new opportunities.
Lead internal projects that use AI to make Framna smarter and more efficient.




Who you are




There‚Äôs no single background that makes you right for this role. What matters is how you think, how you build, and how you work with others. You might recognize yourself here if you:




Get curious about the latest AI developments and enjoy testing them out.
Like solving complex problems and turning experiments into something reliable.
Can explain technical things in a way that makes sense to non-technical people.
Enjoy working in a team where different perspectives make the product better.
Care about building AI that‚Äôs fair, inclusive, and genuinely useful.




About Framna




Framna means ‚Äòto bring forward‚Äô in Old Norse. And that is exactly what we do. We partner with industry leaders (and those about to be) to create excellent digital products that define markets, reshape industries, and deliver meaningful impact.

Born from the union of digital agencies Bontouch, Move, and Shape, Framna emerged from a strong, product-led culture. Today, over 500 of us collaborate across eight studios in Denmark, the Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland, and the US.

Every day, millions of users around the world rely on the products we help shape. From seamless payments to daily commutes, from better health management to smarter shopping. Our work supports more than ‚Ç¨150 million in daily transactions and consistently earns an average App Store rating of 4.5.

Together with some of the world‚Äôs most ambitious brands, including Essity, SJ, Swish, and SEB, we craft products that lead markets and push boundaries. Because when products win, businesses win. We call it Win by product.




What you get




A studio worth leaving home for. Our Stockholm office is right in the middle of the city - a super cozy space where there‚Äôs always something happening, whether it‚Äôs a demo, a fika, or someone testing out a new idea. We mix that with the freedom to work from home when it makes sense, and hours that flex around real life.
A culture of curiosity. On Fridays we have weekly demos, Wednesdays mean lunch-and-learns, and sometimes we throw ourselves into conceptathons just to see what happens. We gather for company conferences just to share ideas, and we take time to learn something new when needed.
The freedom to follow your ‚Äúwhat if.‚Äù We believe the best roles are shaped by the people in them. If you‚Äôre curious about something, you‚Äôll have the trust and space to chase it, and probably a few teammates who want to jump in with you.
Teammates who bring their whole selves. Designers who doodle during standups, engineers who can‚Äôt resist showing off a clever hack, product leads who keep the energy up when things get tricky. Around here, people genuinely like sharing what they know and celebrating when someone tries something new.
And of course, the benefits you‚Äôd expect. A generous wellness grant, top-up on your parental leave, occupational pension, and plenty more to make life outside of work easier.







Our hiring process




Psychometric assessment ‚Äì personality and logic test
Interview with our recruiter, Josephine
Case assignment and case interview
Final meeting
Show more
HTML:
Do you find yourself constantly building new features with generative models? Do you like the challenge of taking something that works in theory and making it useful in practice? At Framna, we‚Äôre looking for an AI Engineer who‚Äôs as curious as they are collaborative. Someone who can dive into supporting structures, such as evaluation frameworks and models, but also explain their findings in a way that makes sense to the rest of us. If that sounds like you, we‚Äôd love to have you on the team!


Become part of the team


Framna partners with some of the world‚Äôs most ambitious brands, like Swish, SJ, Essity, and SEB, to create digital products that define markets and deliver real-world impact. We‚Äôre now more than 500 people across eight studios, building apps used by millions every day.

As an AI Engineer here, you‚Äôll sit in the middle of it all. Some days you‚Äôll be prototyping new ideas with colleagues. Other days you‚Äôll be building the services that take those ideas into production. Sometimes you‚Äôll be the one explaining to a partner what‚Äôs actually possible with AI right now. And throughout it all, you‚Äôll have a network of other AI enthusiasts across Framna to share, test, and learn with.


What you will do


This is a role for someone who likes variety. It‚Äôs about figuring out where AI actually adds value and then building it into products that people can trust and enjoy.


More specifically, you‚Äôll:

  • Explore and apply LLMs and Generative AI, including multi-modal capabilities.
  • Build pipelines for training, testing, deployment, monitoring, and scaling models.
  • Decide when to go custom and when to use existing tools.
  • Fine-tune models and design data pipelines to keep them running smoothly.
  • Share your discoveries with colleagues and partners so everyone levels up.
  • Contribute to pitches and presentations when we explore new opportunities.
  • Lead internal projects that use AI to make Framna smarter and more efficient.


Who you are


There‚Äôs no single background that makes you right for this role. What matters is how you think, how you build, and how you work with others. You might recognize yourself here if you:


  • Get curious about the latest AI developments and enjoy testing them out.
  • Like solving complex problems and turning experiments into something reliable.
  • Can explain technical things in a way that makes sense to non-technical people.
  • Enjoy working in a team where different perspectives make the product better.
  • Care about building AI that‚Äôs fair, inclusive, and genuinely useful.


About Framna


Framna means ‚Äòto bring forward‚Äô in Old Norse. And that is exactly what we do. We partner with industry leaders (and those about to be) to create excellent digital products that define markets, reshape industries, and deliver meaningful impact.

Born from the union of digital agencies Bontouch, Move, and Shape, Framna emerged from a strong, product-led culture. Today, over 500 of us collaborate across eight studios in Denmark, the Netherlands, Sweden, Switzerland, and the US.

Every day, millions of users around the world rely on the products we help shape. From seamless payments to daily commutes, from better health management to smarter shopping. Our work supports more than ‚Ç¨150 million in daily transactions and consistently earns an average App Store rating of 4.5.

Together with some of the world‚Äôs most ambitious brands, including Essity, SJ, Swish, and SEB, we craft products that lead markets and push boundaries. Because when products win, businesses win. We call it Win by product.


What you get


  • A studio worth leaving home for. Our Stockholm office is right in the middle of the city - a super cozy space where there‚Äôs always something happening, whether it‚Äôs a demo, a fika, or someone testing out a new idea. We mix that with the freedom to work from home when it makes sense, and hours that flex around real life.
  • A culture of curiosity. On Fridays we have weekly demos, Wednesdays mean lunch-and-learns, and sometimes we throw ourselves into conceptathons just to see what happens. We gather for company conferences just to share ideas, and we take time to learn something new when needed.
  • The freedom to follow your ‚Äúwhat if.‚Äù We believe the best roles are shaped by the people in them. If you‚Äôre curious about something, you‚Äôll have the trust and space to chase it, and probably a few teammates who want to jump in with you.
  • Teammates who bring their whole selves. Designers who doodle during standups, engineers who can‚Äôt resist showing off a clever hack, product leads who keep the energy up when things get tricky. Around here, people genuinely like sharing what they know and celebrating when someone tries something new.
  • And of course, the benefits you‚Äôd expect. A generous wellness grant, top-up on your parental leave, occupational pension, and plenty more to make life outside of work easier.



Our hiring process


  • Psychometric assessment ‚Äì personality and logic test
  • Interview with our recruiter, Josephine
  • Case assignment and case interview
  • Final meeting

Title: R&D Data Engineer
Description:
Pelago Bioscience is growing, and we are excited to offer a unique opportunity for a data engineer to join our R&D department. In this role, you will help drive the expansion of our data science capabilities by developing software solutions to connect biology and data.

In this position you will be leveraging your knowledge in programming and software development to bridge the gap between the data scientists developing models and the teams who implement them within an innovative CRO business.

This role is ideal for a technically skilled individual who is passionate about applying software development in a scientific and customer-oriented context. High proficiency with Python (NumPy, SciPy, Pandas etc.) is essential and experience with Shiny or R desirable. Experience with SQL environments or database design advantageous. Knowledge of software development practices, including version control, testing and deployment beneficial. Whether you are an experienced software engineer from industry or a recent graduate with strong programming skills, you will have the opportunity to make a measurable impact we deliver science and data-driven value to clients.

Responsibilities


You will be responsible for developing novel applications that prosecute a wide variety of datasets for both internal and external use.
You will be responsible for efficient database design and maintenance of large datasets
Collaborate closely with research and commercial teams to build user-friendly tools that serve internal workflows and client-facing needs.
Monitoring and maintenance of our bioinformatics pipeline and existing applications in real time to identify issues and implement solutions.


This role is housed within the R&D department, you will work closely with stakeholders across different functions within the business, collaborating with data science functions through to end-user focused teams.

Qualifications


An Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, software engineering or related field. Degrees in other STEM subjects with requisite programming skills accepted.
Documented or Demonstrable proficiency in Python with familiarity of libraries such as Numpy, Scipy, Pandas or R is essential.
Knowledge of software development methodologies, version control systems (Such as Git) and testing frameworks desirable.
Knowledge of SQL database design and maintenance desirable


Please submit your application with a CV no later than 18th of September 2025. Please note that we interview candidates continuously and the positions may be filled before last application date, so please do not hesitate with your application!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

About working at Pelago Bioscience:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

At Pelago Bioscience, we aim to attract the best talent from around the world and across multiple scientific disciplines. We provide a dynamic and stimulating environment for our staff to excel and‚ÄØdrive innovation with the customers in focus. We are committed to developing our employees and believe their satisfaction translates into the best experience for our customers.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

At Pelago we are scaling up our business to continue to be a sustainable company where curiosity about science is at our core. We work together with our worldwide customers, with the aim of being the preferred partner of choice in our field. Since December 2021 we are located in the Campus Solna area. We have a beautifully designed activity based office area and a lab floor with a view!

Apply for this position via this link: https://pelagobio.careers.haileyhr.app/en-GB/job/b28cf643-04a8-4a16-8f06-b35ac7286c4a/1701d0ca-2d4f-40df-9e83-0544453f2e5f/7cfb9f78-f246-4eaf-9f46-f445d0979116

Find out more about Pelago Bioscience at https://www.pelagobio.com/

Title: Data scientist
Description:
Om oss

V√•r k√§rnprodukt √§r data ‚Äì men √§nnu viktigare √§r de insikter vi skapar av den.




Din roll

Som Data Scientist kommer du att vara en del av v√•rt analysteam och arbeta praktiskt med att f√∂r√§dla v√•r data, utveckla modeller och s√§kerst√§lla att v√•ra leveranser h√•ller h√∂g kvalitet. Du kommer att bidra till att f√∂rb√§ttra v√•ra metoder f√∂r kalibrering, validering och analys ‚Äì och d√§rigenom skapa √§nnu b√§ttre insikter f√∂r v√•ra kunder.

Du arbetar n√§ra v√•ra utvecklare, implementationsteam och kundansvariga f√∂r att f√∂rst√• b√•de den tekniska sidan och kundernas behov. Rollen √§r en blandning av analys, probleml√∂sning och samarbete.




Ansvarsomr√•den
Analysera och bearbeta stora datam√§ngder
Bidra till utveckling och f√∂rb√§ttring av statistiska modeller
St√∂dja vid upps√§ttning och kalibrering av nya installationer
S√§kerst√§lla datakvalitet och bidra till validering av resultat
Samarbeta med kollegor f√∂r att oms√§tta kundernas behov i datadrivna l√∂sningar
Bidra med insikter och underlag till visualiseringar (t.ex. i Power BI), men utan krav p√• att sj√§lv bygga dashboards




Vem vi s√∂ker

Du √§r analytisk, noggrann och tycker om att arbeta med data i olika former. Du √§r nyfiken p√• hur m√§nniskor r√∂r sig i fysiska milj√∂er och vill anv√§nda din kompetens till att skapa insikter som g√∂r skillnad.

Erfarenhet av dataanalys och statistisk modellering
Programmeringsvana i Python
Kunskap i PostgreSQL och g√§rna PostGIS
Intresse f√∂r geospatial data och mobilitetsm√∂nster
Viss erfarenhet av datavisualisering (Power BI, Tableau eller liknande) √§r meriterande, men inget krav




V√•r kultur

P√• Bumbee Labs kombinerar vi djup teknisk kompetens med en kreativ och samarbetsinriktad arbetsmilj√∂. Vi brainstormar, testar och utmanar id√©er varje dag ‚Äì och vi har kul l√§ngs v√§gen. V√•rt kontor ligger i hj√§rtat av Stockholm, d√§r kreativitet och innovation f√•r utrymme att blomma.

Title: Data Scientist - Sweden Operations
Description:
Shape the Future of Data Science in Life-Saving Medicine Production at AstraZeneca!

Are you passionate about leveraging AI, machine learning, and advanced analytics to drive innovation and impact in healthcare? At AstraZeneca, we put patients first and strive to meet their unmet needs worldwide. Working here means being ambitious, thinking big, and working together to make the impossible a reality. Join us as we harness the power of science and technology to truly change the course of medicine and bring bold new ideas to life.

As a Data Scientist within Sweden Operations in S√∂dert√§lje, you will play a pivotal role in transforming our operations through cutting-edge analytics and advanced data science solutions. You will join a highly collaborative and cross-disciplinary environment, working alongside expert teams across the company to fuel fact-based decision-making and empower process optimization throughout our value chain.

What You'll Do

The Data, Analytics & AI team is integral to the Strategy & Performance function in Sweden Operations. You will work side by side with other data scientists, analysts, and technology experts, delivering insights and developing innovative data-driven solutions that optimize business processes and support strategic projects. Our analytics initiatives span Inbound, Manufacturing, Quality, Outbound, and critical support functions such as Maintenance, Supply, and Production Planning.


In this role, you will: Coordinate the implementation of innovative modelling solutions, integrating complex data from multiple sources and modalities to generate actionable insights.
Translate unstructured business challenges into analytically tractable problems, applying state-of-the-art machine learning and statistical models.
Develop and deploy predictive models and computational methods that guide decision-making and operational improvements.
Act as a subject-matter expert by providing training and advisory services, and ensuring best practices in data science and analytics across Sweden Operations.
Communicate data-driven insights clearly and objectively, influencing partners and shaping impactful solutions.
Maintain robust, production-grade data science workflows, ensuring compliance, quality, and sustained business value.
Leverage generative AI, large language models, and advanced ML to automate processes, enhance data insights, and solve complex business problems.


What We're Looking For


Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent experience) in operations research, mathematics, computer science, engineering, or a related quantitative field
Proven experience with Python and advanced machine learning methods, including supervised and unsupervised learning, neural networks, generative AI such as large language models, and computer vision models
Demonstrated proficiency across the full data science workflow
Strong skills in manipulating and analyzing high-dimensional datasets, drawing actionable conclusions, and communicating technical results or requirements to business stakeholders in business-friendly language
Hands-on experience with SQL databases
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage effectively with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders
Fluency in English, both spoken and written


Desirable Experience


Experience with AWS cloud platform & Snowflake
Familiarity with software development tools, including Git, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, and agile methodologies
Experience working in multinational or digitally mature organizations
Proficiency in Power BI, Dash, Tableau
Swedish language skills


Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to truly make an impact, contributing to the production of life-saving medicines while developing your career in a forward-thinking, global organization. We offer an extraordinary international working environment with excellent opportunities for collaboration, innovation, and professional growth. Diversity and inclusion are at our core, ensuring everyone can thrive.

What‚Äôs Next?

Are you ready to help lead the digital transformation of medicine production? Apply now, submit your CV and cover letter no later than August 27th 2025.

By the way: If you have publicly available repositories or a portfolio showcasing data science or analytics projects (deep learning, ensemble methods, AI, optimization, etc.), include a link with your application.

Join us, and together we‚Äôll turn big data into bold ideas that change patients‚Äô lives.

Date Posted

18-aug.-2025

Closing Date

27-aug.-2025

Our mission is to build an inclusive and equitable environment. We want people to feel they belong at AstraZeneca and Alexion, starting with our recruitment process. We welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of characteristics. We offer reasonable adjustments/accommodations to help all candidates to perform at their best. If you have a need for any adjustments/accommodations, please complete the section in the application form.

Title: SW AI Developer
Description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.

Job Description

We are looking for a solutions-oriented AI developer. As an AI Developer one need to do basically everything that is needed to get the models to MVP status.

Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)


Python (including packaging), (Rust), js, vibe coding, front-end solutions
Kubernetes, Docker, Containerization, REST API
MLFlow, Airflow, Windmill
Hopsworks, Palantir Foundry
Pytorch, pandas, scikit-learn, tensorflow
GMM, HMM, LSTM, Transformers, CNN, RNN
Excellent collaboration skills
Excellent customer presentation skills
Experienced in devops


Application deadline: 27-08-2025

About Us

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company‚Äîand we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that‚Äôs just the beginning. With us, you‚Äôll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

Vi erbjuder dig f√∂ljande, Valet √§r ditt!

üöÄ Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.

üåü A secure monthly salary ‚Äì together we‚Äôll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.

üöó Company car ‚Äì we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.

üíº Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.

üå¥ Vacation ‚Äì Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?

üè• Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.

üìö Skills development ‚Äì you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.

üïë Quality of life ‚Äì Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
About Gilion:

Our mission is clear: We are accelerating founders in their growth journey through our Gilion platform. As a growing product company leveraging AI, we are creating an innovative, technically challenging platform revolutionizing how businesses grow - with the key of the platform being analytics, unique AI forecasting, ultimately enabling access to financing and non-dillutive funding, - in a way never done before. Watch our platform here: gilion.com/platform

Our team is made up of experts who have been part of leading companies like Spotify, Google, King, Sinch, bringing a wealth of experience and a passion for pushing boundaries. At Gilion, you‚Äôll be part of a fast-moving, dynamic environment where your work will have a tangible impact on both our product and the industry as a whole. If you‚Äôre excited about working with challenging technology and making a real difference, Gilion is the place for you.

About the role:

You‚Äôll join our data team to build the backbone that powers Gilion‚Äôs AI-driven financial analysis. Your mission: make customer data analysis-ready and accessible to AI agents in a scalable, automated way. This means building services, data models, and integrations.


Design, build, and maintain backend services that process and serve customer data for AI agent analysis.
Define and implement semantic layers and metrics (e.g., lifetime value) to standardize analysis across customers.
Collaborate with AI orchestration systems to ensure agents have the right tools (MCPs) and data for their tasks.
Continuously refine automated analysis workflows to improve accuracy, scalability, and robustness.
Work closely with product and engineering teams to expand data capabilities and handle new data types or sources.
Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize data pipelines and services.


Background/Profile:


Experience in analytics engineering or data engineering roles.
Backend development skills (Python or similar), with ability to build services and APIs.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with data modeling and data warehouses.
Understanding of data quality principles and automated data validation.
Interest in or exposure to AI-driven data analysis - comfortable working in an environment where AI agents consume your data pipelines.


What we offer:


Work-life balance, hybrid-remote model
Diverse, inclusive and knowledge-sharing culture
Experienced founders, backed by top investors
A growth journey with tons of development opportunities
AI product that impacts how companies grow, disrupting the industry
Show more

Title: CRM Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO

As a CRM Data Scientist within the Loyalty & CRM team under Market Activation, you will be at the forefront of recruiting, onboarding and developing customers through our loyalty and membership program. In this global role, your contributions will have a direct and significant impact on our brand strategy. Your key responsibilities will include:


Analyze customer data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in CRM strategies
Build predictive models to forecast customer behavior and preferences.
Develop and implement machine learning algorithms to enhance customer segmentation, targeting, and personalization efforts.
Collaborate with the CRM team and the Value stream to design and execute A/B tests and experiments.
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Continuously monitor and evaluate the performance of CRM initiatives and recommend adjustments as needed.
Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data science and CRM.



Who You‚Äôll Work With

Loyalty is built through every aspect of our company, from the products we create and the brand we represent to the experiences we offer. When we talk about‚ÄØ‚ÄòLoyalty‚Äô, we leverage two key enablers to inform our strategies and tactics: our‚ÄØMembership program‚ÄØand our CRM capabilities. Membership‚ÄØensures‚ÄØidentification‚ÄØand‚ÄØengagement‚ÄØof our member base, building a‚ÄØdirect relationship‚ÄØwith our customers. Through‚ÄØCRM‚ÄØactivities, we increase the value of customer interactions‚ÄØand drive positive‚ÄØcustomer base development, generating‚ÄØincremental sales.‚ÄØ

The Marketing Activation Unit within Marketing is tasked with creating a strategic plan that brings our brand direction to life across various touchpoints. Leveraging data and customer insights, we design comprehensive plans that ensure a seamless and holistic customer experience.

Who You Are

To thrive in this role, you bring strong analytical thinking, excellent communication skills, and a collaborative mindset. You‚Äôre comfortable working in fast-paced environments, translating complex data into actionable insights, and contributing meaningfully to cross-functional teams. You‚Äôre confident presenting your ideas and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders and are eager to grow your impact through hands-on work and continuous learning.

We‚Äôre looking for candidates who have:


A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
3‚Äì5 years of experience in data analysis, machine learning, and working with CRM systems.
Proficiency in Python and SQL, with the ability to write clean, production-ready code and participate in code reviews.
Applied knowledge in statistics and machine learning, including model evaluation and optimization.
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and version control systems like Git.
Strong communication skills to present insights and ML solutions to diverse audiences.
A proactive approach to working independently while collaborating effectively within cross-functional product teams.



And people who are:


Hands-on with customer segmentation, churn prediction, and recommendation systems.
Familiar with CRM platforms such as Adobe, Salesforce, or HubSpot.
Experienced with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP) and big data tools (e.g., Spark, Hadoop).
Able to translate business problems into machine learning solutions and define appropriate evaluation metrics.
Interested in contributing to Communities of Practice or mentoring junior colleagues as part of your growth journey.



Who We Are

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

This role is based out of Stockholm, Sweden.

WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE WORKING HERE

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program ‚Äì HIP. In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

Diversity, Inclusion, and Innovation

At H&M Group, we're deeply committed to fostering a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We actively seek out qualified candidates regardless of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.

Our commitment to an inclusive workplace drives our dynamic and forward-thinking culture. Regardless of your background, origin, or preferences, your application is warmly welcomed. We value diverse perspectives and skills, and every applicant contributes to our vibrant, creative community. Join us and be part of the future we're building.

JOIN US

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things ‚Äì our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it‚Äôs our people who make us who we are.

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer to Apotea
Description:
We at fika ai are helping Apotea hire a Machine Learning Engineer!




Why apply to Apotea via fika ai?

Take our 20-minute AI interview to stand out. Instead of just a CV, you‚Äôll show who you really are - how you reason, communicate, and solve problems. It's the best way to stand out in a sea of CVs. Your video interview will be shared with the hiring team at Apotea!




AI + Apotea =¬†<heart/>




Apotea is Sweden‚Äôs leading online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare accessible and efficient for everyone. Our Data and AI team is at the heart of innovation, building AI and ML applications that enhance customer experience, streamline operations, and create a foundation for future innovations.¬†We are seeking passionate and driven individuals¬†who are¬†eager to make a significant impact and be part of a small technical team.¬†By following industry best practices, we develop end to end AI applications on top of modern data and AI architectures, making sure our AI products don't¬†end up just being a POC and drive sustainable value in production.¬†The AI organization sits right under CEO P√§r Sv√§rdson, ensuring that your work has high visibility and significant influence.




Your role as a¬†Machine Learning Engineer at Apotea:

Build, deploy, and own end-to-end ML systems¬†‚Äì from prototyping to maintaining production models, ensuring scalability, reliability, and alignment with team strategy.
Turn models into real-world solutions¬†‚Äì integrate ML into products that deliver measurable business value.
Apply MLOps and¬†DevOps best practices¬†‚Äì use CI/CD, IaC, and cloud native solutions¬†to deploy and monitor models.
Collaborate across teams¬†‚Äì work with Data Engineers, Software Engineers,¬†Tech Lead, and Product Owner to align on data, integrations, architecture, and goals.
Define metrics and evaluation processes¬†- establish performance metrics, evaluation and validation frameworks aligned with business logic and requirements
Take proactive initiatives¬†- continuously identify and implement improvements to boost team productivity and solution quality
Mentor junior engineers¬†- provide technical guidance, code reviews, and care for the junior engineers in the team.




Who you are?

We‚Äôre seeking Machine Learning Engineers with diverse skills and a passion for solving complex problems and business impact.




You‚Äôre an ML EXPERT who:

‚Ä¢¬†Ships models to production, not just notebooks

‚Ä¢ Speaks the language of both algorithms and business KPIs

‚Ä¢ Stays ahead of the curve on AI/ML breakthroughs

‚Ä¢ Is proficient in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.




You‚Äôre an ENGINEER who:

‚Ä¢ Writes code that outlasts the current project

‚Ä¢ Thinks in systems, not just scripts

‚Ä¢ Tests obsessively (A/B testing solutions, End-to-End testing softwares) and documents proactively

‚Ä¢ Knows cloud infra like the back of your hand (AWS preferred)




Bonus points for experience with:

‚Ä¢ Implementing CI/CD pipelines, MLOps practices, and infrastructure-as-code for robust and repeatable deployments

‚Ä¢ Feature stores and real-time inference pipelines

‚Ä¢ Open data formats like Delta Lake or Iceberg

‚Ä¢ Swedish language skills (not required, but a plus)




What Apotea Offer You

The chance to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that impact millions of customers.
Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics
Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
Own projects from concept to deployment
A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.




About Apotea

Apotea.se¬†is Sweden‚Äôs largest online pharmacy, with the country‚Äôs broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden‚Äôs most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Liding√∂, and Morgong√•va.




Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.




Location:¬†Sveav√§gen 168, Stockholm, Sweden

  • Take proactive initiatives - continuously identify and implement improvements to boost team productivity and solution quality

Bonus points for experience with:

‚Ä¢ Feature stores and real-time inference pipelines

‚Ä¢ Open data formats like Delta Lake or Iceberg

‚Ä¢ Swedish language skills (not required, but a plus)


What Apotea Offer You

  • The chance to work on cutting-edge AI and ML projects that impact millions of customers.
  • Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
  • Drive sustainability through eco-friendly packaging and logistics
  • Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
  • Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
  • Own projects from concept to deployment
  • A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.


About Apotea

Apotea.se is Sweden‚Äôs largest online pharmacy, with the country‚Äôs broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and over 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden‚Äôs most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Liding√∂, and Morgong√•va.


Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.


Location: Sveav√§gen 168, Stockholm, Sweden

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We‚Äôre democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels‚Äîa privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that‚Äôs not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We‚Äôve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Veo you will get to work on challenging problems and directly contribute to the value created by our AI-driven end-user products.

You will become part of our AI team, which comprises 15 researchers and engineers responsible for all stages in the machine learning lifecycles across different projects - from scoping and defining data annotation tasks to modeling, validation, and deployment. You will be free to determine the directions of the project you work on while also getting feedback and being encouraged to spar with the rest of the team to assist each other in improving and succeeding.

We stay current with the latest research and continuously discuss concepts and ideas in recent papers to assess their relevance to our tasks and product-specific challenges.

We are looking to add yet another ambitious, high-performing junior to senior engineer/researcher with proven experience from real-world machine learning projects to the team. Experience with computer vision is advantageous but not a must.

What you will do:



Train state-of-the-art machine learning models
Write efficient inference pipelines for cloud and edge
Define and supervise data annotation tasks
Improve evaluation schemes to increase understanding of model performance and shortcomings
Contribute to long-term planning and prioritization of tasks




What you will need:



MSc or PhD in a relevant field
Hands-on experience with real-world, large-scale machine-learning projects
Great coding skills
Skilled at both autonomous tasks and contributing to group efforts
Ability to examine details closely and critically




At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology ‚Äì with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Values We Hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

Job Type: Permanent

Industry: Financial Services / Capital Markets

Work Mode: Hybrid (On-site 4 days/week)




About the Client:

We have partnered with a Danish company specialising in Algorithmic Trading. The company has been the market leader in automating financial markets since 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




About the role:

As part of this role, you‚Äôll help design, optimize, and implement calibration and benchmarking frameworks, establish best practices for data processing pipelines, and prototype innovative predictive time-series models. With short feedback cycles, direct deployment, and minimal bureaucracy, your work will have immediate impact.




Team Environment:

You'll join a collaborative, intellectually curious team that values technical input and personal initiative. The group is composed of highly qualified researchers with deep experience in statistics, modelling, and machine learning, working closely with software engineering and trading teams. Knowledge-sharing is integral, and all members contribute code, ensuring mutual understanding across specialties.




Candidate Profile:

PhD or MSc in a quantitative discipline (engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics, or related fields)
3+ years of experience
Strong foundation in mathematics and statistics
Experience with the full machine learning development cycle‚Äîfrom data processing to deployment and monitoring
Proficiency in Python, especially for data processing and numerical analysis
Solid grasp of computer science principles
Analytical, scientific mindset
Right to work in Denmark(We can't offer sponsorship)




Bonus skills:

Experience handling large, complex datasets
Familiarity with frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, XGBoost, or CatBoost
Additional programming experience in languages like C# or C/C++




What‚Äôs offered:

Flat organizational structure fostering trust and autonomy
Challenging, interesting problems to solve
Supportive and highly skilled team
Modern workspace with a hybrid work model
Comprehensive benefits including pension, health insurance, and generous leave

Title: Data Scientist, Corporate Health, Safety & Environment
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you enthusiastic about data and have a desire to contribute to positive change? We‚Äôre seeking a Data scientist to join our team to contribute to Lundbeck‚Äôs ESG reporting and deliver meaningful insights through data-driven assessments.

For over a decade, we have reported on our sustainability efforts, the most important challenges and the impact on our business, stakeholders and the societies in which we operate. In the coming years we see an increase in expectations on transparency, consolidation into formal frameworks and requirements for corporate sustainability reporting and insights. Based on this, we have a new job opening in our Corporate Health, Safety & Environment team.

Your new role

As a Data Scientist in our Corporate Health, Safety, and Environment department, you will play a key role in collecting, managing, transforming, and visualizing ESG-related data to support our sustainability initiatives and reporting requirements. You will work with data related to climate change, waste, the circular economy, water, health and safety, and more. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will help ensure that accurate, meaningful data is available to drive informed decision-making and fulfill reporting obligations.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection:


Gather ESG data from various internal and external sources.
Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Develop and implement data collection methodologies and tools.



Data Storage and Management:


Design and maintain databases and data storage solutions for ESG data.
Implement data governance and internal control
Ensure efficient and scalable data storage systems.



Data Transformation:


Clean, preprocess, and transform raw data into usable formats.
Develop algorithms and models to analyze ESG data.
Identify trends, patterns, and insights from data.



Data Visualization:


Create visualizations and dashboards to communicate ESG data effectively.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data visualization needs.
Prepare and present data insights to domain experts, decision makers and other stakeholders.



What You Bring To The Team

Whether your greatest strength is in solving technical challenges or igniting enthusiasm in delivering quality products, your colleagues would agree that you are a role model in collaboration and co-creation, and that you are technically adept. You are passionate about leveraging technology to deliver best-in-class data models.

In addition, you have:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Environmental Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in data collection, management, transformation, and visualization.
Experience with dimensional modelling
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, SQL).
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI or SAC).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.



Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you‚Äôre not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include your motivation for applying. No separate cover letter is needed. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions or want to hear more, please feel free to contact Danny Alves Ferreira, ESG Analyst at DAVF@Lundbeck.com

Applications must be received by 31 of August 2025.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).
