HTML:
Are you enthusiastic about data and have a desire to contribute to positive change? We‚Äôre seeking a Data scientist to join our team to contribute to Lundbeck‚Äôs ESG reporting and deliver meaningful insights through data-driven assessments.

For over a decade, we have reported on our sustainability efforts, the most important challenges and the impact on our business, stakeholders and the societies in which we operate. In the coming years we see an increase in expectations on transparency, consolidation into formal frameworks and requirements for corporate sustainability reporting and insights. Based on this, we have a new job opening in our Corporate Health, Safety & Environment team.

Your new role

As a Data Scientist in our Corporate Health, Safety, and Environment department, you will play a key role in collecting, managing, transforming, and visualizing ESG-related data to support our sustainability initiatives and reporting requirements. You will work with data related to climate change, waste, the circular economy, water, health and safety, and more. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will help ensure that accurate, meaningful data is available to drive informed decision-making and fulfill reporting obligations.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection:

  • Gather ESG data from various internal and external sources.
  • Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
  • Develop and implement data collection methodologies and tools.


Data Storage and Management:

  • Design and maintain databases and data storage solutions for ESG data.
  • Implement data governance and internal control
  • Ensure efficient and scalable data storage systems.


Data Transformation:

  • Clean, preprocess, and transform raw data into usable formats.
  • Develop algorithms and models to analyze ESG data.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and insights from data.


Data Visualization:

  • Create visualizations and dashboards to communicate ESG data effectively.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data visualization needs.
  • Prepare and present data insights to domain experts, decision makers and other stakeholders.


What You Bring To The Team

Whether your greatest strength is in solving technical challenges or igniting enthusiasm in delivering quality products, your colleagues would agree that you are a role model in collaboration and co-creation, and that you are technically adept. You are passionate about leveraging technology to deliver best-in-class data models.

In addition, you have:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Environmental Science, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in data collection, management, transformation, and visualization.
  • Experience with dimensional modelling
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, SQL).
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI or SAC).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you‚Äôre not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include your motivation for applying. No separate cover letter is needed. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions or want to hear more, please feel free to contact Danny Alves Ferreira, ESG Analyst at DAVF@Lundbeck.com

Applications must be received by 31 of August 2025.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).

Title: Data Scientist for AI Centre of Excellence
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Would you like to be part of a team focused on solving real-world business problems by transforming our approach to how we work with data and AI/machine learning at scale at Danske Bank?

With clear ties to our Forward ‚Äô28 Group Strategy, Group Data & Analytics is now creating the foundation for leveraging data and AI/ML capabilities. We are currently ramping up to build a highly specialised team that partners with our core business and development teams to deliver solutions that elevate data-driven decision-making and add value to our portfolio of existing and new IT applications.

To do so, we have recently established an AI & Data Science team that will empower the organisation to leverage data and AI technologies to deliver business value and benefits.

Not only do we want to build things right, but just as importantly, we want to build the right things‚Äîwhich, in the era of AI and all the hype that comes with it, can be a challenge. You will play a key role in striking that balance.

As part of our migration to AWS, you will also be involved in moving to our future Data Science platform to help accelerate the impact of machine learning across Danske Bank. This will happen in close collaboration with peers in other teams across the organisation. You will promote clear directions for standards, best practices, and ways of working with data science as formulated by our team.

Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different levels of seniority in the role.

Please be informed that interviews will be held in mid-August.

About you:


Hands-on experimentation and proof-of-value in our lab environment
Scope and deliver end-to-end AI solutions
Guide and educate data scientists and data engineers throughout our organisation in relation to both methods and platform/tooling
Cultivate strong relationships with data scientists and business experts across the organisation


You will:


Outcome-oriented with a focus on solving problems
Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to bring the right stakeholders together
Curious about product development and technology trends, with a keen interest in knowledge and self-improvement
Strong in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning
Experience with the following or similar technologies: Python, Spark/PySpark, Airflow, SQL, Public cloud providers, particularly AWSD, databricks, FastAPI, MLflow, Monitoring frameworks (g., Prometheus, Grafana), Containerisation (g., Kubernetes, Docker, OpenShift), CI/CD, pipelines, Git/Azure DevOps
Upper-intermediate English skills
Experience with Design Thinking or a similar UX framework would be beneficial


‚ÄúWe believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.‚Äù

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If the position is located in Lithuania the monthly salary range will be from 2680 EUR to 4020 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package (benefits are only valid for Lithuania the same as the salary ranges) which includes:

Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.


Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits in Lithuania HERE .

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist.

Curiosity, excitement, teamwork, and a near-obsession with understanding our frontline business are what I believe it will take to co-create the best data and AI solutions for our business. If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Michael Thruesen on LinkedIn , and I will be happy to answer your questions!

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data scientist with a passion for language, logic, and large language models

To support our continued growth and innovation, we are seeking a Data scientist to join our team in Aarhus. This is a unique opportunity to combine your love of language, structure, and data models, to help shape how we use LLMs, and other machine learning technologies in customer-facing solutions.

Who We Are

Founded in a garage in 2016 and now headquartered in the heart of Aarhus, Adversus is a fast-growing SaaS company with a talented team of +50 colleagues. We‚Äôve established ourselves as a leading provider of cloud-based call center software, serving customers in more than 35 countries across the globe. We build smart, scalable solutions‚Äîand we always seek new ways to work smarter, not harder.

What You Will Be Doing

As our Data Scientist, you will help design, test, evaluate and refine the technologies that drive accurate, useful, and creative outputs from machine learning models. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and customer-facing teams to ensure our AI features are reliable, effective, and aligned with real-world needs.

You will play a critical role in unlocking the full potential of AI across our platform, helping our customers with automated workflows, content creation, quality assurance, and improving their interactions with our platform.

How We See You


A structured thinker with a flair for language and logic
Familiar with tools like OpenAI‚Äôs GPT-4, and prompt engineering best practices
Able to package AI interactions in a format suitable for API consumption.
A pragmatic engineer with a solid understanding of technology limits, but also keeping an eye on the opportunities
Comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced environment
You‚Äôre fluent in English, both written and verbal.


Key Responsibilities


Craft, and iterate on effective inputs to power AI-driven features
Collaborate with development teams to integrate AI outputs into product workflows
Evaluate model behavior, identify edge cases, and propose improvements
Maintain libraries and documentation for internal use
Explore fine-tuning, embeddings, and retrieval techniques to improve performance
Stay up-to-date with AI advancements and bring fresh ideas to the team


If you‚Äôre a language lover, systems thinker, and AI enthusiast ready to turn creativity into capability, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Who You Are




AI Enthusiast: You're excited about the AI revolution and actively experiment with new AI tools daily

Pragmatic Builder: You ship fast, iterate quickly, and use AI to eliminate boilerplate and accelerate development

Startup Mindset: Comfortable with ambiguity, wearing multiple hats, and context-switching between diverse projects

Tool Maximiser: You know how to squeeze every drop of value from AI assistants, turning them into true pair programmers

Continuous Learner: The AI landscape changes weekly, and you're always exploring the latest tools and techniques

Impact-Driven: You measure success by delivered value, not lines of code written

Collaborative: You share AI discoveries with the team and help others level up their AI-augmented development skills




We Offer




Work at the forefront of AI-augmented software development
Freedom to experiment with cutting-edge AI tools and techniques
Diverse projects spanning the entire stack - no two days are the same
Direct impact on product direction in a fast-growing SaaS company
Modern office in vibrant √òsterbro with hybrid work flexibility
Budget for AI tools and subscriptions
Lunch with the team in Copenhagen
Dynamic startup environment where your ideas matter
Competitive compensation




Role Responsibilities




AI-Powered Development: Use Cursor, Claude Code, and similar tools to rapidly build features across the stack

Rapid Prototyping: Leverage AI to create POCs and MVPs in hours/days instead of weeks

MCP Server Development: Build and maintain MCP servers for enhanced AI tool integration

Full Stack Implementation: Jump between React frontends, .NET APIs, Python scripts, and infrastructure as needed




What You'll Build




Frontend features using React
Backend APIs in .NET
Python automation scripts for data processing and integrations
MCP servers that give AI tools access to our domain-specific knowledge
Infrastructure-as-code
Rapid prototypes for new features, leveraging AI to go from idea to demo in hours
Internal tools and utilities that boost team productivity




Required Experience




Generalist Background: 4+ years as a full-stack developer, comfortable with frontend, backend, and some DevOps (.NET or Node JS, RESTful API's, React, Typescript, Azure Cloud, Azure DevOps, SQL, Git)

Startup Experience: Proven track record in fast-paced environments where you owned projects end-to-end

AI Tool Mastery:

Daily hands-on experience with AI coding assistants (Cursor, Claude Code, or similar)
Demonstrated ability to use AI for rapid prototyping and development acceleration
Examples of projects where AI tools provided significant productivity gains

MCP Server Expertise:

Built and deployed MCP servers
Integrated MCP servers with development workflows
Understanding of how to expose domain knowledge to AI assistants

AI Integration Experience:

Integrated LLMs into applications (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.)
Built AI-powered features or automations
Experience with prompt engineering and AI workflow optimisation




Preferred Experience




Fashion/E-commerce: Understanding of PLM or retail tech

Open Source: Contributions to AI tooling or MCP server ecosystem

Automation: Built tools that automate repetitive development tasks




If this sounds like you then please apply üöÄ

Title: Data Scientist in the Explorative Biochemical Analytics Department, R&D Novonesis
Place: H√∏rsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity‚Äôs biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It‚Äôs how we've gotten so far. And it‚Äôs how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We‚Äôre here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Data Scientist in the Explorative Biochemical Analytics Department, R&D Novonesis

Are you passionate about developing data flows, and solving real-world problems in biotechnology using data-driven decisions? Do you have experience with databases and a mindset for creating solutions for users to work smarter and not harder? Then you might be our new data scientist.

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Scientist who thrives in a collaborative environment and is excited to work across a broad variety of data types and scientific workflows. You‚Äôll play a key role advancing our digital infrastructure by designing data pipelines and creating intuitive visualizations to support our scientists and business stakeholders. Furthermore, you will be anchored in key R&D projects to contribute with advanced data analysis for the development of new biosolutions.

Welcome to Explorative Biochemical Analytics Department

The Explorative Biochemical Analytics Department develops biochemical methods and provides qualitative and quantitative data of small molecules, peptides, proteins and polysaccharides in biological matrices for use in projects and product development.

We primarily use liquid chromatography as separation technique and mass spectrometry, UV, infrared spectroscopy, and light scattering for detection. We are active in many projects to accelerate mode of action understanding and to improve the chemical characterization of existing and future enzymatic and microbial products.

Key Responsibilities


Design and implement data pipelines for diverse biochemical analyses, ensuring seamless integration between our laboratories and data infrastructure.
Collaborate closely with scientists and lab technicians to understand experimental workflows, ensure accurate data capture, and provide tailored data solutions to support research objectives.
Build data solutions and interactive visualizations to provide researchers with ‚Äúone-click‚Äù access to analyses, dashboards, and metrics.
Collaborate with scientists to solve data challenges (e.g., developing apps, datasets, performing biochemical data analysis, etc).
Represent the team in data governance initiatives across Novonesis
Provide mentorship and training to team members on data science methodologies, tools, and best practices.
Define and implement best practices for managing FAIR biochemical data.


To Succeed You Must Hold


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in biology, biotechnology, bioinformatics, pharma, or similar field, with strong biological literacy.
Master‚Äôs degree in data science or related discipline with 3+ years of experience working in this area.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and app development.
Experience working with SQL and relational databases.
Experience working with unstructured or semi-structured data from laboratory systems, instruments, or experimental outputs.
A strong communicator who can collaborate with colleagues from a variety of backgrounds including chemists, microbiologists, lab technicians and IT professionals.


Other Skills That Are Preferable


Hands-on experience building apps using Dash, Streamlit, or similar platforms.
Strong foundation in statistics and multivariate data analysis techniques.
Practical experience in applying machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification, clustering) to analyze and interpret complex biological or biochemical datasets.
Experience working with large-scale scientific datasets, such as omics data, or time-series laboratory data.


Location: This job will be located at Novonesis Innovation Campus in H√∏rsholm, Denmark.

Application deadline: August 25th 2025. Please apply as soon as possible as we will continuously screen the applicants.

Contact details: Department Manager Bruna Marques dos Santos, e-mail: bmds@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following


Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.


If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.

  • Collaborate closely with scientists and lab technicians to understand experimental workflows, ensure accurate data capture, and provide tailored data solutions to support research objectives.
  • Build data solutions and interactive visualizations to provide researchers with ‚Äúone-click‚Äù access to analyses, dashboards, and metrics.
  • Collaborate with scientists to solve data challenges (e.g., developing apps, datasets, performing biochemical data analysis, etc).
  • Represent the team in data governance initiatives across Novonesis
  • Provide mentorship and training to team members on data science methodologies, tools, and best practices.
  • Define and implement best practices for managing FAIR biochemical data.

To Succeed You Must Hold

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in biology, biotechnology, bioinformatics, pharma, or similar field, with strong biological literacy.
  • Master‚Äôs degree in data science or related discipline with 3+ years of experience working in this area.
  • Proficiency in Python for data analysis and app development.
  • Experience working with SQL and relational databases.
  • Experience working with unstructured or semi-structured data from laboratory systems, instruments, or experimental outputs.
  • A strong communicator who can collaborate with colleagues from a variety of backgrounds including chemists, microbiologists, lab technicians and IT professionals.

Other Skills That Are Preferable

  • Hands-on experience building apps using Dash, Streamlit, or similar platforms.
  • Strong foundation in statistics and multivariate data analysis techniques.
  • Practical experience in applying machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification, clustering) to analyze and interpret complex biological or biochemical datasets.
  • Experience working with large-scale scientific datasets, such as omics data, or time-series laboratory data.

Location: This job will be located at Novonesis Innovation Campus in H√∏rsholm, Denmark.

Application deadline: August 25th 2025. Please apply as soon as possible as we will continuously screen the applicants.

Contact details: Department Manager Bruna Marques dos Santos, e-mail: bmds@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following

  • Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
  • Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.

If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Her er vores CV

N√•r nu vi beder dig om et CV, er det vist kun fair, at du ogs√• f√•r vores.

Vi hedder Vertica, og vi er en h√∏jt specialiseret virksomhed inden for digital forretningsudvikling og ecommerce-l√∏sninger. Vi har mere end 20 √•rs erfaring, og vi har lige nu ansvaret for 150 verticanere fordelt p√• vores kontorer i hjertet af Aarhus og K√∏dbyen i K√∏benhavn.

Vi har lavet prisvindende ecommerce-l√∏sninger for nogle af de st√∏rste og mest ambiti√∏se e-handelsvirksomheder i Danmark s√•som S√∏strene Grene, Br√∏drene Dahl, H√∏rkram og Louis Poulsen. Arbejde, der kr√¶ver bred faglig viden om alt fra teknisk forretningsudvikling, softwareudvikling og QA til projektledelse, UX og digitalt design.

Vi tror meget p√• vigtigheden af en god arbejdskultur, og vi er stolte af at have bygget en, der beror p√• faglig stolthed, videndeling, personlig udvikling og flere sociale arrangementer, end du nogensinde f√•r tid til.

S√• vi kan lidt af hvert, og vi synes, du skal v√¶lge os.

Din nye hverdag

Som en del af vores AI og Data-team arbejder du sammen med et team af kolleger med forskellig baggrund og kompetencer. Det, der binder jer sammen, er jeres store interesse for data, AI og forretningsudvikling ‚Äì og hvordan vi i Vertica kan hj√¶lpe vores kunder med at oms√¶tte data til vigtige indsigter, som kan v√¶re med til at flytte og styrke vores kunders forretning. I din rolle kommer du med det rette data p√• det rette tidspunkt og i den rette kvalitet. Du skaber s√•ledes et st√¶rkt fundament for, at vores kunder har nem adgang til at arbejde med data. Da vi er en konsulentvirksomhed, vil vores opgaver variere afh√¶ngigt af vores kunders behov. Dog kan vi fort√¶lle, at vores fokus er at udvikle AI l√∏sninger til ecommerce, hvor vi laver alt fra conversational agents til dynamisk priss√¶tning.

Vi forestiller os, at du skal arbejde med f√∏lgende.



Designe, bygge og levere v√¶rdiskabende AI l√∏sninger til en bred r√¶kke af kunder i samarbejde med resten af AI og Data teamet‚ÄØ
V√¶re med til at finde de bedste l√∏sninger baseret p√• kundernes √∏nsker og behov
Udvikle og implementere robuste metoder til evaluering og overv√•gning, s√• vi sikrer h√∏j kvalitet i vores l√∏sninger.
Udvikle produktionsklar Python kode‚ÄØ
Bidrage til at definere best practices og standarder for data science i organisationen
F√∏lge og arbejde p√• projekter fra start til slut samt endeligt at s√¶tte l√∏sningen i produktion



Dit fundament

Vi forestiller os, at du har minimum 3 √•rs relevant erhvervserfaring samt har et solidt teknisk grundlag og evnerne og forst√•elsen for at drive processer fra start til slut.‚ÄØMen vigtigst af alt er, at du er passioneret omkring AI og har lyst til at drive vores forretning til nye h√∏jder sammen med resten af teamet.

Det er et plus, hvis du har erfaring med hele machine learning lifecycle eller har erfaring med at arbejde med forskellige dataplatforme.

Derudover l√¶gger vi v√¶gt p√•, at:



Du har erfaring som konsulent og motiveres af at arbejde med AI projekter samt hj√¶lpe kunder med at finde den bedste l√∏sning til deres udfordringer‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Du har erfaring med at s√¶tte machine learning modeller eller AI l√∏sninger i produktion‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Du har st√¶rke f√¶rdigheder og god erfaring med Python‚ÄØ
Du har flair og interesse for at arbejde med en bred vifte af AI l√∏sninger



Fik vi n√¶vnt‚Ä¶

At vi ikke har nogen chefer. Her er der ingen, der bestemmer, hvordan du skal arbejde. Vi har sat beslutningerne fri, s√• dem der har faglighed og kompetence selv bestemmer, hvordan de l√∏ser opgaverne. Det betyder, at du og dit team f√•r mulighed for at indrette jeres arbejde, s√•dan som I mener, det er bedst.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

At gennemsigtighed er en af kernev√¶rdierne i Vertica, og derfor ligger vores personaleh√•ndbog frit tilg√¶ngeligt online. I personaleh√•ndbogen kan du l√¶se, hvilke vilk√•r vi - og alle vores fremtidige kolleger - arbejder under. Hvis ikke du har tid til at l√¶se hele h√•ndbogen igennem, s√• har vi fremh√¶vet nogle af dem, vi s√¶tter s√¶rligt pris p√•.

At vi tror p√• livslang l√¶ring: Vi g√•r i livets skole, men af og til er der ogs√• kurser, konferencer eller uddannelser, som man kan l√¶re af. Er der noget, du gerne vil blive klogere p√•, har du muligheden for at videreuddanne dig i Vertica. Vi har intet loft p√• uddannelsesbudgettet, s√• der heller ikke er loft p√• l√¶ringen.

At vi er hamrende sociale: Vi holder af sociale arrangementer, og vi holder mange af dem. Det kan v√¶re alt fra klatring, padeltennis, byg-dit-eget-tastatur og cocktail-kursus til familietur i Djurs Sommerland. Derudover tager vi hvert √•r p√• en firmaweekend, hvor vi har fokus p√• hygge, god mad og socialt samv√¶r.

At vi er hele mennesker p√• arbejde: Vi tror p√• at der er andet i livet end arbejde og derfor er det vigtigt for os, at vi holder os inden for en 37-timers arbejdsuge, og at vi behandler hinanden med stor ordentlighed og respekt

Title: Mid-level Data Scientist ‚Äì Applied AI (B2C)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Trustpilot, we're on an incredible journey. We're a profitable, high-growth FTSE-250 company with a big vision: to become the universal symbol of trust. We run the world's largest independent consumer review platform, and while we've come a long way, there's still so much exciting work to do. Come join us at the heart of trust!

From millions of reviews to rich user interaction data, we have a vast amount of behavioral and content data that powers our consumer platform. In the B2C Applied AI team, we‚Äôre focused on leveraging AI and ML to improve how people discover, interact with, and trust businesses on Trustpilot.

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our B2C Applied AI team to build intelligent, data-driven product features that improve user experience and deliver business impact. You will collaborate closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, designers, data analysts, and ML engineers to develop and maintain impactful AI/ML models at scale.

To succeed in this role, you‚Äôll bring hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning solutions, especially in areas such as ranking, search, recommendations, and personalization. You‚Äôll also demonstrate a strong understanding of user behavior data and how to use it to influence product development. A product mindset and ability to work cross-functionally are essential.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Great opportunity to make a real product impact by applying the state of the art in AI and ML.
Work on some of our most exciting Data Science initiatives aimed at improving the Trustpilot consumer experience: from ranking and recommendations to natural language processing and search.
Build, deploy, and maintain production-ready ML models that directly power features used by millions of users.
Collaborate closely with engineers, product managers, and designers to develop user-facing features informed by ML and experimentation.
Use data and model insights to identify new opportunities for personalization and discovery across our platform.
Take ownership of specific ML features or components and drive them from concept to production and iteration.
Work with leading tools such as GCP Vertex AI, BigQuery, Airflow, and emerging ML technologies.
Be a part of a friendly, diverse, innovative, international team and workplace that encourages learning and growth.


Who You Are


Experience working in a Data Science or Machine Learning role, ideally on consumer-facing products like search, ranking, recommendations, personalization, or discovery.
Strong hands-on ability with ML modeling, including semantic search, ranking algorithms, clustering, recommendation systems, and natural language processing (NLP), with a track record of deploying models to production.
Strong skills in data analysis, statistical modeling, and computational problem-solving; ideally with a background in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science.
Comfortable working with large-scale data and behavioral/user interaction data, and using it to build impactful, data-driven product features.
Proficient in Python and SQL, and confident working across the full ML lifecycle from exploration to deployment.
Experience with cloud platforms like GCP (preferred), AWS, or Azure, and tools such as BigQuery, Vertex AI, and Airflow.
Familiarity with ML production tooling and infrastructure, including CI/CD workflows.
Comfortable using metrics to monitor, iterate, and improve model performance.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äî able to engage clearly and effectively with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
Collaborative and agile‚Äî experienced in working closely with Product Managers, UX Designers, and Engineers within cross-functional teams to create impactful solutions.
You take ownership, move quickly, and are driven to solve real user problems with scalable, measurable, and maintainable solutions.


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It‚Äôs complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever ‚Äî to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial ‚Äî we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we‚Äôre headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We‚Äôre driven by connection. It‚Äôs at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh ‚Äì‚Äì it‚Äôs built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We‚Äôre a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you ‚Äì‚Äì we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you‚Äôre ready to grow, let‚Äôs go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We‚Äôre a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you ‚Äì‚Äì we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you‚Äôre ready to grow, let‚Äôs go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Process Data Scientist
Place: Hiller√∏d, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site‚Äôs process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously ‚Äì with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site‚Äôs process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master‚Äôs degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hiller√∏d, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee‚Äôs home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hiller√∏d, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world‚Äôs most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare‚Äôs potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers‚Äô products ‚Äì enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another‚Äôs passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Data Scientist, Commercial Excellence - Denmark, Sweden, Netherlands, Finland, Germany or UK
Description:
Location

Viby J, DK Solna, SE Soederkulla, FI Leeds, GB Utrecht, NL Duesseldorf, DE

At Arla Foods, we are committed to creating the future of dairy through innovation, sustainability, and collaboration. As a farmer-owned cooperative and one of the world‚Äôs leading dairy companies, we produce household-favourite brands while striving to make a positive impact on people and the planet.

We are now looking for a data-driven, curious, and growth-minded Data Scientist to join our Commercial Excellence Team. If you are passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights and want to make a real business impact, this is your opportunity.

How You Will Make An Impact

As a Data Scientist in the NRM Centre of Excellence organisation, you will play a key role in supporting Arla‚Äôs growth and profitability ambitions across our European markets. This is a hands-on, operational role where you will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyse commercial data, develop advanced analytics tools, and translate insights into strategic decisions.

You will be the go-to expert for understanding our data landscape - identifying opportunities, addressing challenges, and helping shape the future of data science at Arla within the commercial space. Your key responsibilities will be to


Translate business objectives into data science problems and develop solutions that drive commercial value
Design, optimise, and deploy advanced analytics models to support NRM strategies
Continuously improve existing models and develop new ones to meet evolving business needs
Visualise insights using tools like Power BI and communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear, compelling way
Conduct exploratory data analysis, test hypotheses, and uncover trends and patterns
Ensure high-quality code, documentation, and scalable, stable solutions


What Will Make You Successful

We are looking for a Data Scientist who is not only technically skilled but also driven by curiosity and a passion for creating value. You are proactive and thrive on identifying opportunities for improvement, always ready to share new ideas and perspectives on how data can be leveraged to drive the business forward. Besides this, we imagine that you bring


A University degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, econometrics, mathematics, or data science
2-5 years of hands-on experience, where you have applied advanced analytics to real-world business problems
An analytical mindset with the ability to synthesize data from multiple sources
Proficiency in Python and/or R, and SQL
Experience working with large, complex datasets (e.g., Nielsen, SAP, retailer ePOS)
Strong understanding of relational databases (e.g., Oracle, SQL Server)
Advanced Excel skills and strong data visualization capabilities (PowerBI or similar)
Preferably experience with Databricks


What do we offer?

We are committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. You will join a market leader who produces nutritious household-favorite brands in a way that make things better for our customers, the farmers who own us, and the whole world.

Application and contact

Please apply as soon as possible as we process applications on an ongoing basis. If you have any specific questions about the role, please reach out to Harri H√§rk√∂nen, ‚ÄéHead of Commercial Digital Transformation, at +358 40 5534945.

Shape the Future of Dairy

Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to producing high-quality products while championing sustainability and innovation. We're passionate about people and our planet, striving to unleash the full potential in each of us. Our goal is to make healthy dairy nutrition and good food habits accessible to all. Join us at Arla Foods and become part of a worldwide cooperative dedicated to making a significant impact on the planet and steering the dairy industry towards a sustainable future.

We are devoted to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Diversity and collaboration are key to our success, propelling us to new heights in the dairy industry.

Ref. 103161

Title: AI Agent Engineer II
Description:
Job Description

The Agentic Tribe is revolutionizing the chatbot and voice assistance landscape with Gen3, a cutting-edge AI Agent system that's pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. Gen3 isn't your typical chatbot; it's a goal-oriented, dynamic, and truly conversational system capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting to user needs in real-time. By leveraging a multi-agent architecture and advanced language models, Gen3 delivers personalized and engaging user experiences, moving beyond scripted interactions to handle complex tasks and "off-script" inquiries with ease.

About The Role

We're seeking a passionate AI Agent Engineer to join our team. In this role, you'll contribute to innovating at the forefront of AI technology, focusing on developing and refining intelligent, autonomous agents that leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) to streamline operations. You'll be a key player in implementing and improving the cognitive architecture for our AI-powered applications, creating systems that can reason, plan, and execute complex, multi-step tasks. You'll primarily focus on defined project scopes and tasks, working under the guidance of more senior team members.

What You Will Do (Responsibilities)


Contribute to the design and development of robust, stateful, and scalable AI agents using Python and modern agentic frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex).
Support the evaluation and selection of appropriate foundation models and services from third-party providers (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Google), contributing to the analysis of their strengths, weaknesses, and cost-effectiveness for specific use cases.
Participate in the lifecycle of AI Agent deployment‚Äîcollaborate closely with your immediate team, including product managers and software engineers, to understand user needs for the features you're building.
Troubleshoot and debug AI systems to ensure optimal performance and reliability in production environments for assigned components.
Document development processes, code, and findings to ensure knowledge sharing and maintainability within the team.


Core Technical Competencies


Familiarity with LLM-Oriented System Design: Understanding of multi-step, tool-using agents (e.g., LangChain, Autogen). Basic understanding of prompt engineering, context management, and LLM behavior (e.g., hallucinations).
Tool Integration & APIs: Ability to integrate agents with external tools, databases, and APIs (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic) in secure execution environments.
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG): Understanding of RAG pipelines with vector databases.
Evaluation & Observability: Basic understanding of LLM evaluation frameworks and monitoring for latency and accuracy.
Safety & Reliability: Awareness of prompt injection and basic concepts of implementing guardrails and fallback strategies.
Performance Optimization: Basic understanding of managing LLM token budgets and latency.
Planning & Reasoning: Familiarity with concepts of agents with long-term memory and planning capabilities.
Programming & Tooling: Proficient in Python (Fast API) and LLM SDKs;


Bonus Points (Preferred Qualifications)


Bachelor's or Master's in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, NLP).
Understanding of foundational ML concepts (attention, embeddings, transfer learning).


The Interview Process

We are excited to learn more about you, so we want to be transparent about what you can expect from our interview process:


Initial Call with Talent Team - 15 mins
Interview with one member of the Hiring Team - 45 minutes
Take-home technical challenge
A technical interview with two of our developers to talk more in-depth about your technical experience and answer any questions you might have - 1 hour
Final interview with 2 of the following: CTO or Engineering Manager/Director - 45 minutes


About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk‚Äôs use of your personal information.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Data Scientist (Randers SV, DK, 8940)
Description:
14/08/2025

Group CFO

DNK-Randers, Danish Crown Vej

Data Scientist

Do you believe there‚Äôs a connection between bacon and data? Do you want to be part of a team whose mission is to turn data into delicious insights?

At Danish Crown, we believe that just as bacon is a key product in our portfolio, data is the essential ingredient that drives our innovation and success, helping us to optimize processes, predict trends, and maintain our leadership in the industry ‚Äì and we‚Äôre now looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team and help us in this journey ahead of us.

Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist at Danish Crown, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets to uncover valuable insights, developing predictive models, and working closely with cross-functional teams to drive data-informed decision-making. You will be involved in various projects, such as:


Commodity, livestock, and product forecasting.
Object detection and tracking in real-time video feeds from production sites.


Success starts with a team

You will become part of the Data Science team within the Data, Analytics & AI space in the Global IT department. We work on multiple initiatives for various business units, with tasks around delivering data analysis and insights, modelling of complex data sources, and research and implementation of machine learning and deep learning models for tasks such as time-series forecasting, image recognition, or natural language processing, amongst others.

We are curious about the latest developments in our space, and therefore actively encourage everyone to have an innovative mindset and propose their ideas for further incubation.

Key Responsibilities

You‚Äôll be part of helping Danish Crown become a data-first organization. Your main tasks will include:


Providing actionable insights, identify trends and measure performance by conducting advanced statistical and other analyses.
Developing analytical solutions by creating, testing and implementing complex models and algorithms.
Implementing scalable, sustainable solutions addressing business needs in collaboration with AI/ML and Data Engineers.
Explaining the design, functioning and output of analytical models/solutions to consumers.
Staying up to date with the latest trends and advancements in data science and machine learning.


Who are we looking for?

A passionate and detail-oriented colleague with a knack for uncovering insights from data, thriving in a collaborative environment and always eager to learn and apply new technologies.

With a strong analytical mindset, you enjoy solving complex problems and your excellent communication skills allow you to effectively convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

Additional Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.
Strong programming skills in Python. SQL is a plus.
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques.
Fluent in English. Understanding of Danish can be a plus.
Familiar with cloud platforms and version control.


Appetite For More?

If you have any questions about the position, please feel free to contact Manager, Data Science Global IT, Francesc Joan Riera at (+45) 60 90 67 72.

We review candidates continuously, so let us know why you are the right candidate for the job and send it together with your CV. We aim for a start, as soon as possible ‚Äì will wait for the right person.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers worldwide. From butchers to business developers, we're more than 24,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate-neutral by 2050 for better food and a brighter future.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you‚Ä¶


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You‚Äôll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion ‚Äì your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux‚Äô products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world‚Äôs 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Want to join us as we take AI to the next level? Then you might be our AI Engineer.

We are a market leader in the utilization of AI, including LLMs, and have even greater visions. In the Digital Incubation and AI team, we work both as an internal AI consultant and development team, and as a strategic team, shaping our approach and architecture around generative AI. And this is where you come in.

As our AI Engineer, you will collaborate with both your colleagues on the team, and stakeholders across the company to scope, develop, and deploy leading AI solutions, as well as help design and build the underlying AI infrastructure, including working directly with AI models.

The team you will be part of - Digital Incubation and AI

As part of our Digital, Data and IT (DDI) function of +200 employees, we support the GN Group across the world, delivering business critical applications and infrastructure.

As part of our inclusive and engaging team of AI developers, digital product designers, adoption specialists, and others, you will receive a warm welcome from all members.

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:

Your role will involve guiding the evolution of AI technologies through the selection, tweaking, and deployment of models, as well as crafting the core architecture and platforms, and developing solutions for end users.

Specifically, your work will include, but is not limited to, the following assignments


Scoping, planning, and development of AI solutions on various platforms.
Documenting existing processes as well as the developed solutions.
AI model development, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, model training and evaluation.
Participating and leading projects to scope, develop, and deploy value-driving solutions.
Further iterating solutions once they reach production in a DevOps setup.


You will be challenged with the complexity of a truly global organization and in this context, you will need to navigate across cultures, functions, and organizational levels.

To thrive in the role, we imagine that you:

We imagine that you are team-oriented and can manage your own tasks when necessary. You are result-oriented with an open mind-set for collaborating. You demonstrate accountability and are prepared to operate within a fluid work environment, having experience with Agile practices or being open to acquiring that knowledge.

Moreover, we imagine that you have:


A higher educational background within Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science or a related field of study.
Proficiency in relevant programming languages, such as Python (prioritized), Java, or C++.
Experience working with data and data libraries, such as NumPy and pandas.
Experience in designing and experimenting with algorithms and models for various use cases.
Familiarity with Azure app Service - and applicants with familiarity with Azure DevOps and experience with both open-source models and frameworks are encouraged to apply.
Fluency in written and spoken English, since it is essential you can communicate effortlessly with your colleagues, no matter where in the World they are. If you are fluent in one of the Scandinavian languages it is a benefit, but this not a perquisite for the position.


Your new position will benefit from your openness to learning and your inquisitive nature.

We encourage you to apply

Even if you don‚Äôt match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well.

We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process

All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. As such, we encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

How to apply?

Use the ‚ÄòAPPLY‚Äô link no later than 7th of September 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don‚Äôt wait to send yours.

On a time crunch? Feel free to only submit your up-to-date CV including a few sentences outlining your motivation for applying ‚Äì quick and easy.

If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Thomas Gr√∏nfeldt Senger, head of Digital Incubation and AI, on LinkedIn or on +45 27799947.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiast.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
üöÄ We're Hiring: MLOps Engineer | Copenhagen | Hybrid Work

Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)




Are you passionate about building reliable, scalable platforms for machine learning? We‚Äôre looking for an experienced IT Platform Engineer to help shape and support a cutting-edge MLOps environment that powers real-time model deployment and scoring across critical domains, including fraud detection and online payments.




üåç The Role

Join a collaborative squad focused on delivering a future-proof MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You'll take ownership of automating model life cycles‚Äîfrom development to deployment‚Äîand build CI/CD workflows, infrastructure as code, and robust ML pipelines that scale with enterprise needs.




üîß Tech You‚Äôll Use

Cloud: AWS (extensive use), Databricks
Languages: Python, PySpark
Infra: Terraform, Docker, GitHub Actions
Tools: MLflow for model tracking/versioning, container orchestration
Bonus: Experience with Kafka or Pub/Sub streaming is a big plus!




üéØ What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Develop and maintain automated pipelines for ML model training, validation, and inference
Build CI/CD workflows that seamlessly move models into production
Containerize ML workloads and manage infrastructure using best-in-class tools
Collaborate in an agile setup




üë§ About You

You bring at least 2 years of hands-on experience in MLOps, solid cloud knowledge, strong Python and infrastructure-as-code skills, and an eye for performance and reliability. You‚Äôre a proactive problem-solver, a team player, and passionate about scaling ML in production.




üíº What‚Äôs In It for You

A human-centred, inclusive work culture
Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)
Flexible hybrid working setup
Access to development programs and professional certifications
Comprehensive health, insurance, and well-being benefits
A competitive compensation package and extra leave options




üìçLocation: Copenhagen

üìÖ Apply now and help us transform how machine learning supports real-world impact.
