Title: Senior Data Scientist - Python & Azure
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At EY, we‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.

We‚Äôll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The opportunity

Join EY‚Äôs fast-growing AI & Data team and help us build a better working world with data. We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Scientist who can solve complex problems with data, create scalable machine learning solutions, and guide clients through their digital transformation journeys. If you're passionate about Python, thrive in Azure environments, and want to work at the forefront of AI innovation - this is your opportunity.

Your Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and data-driven solutions in Azure.
Lead end-to-end data science projects, from problem framing to model implementation and monitoring.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineers, cloud architects, and domain experts.
Translate business problems into analytical frameworks and actionable insights.
Present findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Mentor junior data scientists and contribute to EY‚Äôs internal knowledge base and best practices.


Skills And Attributes For Success


Strong proficiency in Python for data analysis, machine learning, and scripting.
Proven experience working with Microsoft Azure services (e.g., Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse).
Solid understanding of ML concepts, statistics, and model evaluation techniques.
Experience with data wrangling, feature engineering, and large-scale data processing.
Familiarity with DevOps/MLOps in cloud environments is a strong plus.
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively.
A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data science or advanced analytics roles.
Hands-on project experience deploying models in production environments using Azure.
Business acumen and experience working with clients or in consulting settings.
Proficiency in Danish


Ideally, you‚Äôll also have


Experience with other programming languages (e.g., R, SQL, Scala) or visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Experience in regulated industries such as healthcare, financial services, or energy.
Certifications in Azure Data Science or related cloud technologies.


What We Look For

We are seeking a dynamic and innovative individual who is passionate about continuous learning and professional growth. Flexibility and the ability to collaborate effectively in a global team are essential. We value integrity and expect our team members to uphold the highest ethical standards. Additionally, we are looking for someone who is driven to make a meaningful impact through their work.

What We Offer You

We offer a dynamic and inclusive workplace where innovation is encouraged. You will have opportunities for learning, certification, and career growth. We provide flexible working arrangements and foster global collaboration. You will have access to cutting-edge technologies and tools. Our purpose-driven culture values integrity, collaboration, and impact.

At EY, we‚Äôll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We‚Äôll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.

To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.
Show more
HTML:
At EY, we‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.

We‚Äôll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The opportunity

Join EY‚Äôs fast-growing AI & Data team and help us build a better working world with data. We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Scientist who can solve complex problems with data, create scalable machine learning solutions, and guide clients through their digital transformation journeys. If you're passionate about Python, thrive in Azure environments, and want to work at the forefront of AI innovation - this is your opportunity.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and data-driven solutions in Azure.
  • Lead end-to-end data science projects, from problem framing to model implementation and monitoring.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineers, cloud architects, and domain experts.
  • Translate business problems into analytical frameworks and actionable insights.
  • Present findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Mentor junior data scientists and contribute to EY‚Äôs internal knowledge base and best practices.

Skills And Attributes For Success

  • Strong proficiency in Python for data analysis, machine learning, and scripting.
  • Proven experience working with Microsoft Azure services (e.g., Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse).
  • Solid understanding of ML concepts, statistics, and model evaluation techniques.
  • Experience with data wrangling, feature engineering, and large-scale data processing.
  • Familiarity with DevOps/MLOps in cloud environments is a strong plus.
  • Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively.
  • A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in data science or advanced analytics roles.
  • Hands-on project experience deploying models in production environments using Azure.
  • Business acumen and experience working with clients or in consulting settings.
  • Proficiency in Danish

Ideally, you‚Äôll also have

  • Experience with other programming languages (e.g., R, SQL, Scala) or visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
  • Experience in regulated industries such as healthcare, financial services, or energy.
  • Certifications in Azure Data Science or related cloud technologies.

What We Look For

We are seeking a dynamic and innovative individual who is passionate about continuous learning and professional growth. Flexibility and the ability to collaborate effectively in a global team are essential. We value integrity and expect our team members to uphold the highest ethical standards. Additionally, we are looking for someone who is driven to make a meaningful impact through their work.

What We Offer You

We offer a dynamic and inclusive workplace where innovation is encouraged. You will have opportunities for learning, certification, and career growth. We provide flexible working arrangements and foster global collaboration. You will have access to cutting-edge technologies and tools. Our purpose-driven culture values integrity, collaboration, and impact.

At EY, we‚Äôll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We‚Äôll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.

To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Gr√ºn, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

Title: Senior ML Engineer (Generative AI & LLMs, Remote, Europe)
Description:
Lion Group is building a global network of elite AI talent. We partner with innovative SaaS, fintech, and creative tech companies to deliver world-class AI solutions. As part of our network, you‚Äôll work on challenging international projects, collaborate with top engineers, and stay at the forefront of AI innovation.

The Role

As a Senior AI Engineer, You Will


Design, train, and optimize large language models and generative AI applications
Implement AI pipelines, fine-tuning, and prompt engineering for production environments
Deploy scalable AI solutions in cloud-based infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Research and experiment with multimodal AI, agent workflows, and low-latency inference
Ensure model performance, reliability, and cost efficiency at scale
Collaborate with global teams to deliver impactful AI products


Ideal Profile


Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or PhD preferred) in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or related field
5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist, ML Engineer, or AI Researcher

Solid understanding of LLMs, NLP, and generative AI architectures
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Strong problem-solving mindset and ability to deliver production-ready solutions
Detail-oriented with a track record of high-quality work


What's on Offer?


Work on cutting-edge AI projects with leading U.S. and U.K. companies
Competitive salary (flexible for exceptional candidates)
Excellent career growth in a global talent network

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
There‚Äôs no quality healthcare without a quality platform. And no powerful AI without a developer experience that just works.

Doctors and nurses are facing immense pressure: growing administrative burdens, tighter resources, and the risk of burnout. They deserve tools that restore their focus on care, not paperwork. Corti began by building the world‚Äôs leading AI assistant for healthcare, supporting clinicians in real time by listening, documenting, prompting, and safeguarding critical conversations.

Now, we‚Äôre opening up that intelligence through our API platform‚Äîenabling developers, partners, and providers to build with Corti‚Äôs AI in their own tools and workflows. From ambient scribing to clinical decision support, our infrastructure is unlocking new ways to scale healthcare excellence.

Entire health systems trust Corti. Millions of patient interactions have already been improved by our AI. With your help, we‚Äôll reach millions more.

At Corti, we are growing fast and always looking for skillful people to ensure we go in the right direction. If you enjoy working in an autonomous and collaborative team, guided by shared values and a willingness to act, iterate, and learn, then join us at Corti as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer

üìå As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of our machine learning R&D team and work closely with our product teams. The machine learning R&D team consists of seasoned engineers as well as several Ph.D. students and postdocs collaborating with Danish and international universities. Our product teams are cross-functional and own product discovery and delivery end-to-end.

You can read more about our research and publications here: https://corti.ai/company/research

Our vision, products, and solutions to enrich patient consultations are described here: https://corti.ai/

In this role, you will work alongside our other machine learning engineers and researchers, developing new models, implementing state-of-the-art research outputs, and translating those outputs into tangible product outcomes. For example, you might be involved in the prototyping a new machine learning-based product feature in collaboration with other teams. Or you might work independently on taking state-of-the-art research and assessing how well it works in Corti‚Äôs domain. There are many possibilities and plenty of room for creativity and bringing in your own ideas.

The impact you'll have


Develop prototypes based on cutting-edge applied machine learning working on audio, text, and structured data sources.
Own the technical translation of state-of-the-art machine learning innovations to inform the development of new product features.
Design and implement well-defined APIs for new machine learning tools to make them available for customers and across the organization.
Participate in research ventures and drive publication at top machine learning venues or impactful digital medicine journals.
Improve healthcare globally as part of your daily work.


You'll thrive in this role if you have the following


A higher university degree or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related interdisciplinary field.
In-depth experience with Python and strong command of data structures and algorithms in order to contribute to production-grade code.
In-depth knowledge of one or more of the major machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow).
Experience building agents or agentic workflows
Ability to manage machine learning research projects and clearly communicate outcomes to technical and non-technical audiences.


Nice to have


Publication history at top machine learning venues (e.g., NeurIPS, ACL, or digital medicine journals) that shows that you can drive research projects.
Hands-on experience with automatic speech recognition or natural language processing.


Practicalities


The work location for this position is preferred in Copenhagen, but we can be flexible with the right candidate.
This is a full-time position, starting as soon as possible.


Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

ü§ù Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.Ôªø

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you‚Äôll consider applying!
Show more
HTML:
There‚Äôs no quality healthcare without a quality platform. And no powerful AI without a developer experience that just works.

Doctors and nurses are facing immense pressure: growing administrative burdens, tighter resources, and the risk of burnout. They deserve tools that restore their focus on care, not paperwork. Corti began by building the world‚Äôs leading AI assistant for healthcare, supporting clinicians in real time by listening, documenting, prompting, and safeguarding critical conversations.

Now, we‚Äôre opening up that intelligence through our API platform‚Äîenabling developers, partners, and providers to build with Corti‚Äôs AI in their own tools and workflows. From ambient scribing to clinical decision support, our infrastructure is unlocking new ways to scale healthcare excellence.

Entire health systems trust Corti. Millions of patient interactions have already been improved by our AI. With your help, we‚Äôll reach millions more.

At Corti, we are growing fast and always looking for skillful people to ensure we go in the right direction. If you enjoy working in an autonomous and collaborative team, guided by shared values and a willingness to act, iterate, and learn, then join us at Corti as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer

üìå As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of our machine learning R&D team and work closely with our product teams. The machine learning R&D team consists of seasoned engineers as well as several Ph.D. students and postdocs collaborating with Danish and international universities. Our product teams are cross-functional and own product discovery and delivery end-to-end.

You can read more about our research and publications here: https://corti.ai/company/research

Our vision, products, and solutions to enrich patient consultations are described here: https://corti.ai/

In this role, you will work alongside our other machine learning engineers and researchers, developing new models, implementing state-of-the-art research outputs, and translating those outputs into tangible product outcomes. For example, you might be involved in the prototyping a new machine learning-based product feature in collaboration with other teams. Or you might work independently on taking state-of-the-art research and assessing how well it works in Corti‚Äôs domain. There are many possibilities and plenty of room for creativity and bringing in your own ideas.

The impact you'll have

  • Develop prototypes based on cutting-edge applied machine learning working on audio, text, and structured data sources.
  • Own the technical translation of state-of-the-art machine learning innovations to inform the development of new product features.
  • Design and implement well-defined APIs for new machine learning tools to make them available for customers and across the organization.
  • Participate in research ventures and drive publication at top machine learning venues or impactful digital medicine journals.
  • Improve healthcare globally as part of your daily work.

You'll thrive in this role if you have the following

  • A higher university degree or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related interdisciplinary field.
  • In-depth experience with Python and strong command of data structures and algorithms in order to contribute to production-grade code.
  • In-depth knowledge of one or more of the major machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow).
  • Experience building agents or agentic workflows
  • Ability to manage machine learning research projects and clearly communicate outcomes to technical and non-technical audiences.

Nice to have

  • Publication history at top machine learning venues (e.g., NeurIPS, ACL, or digital medicine journals) that shows that you can drive research projects.
  • Hands-on experience with automatic speech recognition or natural language processing.

Practicalities

  • The work location for this position is preferred in Copenhagen, but we can be flexible with the right candidate.
  • This is a full-time position, starting as soon as possible.

Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

ü§ù Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.Ôªø

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you‚Äôll consider applying!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
üåü¬†Why You‚Äôll Love This

AI is rapidly evolving and changing how we build, work, and think. So far we‚Äôve been trailing behind a bit, but we are ready to catch up and figure out how best to utilize AI.

We are looking for an enthusiastic and skilled engineer to play a pivotal role in integrating artificial intelligence into both our daily work and our core product. This is an exciting opportunity to work across various departments, and help drive our AI initiatives forward.




üõ†¬†What You‚Äôll Be Doing

You‚Äôll be our internal AI champion ‚Äî researching, prototyping, and guiding us as we explore new ways to use modern AI tools.

¬†Here‚Äôs what your days might include:

Spotting AI opportunities in both our products and day-to-day workflows.
Building prototypes using tools like Claude, loveable, etc.
Automating repetitive tasks to improve efficiency and make work more enjoyable .
Testing new AI tools, exploring their limits, and recommending what to adopt.
Collaborating with teams such as product, engineering, and others to understand pain points and help find solutions (maybe using AI?).
Running small experiments, creating demos, and showcasing AI's potential to inspire others.




üôã¬†Who You Are

You are someone who loves to build things and have experience with modern AI tools.¬†No-code, low-code, dev-focused assistance, all of it is relevant for us.

You are great at running with an idea¬†and turning it into a prototype. Helping others see the value of AI assistance is your jam, and communicating complex information in a simple manner is something you excel at. Working with different departments and teams is a possibility to learn more and have a broader impact.¬†

Extra points if you:




Have experience working with C#.
Have previously worked in a SaaS company.
Know TypeScript /* or JS in general */
Have worked with product or design teams.




üßë‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüßë¬†Who We Are

At iPaper, we help retailers create better online shopping experiences. For years, we‚Äôve been the go-to platform for turning static PDFs into interactive, shoppable catalogues. Now, with Horizon, we‚Äôre taking it further, transforming product feeds into scrollable, mobile-friendly catalogues designed for today‚Äôs digital-first shoppers.

We‚Äôre a company of 40 people across many nationalities, based in Aarhus. We‚Äôre friendly, down-to-earth, and a little nerdy (in the best way). We genuinely enjoy spending time together - whether it‚Äôs solving tricky bugs, celebrating a launch, or sharing cake in the kitchen.

Our office is built for both focus and fun - think foosball table, PlayStation, VR gear, rooftop terrace, spontaneous grill sessions, and plenty of other social events small and large üî•

We‚Äôve been around since 2006, so we‚Äôre stable and profitable, but we‚Äôve kept part of that startup energy ‚Äî agile, curious, and full of heart. You‚Äôll be part of a company that cares deeply about the work and the people doing it.




üéÅ¬†What You‚Äôll Get




Hybrid work setup (we love the office but flexibility is key).
Flexible hours and work-life-balance.
Time and budget for personal development.
High-spec gear and modern tools.
A fun, inclusive, and nerd-friendly team .
The opportunity to help shape how we work with AI from the ground up.

Want more details? Check out our public employee handbook:¬†https://handbook.ipaper.io




‚úâÔ∏è¬†How to Apply

¬†We‚Äôve kept it simple. No resume. No cover letter.

¬†Just share your name, LinkedIn, and answer a few quick questions.




We‚Äôd love to hear from you.

¬†// The iPaper Team

Title: AI Solutions Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go we aim to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. 40% of all the food produced in the world is wasted, with a big impact on the planet: 10% of greenhouse gas emissions worldwide come from food loss and waste.

Too Good To Go operates the world‚Äôs largest B2C marketplace for surplus food. Through our app we connect businesses that have unsold, surplus food with consumers who can buy and enjoy it at a reduced price. We are a mission-driven certified B Corp.

We‚Äôre growing fast: Our community of over 124 million registered users across 19 countries has already saved more than 473+ million meals from going to waste - together avoiding more than 1.278.000 tonnes of CO2e from entering the atmosphere.

In 2023, Apple recognised Too Good To Go as Winner at the annual App Store Awards, for our app‚Äôs exceptional user experience and profound impact on society.

We always look for talented people with diverse backgrounds to join our team. Right now, we‚Äôre recruiting our very first AI Solutions Developer!

Your mission

As our AI Solutions Developer you will design and implement artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions that automate and optimize our commercial business processes, with the aim of driving Sales efficiency. You will partner with stakeholders across commercial, product and engineering teams to identify opportunities for process optimization by leveraging AI, and lead the design, testing and scaling of solutions, while ensuring alignment with technical standards, security, and compliance requirements.

You will tackle specific business challenges in our sales operations on a project basis, and leverage your deep knowledge of AI tools in the market to develop MVP solutions, and embed these into the daily sales processes.

By combining your technical skills and commercial understanding, you will help our sales teams across 19 countries work more effectively, spend time on what matters, ultimately leading to more food saved. This role will be based in Copenhagen and reports to our Chief Commercial Officer.

Role Description


Opportunity Identification: You will be gathering context of existing sales processes to assess key opportunities for automation and AI/ML solutions in our operations, challenging current setups, and being a sparring partner to the rest of the Global Commercial teams and broader organization.
Solution Design & Architecture: You will lead the end-to-end selection and design of AI/ML systems for commercial teams, from requesting data pipelines, selecting the appropriate models to use, sourcing/developing tools and prompts, and deploying and monitoring solutions.
Change Management: Your job is to drive change in the organization, and you will be working with other teams in the Global Commercial function to introduce new AI tools and improve ways of working in our operations for lasting impact.
Stakeholder Collaboration: The work is cross-functional by nature, and you will be engaging with colleagues across the company to map workflows and identify automation opportunities. You will be responsible for translating business needs into powerful technical solutions.
Platform & Tooling Selection: As an internal AI expert, you will be recommending which AI platforms and tools we should leverage in our commercial teams. You will oversee procurement and integration of third-party AI services in the Sales community, in close collaboration with our Tech and Legal teams.
Security & Compliance: You will be expected to comply with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and organizational security policies.
Community & Knowledge Sharing. As a domain expert, you will form a community with other data scientists, ML engineers, and developers in the company on AI practices, and be an ambassador of the AI journey across all teams.


Requirements


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
Solid experience with business process automation platforms and iPaaS solutions.
Strong understanding of APIs and webhook integrations.
Experience with JSON, data mapping, and transformation.
Proficiency in workflow logic, conditional operations, and error handling.
Experience designing and implementing automated workflow solutions using modern workflow automation platforms (such as Make.com, N8N, Zapier, or similar tools)
Strong AI prompting skills, experience leveraging APIs to connect data sources, and building MVP solutions.
Experience with project and change management, preferably from introduction of new tech solutions.
Good understanding of sales processes, preferably in a B2B environment.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We‚Äôre proud of the change we‚Äôre driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a global social impact company and certified B Corporation, where you can see real and tangible impact in your role.
Work alongside an international community of users, partners and 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries on the same important sustainability mission.
Personal and professional development in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work.
A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate success and socialise with colleagues that care.


Benefits


Work Flexibly
Enjoy hybrid working from our great offices, at home or abroad.
Extra parental leave and days off beyond local legislation and the option to take an extra week of unpaid leave
Health insurance and pension plans (subject to country of employment).
Additional days off for significant life events
Celebrate and Socialise
Regular social events like summer and winter parties.
Coffee, snacks and fully-equipped kitchens.
Get to know our community with a monthly free Surprise Bag.
Paid volunteer time through our Shareback volunteering programme
Women in the Workplace, P.R.I.D.E., People of Colour and Functionally Diverse Employee Resource Groups

How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: AI Engineer in leading SaaS Scale Up!
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Help us reinvent product lifecycle management, with AI | Copenhagen




We‚Äôre going AI-first, and we need someone who‚Äôs already built real things with AI agents and AI tooling. If you‚Äôve used GPT, LangChain, Claude, or similar to automate processes, integrate APIs, or create production-grade AI flows, this is your stage.




Our mission: build the most advanced, intelligent product lifecycle management (PLM) platform for the fashion and lifestyle industry. Our customers are global brands and suppliers who use our platform to collaborate, manage collections, and streamline every stage from idea to finished product. We help them digitize workflows, optimize resources, and make better decisions, faster.




This isn‚Äôt a research role. This is about building AI-driven tools that work, ship fast, and deliver impact.




What You‚Äôll Do

Build internal AI agents that automate everything from product data enrichment to supplier communication flows.
Use OpenAI (GPT-4o), LangChain, n8n, and custom .NET/React/Azure-based services to develop real, end-to-end solutions.
Translate domain knowledge (from product, customer success, and support teams) into prompt-based tools, scripts, and interfaces.
Develop backend logic in .NET and connect with our main platform via REST APIs, webhooks, and Azure services.
Collaborate directly with the founder, product team, and engineers to prioritize high-impact use cases.
Document and test your agents so they can scale across customers, countries, and product lines.
Optionally: build or connect frontend UIs in React or with low/no-code tools like Retool.




Who You Are

You have a Master‚Äôs degree or 3‚Äì5 years of relevant experience building software with AI agents or AI tooling, in production or through substantial real-world projects.
You‚Äôve already built real things with AI ‚Äì whether that‚Äôs agents, automations, prompt-driven workflows, or integrations between AI tools and APIs.
You‚Äôre comfortable with .NET/C#, React, REST APIs, and Azure-based databases/storage.
You‚Äôve used tools like LangChain, GPT, Claude, Supabase, or n8n, and ideally connected them together into working systems.
You love shipping fast, learning fast, and solving real customer problems.
You think in systems. You see the flow between tools, prompts, users, and data.
Bonus: experience with product lifecycle management, supply chain, or fashion industry workflows.




Why Join Us

Work on real-world AI problems, not gimmicks.
Be part of a small, ambitious, and product-driven team with deep market traction.
Ship and own projects that get used by brands and suppliers worldwide.
Help define how AI is applied in one of the most operationally complex and underserved domains: product development and collaboration.
Enjoy full autonomy, fast feedback loops, and the ability to shape the product and stack.
Based in Copenhagen? Great. Prefer hybrid or remote (within CET ¬±2)? Also great.




Tech Stack You‚Äôll Touch

GPT-4o / OpenAI Functions / Claude
LangChain / n8n
.NET / C# / React
Azure Functions, Azure Storage, Azure SQL
REST APIs (internal and customer)
Retool (optional)
Other tech stacks that can improve efficiency




Compensation

Competitive salary based on experience
Equity/warrants
Office in central Copenhagen with hybrid flexibility
Real ownership. No bureaucracy.




**OPEN TO EU RELOCATORS!**




Contact hiring manager, Luqman Mohammed-Brown at L.Mohammed-Brown@tenthrevolution.com if you have any questions.

  • Competitive salary based on experience
  • Equity/warrants
  • Office in central Copenhagen with hybrid flexibility
  • Real ownership. No bureaucracy.


**OPEN TO EU RELOCATORS!**


Contact hiring manager, Luqman Mohammed-Brown at L.Mohammed-Brown@tenthrevolution.com if you have any questions.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Senior Data Scientist

We are seeking an exceptional Senior Data Scientist to join our highly skilled team in Copenhagen. You will play a pivotal role in developing a state-of-the-art system that leverages Bayesian statistics and advanced theoretical concepts to estimate and understand the size of marketing and advertising audiences. This initiative is a cornerstone of Choreograph‚Äôs broader mission to revolutionise analytics capabilities across the organisation using AI and data science.

You will thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where objectives evolve rapidly and complex, abstract problems are the norm. If you are passionate about tackling challenging statistical and mathematical problems, and enjoy working collaboratively with other experts, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and implement Bayesian statistical models and other advanced analytical methods to estimate audience sizes and characteristics.
Collaborate closely with a multidisciplinary team to design, build, and refine data-driven solutions.
Write high-quality, production-ready Python code including package development, unit testing, and documentation.
Work independently to solve complex mathematical and conceptual problems with minimal supervision.
Engage in productive, abstract discussions with team members to untangle nuanced issues and arrive at robust solutions.
Contribute to code repositories using Git and participate in code reviews and version control best practices.
Utilize cloud computing resources for scalable data processing and model deployment.
Handle diverse data formats and ensure data integrity throughout the analytics pipeline.
Adapt quickly to changing project requirements and priorities.


Must-Have Qualifications & Skills


Postgraduate-level knowledge in probability and statistics, with a strong foundation in Bayesian methods.
Advanced Python programming skills, including experience with building packages, unit testing, and handling multiple data formats.
Demonstrated ability to solve complex mathematical and statistical problems.
Resilience and confidence in facing difficult, open-ended challenges.
Adaptability to dynamic, fast-changing environments, ideally with experience in startup-like or high-pressure settings.
Ability to work independently and creatively, finding solutions to novel problems with minimal supervision.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in discussing and resolving abstract or conceptual issues.
Familiarity with Git and repository management.
Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).


Nice-to-Have Skills & Experience


Programming experience in Scala and understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
Knowledge of set theory and propositional logic.
Background in media, advertising, or digital advertising analytics.
Familiarity with the unique challenges of audience measurement and marketing analytics.


What We Offer


The opportunity to work on cutting-edge analytics projects with global impact.
A collaborative, intellectually stimulating environment with leading experts.
Flexible, fast-moving work culture similar to a startup, within the stability of a global organization.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Access to world-class resources and professional development opportunities.


We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we‚Äôve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram,‚ÄØLinkedIn, and‚ÄØX.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Staff Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
Job Description

The Agentic Tribe is revolutionizing the chatbot and voice assistance landscape with Gen3, a cutting-edge AI Agent system that's pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. Gen3 is not your typical chatbot; it's a goal-oriented, dynamic, and truly conversational system capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting to user needs in real-time. By leveraging a multi-agent architecture and advanced language models, Gen3 delivers personalized and engaging user experiences, moving beyond scripted interactions to handle complex tasks and "off-script" inquiries with ease.

We are delighted to be hiring a Staff Machine Learning Scientist for the AI Agent product at Zendesk. You will own a designated product area and revolutionize how our customers experience our products. This is an exciting opportunity to bridge the gap between cutting-edge ML research and real-world impact. You'll have the freedom to shape the product roadmap, discover innovative ML applications, and collaborate with a talented cross-functional team.

What You Will Do (Responsibilities)


You'll be part of a team responsible for designing and testing novel AI solutions for real business problems
You'll own the full research projects end-to-end from understanding business requirements to design, implementation, experimentation and reporting
You'll discuss your and others ideas in the research team regularly and provide peer review for your colleagues work
You'll keep up with the NLP and ML fields and literature and introduce new concepts discovered as potential solutions to our business problems
You'll work closely with AIengineers helping them implement your designs into our production system
You'll use suitable tools and technologies for rapid implementation and quickly testing your hypotheses while keeping in mind the requirements of future production implementation
You‚Äôll collaborate with Product managers and other non technical stakeholders to discover product roadmap.


Who You Are


Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.
Proven record of Machine Learning or NLP research, ideally in industry.
Knowledge of building deep learning neural network architectures, ideally with focus on NLP.
Ability to implement ideas from research literature into proof-of-concept models.
Practical approach for researching machine learning solutions to business problems.
Huge bonus if you have experience with LLMs, Prompt Engineering and AI Agent Context Management.
Ideally have experience with conversational AI and voice technologies, including text-to-speech (TTS) and speech-to-speech (STS).
A positive, pro-active team player who is passionate about their craft, is keen to take part in product discussions and cares about helping the team deliver.
Great communication skill and fluency in English.


How do we measure success in this role?


How well your work aligns with the overall product roadmap and strategic goals.
Effectiveness in collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders
Discovery and Ideation - ability to identify new opportunities within the product area, as well as their ability to prioritize and champion these ideas.


The Interview Process

We are excited to learn more about you, so we want to be transparent about what you can expect from our interview process:


Initial Call with Talent Team - 15 mins
Interview with one member of the Hiring Team - 45 minutes
Take-home technical/research challenge
A technical interview with two of our scientists to talk more in-depth about your technical experience and answer any questions you might have - 1 hour
Final interview with 2 of the following: CTO or Engineering Manager/Director - 45 minutes


About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk‚Äôs use of your personal information.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Research Scientist in Microbial Screening
Place: H√∏rsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity‚Äôs biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It‚Äôs how we've gotten so far. And it‚Äôs how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We‚Äôre here to better our world with biology.

Welcome to Microbial screening

We identify and deliver lead strains to drive the development of new products across various business areas within Novonesis. Microbial Screening comprises four departments dedicated to maintaining and expanding the Novonesis Culture Collection, as well as selecting lead candidates for a variety of food product areas by screening strain libraries using state-of-the-art screening technologies.

Join us as our new scientist in Strain Screening

Become part of a passionate team and make a difference using innovative technology. You will join a dedicated team of scientists and technicians based in H√∏rsholm. Together, we focus on developing and utilizing high-throughput screening technology to analyze large biological libraries, identifying and isolating promising candidates.

In This Role You‚Äôll Make An Impact By


Contributing to our cross-functional new product development teams from early idea scoping to late stage and deliver the next generation innovative culture solutions focusing on Cheese, Fresh Dairy, Bioprotection and Plant-based food product categories.
Supporting the discovery of new biological solutions using state-of-the-art screening technology
Continuously advancing our screening platforms and exploring novel applications to drive innovation.


What We‚Äôre Looking For


Ph.D degree in Food Science, Biotechnology or related field (e.g. microbiology)
Expertise in developing and optimizing assays for high-throughput screening
A passion for innovative technology combined with a commitment to continuous learning
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a collaborative and inclusive mindset.
Strong project management abilities, ensuring timely and accurate completion of task(s).
Have excellent experimental planning and data analysis skills, coupled with curiosity about digitalization advancements.


Experience In The Following Areas Will Be Highly Valued


In-depth knowledge of cheese and yogurt fermentation processes.
Expertise in texture measurements
Programming skills and analysis of large datasets


Application deadline: 24th of August 2025. We will screen applications and invite for interviews after the deadline.

Location: H√∏rsholm, Denmark

Contact details: If you have any questions, you are more than welcome to reach out to Head of Strain Screening, Jakob Frimodt-Moeller on jakr@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following


Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.


If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you curious about modern software development and looking for your next challenge? At Deloitte Engineering, we are seeking recent graduates and candidates with up to two years of full-time experience in software engineering who want to take an active role in improving their technical and problem-solving competencies while growing our Engineering practice.




With more than 3,000 employees, Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, Technology, and Transformations.




About the team

We, the Engineering offering of Deloitte Technology & Transformation Denmark, are on the lookout for additional team players for our quickly growing practice of software engineers, architects, cloud consultants, and IT management consultants. We assist our clients, some of the largest companies, agencies, and organizations in Denmark and the Nordics, on the implementation of new cloud-native systems as part of their digital transformation, and we need you to help build their opportunities and meet their challenges!




Together, we will accelerate your career towards becoming a proficient software engineer. At Deloitte, we are committed to empowering you throughout your career development. As a new employee, you are assigned a talent manager to support your career aspirations and development. You will also be part of a tech community with monthly meetings in which we share knowledge, investigate new topics, and upskill within relevant technologies and methodologies.




Job Description

As a Junior Software Engineer in Deloitte Engineering, you will work with the full software lifecycle, all the way from architecting the solution and writing code to integrating and deploying the solution. You will work closely with both clients and internal stakeholders to ensure that our solutions meet their business needs and their technical requirements. Our client assignments can vary greatly, but common to all of them is that we strive to work with the technologies that the client prefers. Regardless of the technology, we provide you with the opportunity and tools needed to learn and grow within all of them.




In this role, you will make an impact by:

Developing applications and solutions of all sizes, frequently in Agile settings (SAFE/Scrum). This includes both backend and frontend development.
Assisting in designing and architecting solutions, often in a Cloud context.
Assisting in the implementation of CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and adopting DevOps practices to streamline development workflows.
Building internal capabilities through community tasks, maybe within new business areas.
Joining in on workshops, sales pitches, and contributing to proposals for new client projects.




Qualifications

You hold a Master‚Äôs degree, preferably with a focus on Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other relevant fields such as Information Technology or Software Design. You have either:

Recently graduated (or expect to graduate in the summer of 2025) and have relevant experience from part-time positions, utilizing your analytical and problem-solving skill set, or
You have up to two years of full-time experience in software engineering positions, preferably working closely with business stakeholders.




Furthermore, you are either a native Danish speaker or highly proficient in written and spoken Danish.

What you bring to the team:

Experience in Java, C#/.NET, JavaScript, TypeScript, or one or more other widely used programming languages.
Strong analytical skills, a focus on quality and detail, and a proven ability to solve problems in a structured way.
Preferably some experience with DevOps practices such as CI/CD, IaC, and test automation.
A positive, team-oriented mindset and a hunger for learning new technologies.
Excellent communication skills and an ability to express yourself clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.




Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.




What we can offer you

We highly appreciate the variation in knowledge, experience, and perspectives our consultants bring to the table. In exchange, we make sure that you develop professionally and are supported and encouraged to meet your career goals‚Äîfor example, we offer our consultants:

Enrolment in the Consultant Academy, which is our training program for building the essential Consultant skills. The Academy takes you to exciting locations to learn from leading professionals in their respective fields.
Focused career development by assigning you a talent manager who acts as your mentor and guides you in your professional journey at Deloitte.
Continuous learning opportunities within Software Engineering, Cloud, and Agile Ways of Working, for example, through certification courses.
The opportunity to participate in projects and internal work with our different market offerings to find the right fit for you.




On the social aspect, Deloitte Technology & Transformation is second to none. We offer everything from various sports communities to dinners and parties all year round, as well as a yearly trip where all our colleagues come together off-site to create lasting memories. We have a strong culture and community in Engineering, and we support each other every day to make an impact with our clients and to promote our personal and professional development.




Additional Information




Do you want to be part of our team?




Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.




Send your application, CV, grade transcripts from both Bachelor‚Äôs and Master‚Äôs studies, and other relevant documents by 30.09.2025. We process applications and arrange interviews continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible.




Please note that it is a requirement to have a Danish work permit to be considered for this position.




Expected start date: 01.11.2025




Please do not hesitate to contact Sophus Benee Olsen at +45 30 93 61 88 if you have any questions about the position.




We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.

By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.




We look forward to connecting with you!




In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths ‚Äì because that is how we can make a difference.

Are you curious about modern software development and looking for your next challenge? At Deloitte Engineering, we are seeking recent graduates and candidates with up to two years of full-time experience in software engineering who want to take an active role in improving their technical and problem-solving competencies while growing our Engineering practice.


With more than 3,000 employees, Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, Technology, and Transformations.


About the team

We, the Engineering offering of Deloitte Technology & Transformation Denmark, are on the lookout for additional team players for our quickly growing practice of software engineers, architects, cloud consultants, and IT management consultants. We assist our clients, some of the largest companies, agencies, and organizations in Denmark and the Nordics, on the implementation of new cloud-native systems as part of their digital transformation, and we need you to help build their opportunities and meet their challenges!


Together, we will accelerate your career towards becoming a proficient software engineer. At Deloitte, we are committed to empowering you throughout your career development. As a new employee, you are assigned a talent manager to support your career aspirations and development. You will also be part of a tech community with monthly meetings in which we share knowledge, investigate new topics, and upskill within relevant technologies and methodologies.


Job Description

As a Junior Software Engineer in Deloitte Engineering, you will work with the full software lifecycle, all the way from architecting the solution and writing code to integrating and deploying the solution. You will work closely with both clients and internal stakeholders to ensure that our solutions meet their business needs and their technical requirements. Our client assignments can vary greatly, but common to all of them is that we strive to work with the technologies that the client prefers. Regardless of the technology, we provide you with the opportunity and tools needed to learn and grow within all of them.


In this role, you will make an impact by:

  • Developing applications and solutions of all sizes, frequently in Agile settings (SAFE/Scrum). This includes both backend and frontend development.
  • Assisting in designing and architecting solutions, often in a Cloud context.
  • Assisting in the implementation of CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and adopting DevOps practices to streamline development workflows.
  • Building internal capabilities through community tasks, maybe within new business areas.
  • Joining in on workshops, sales pitches, and contributing to proposals for new client projects.


Qualifications

You hold a Master‚Äôs degree, preferably with a focus on Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other relevant fields such as Information Technology or Software Design. You have either:

  • Recently graduated (or expect to graduate in the summer of 2025) and have relevant experience from part-time positions, utilizing your analytical and problem-solving skill set, or
  • You have up to two years of full-time experience in software engineering positions, preferably working closely with business stakeholders.


Furthermore, you are either a native Danish speaker or highly proficient in written and spoken Danish.

What you bring to the team:

  • Experience in Java, C#/.NET, JavaScript, TypeScript, or one or more other widely used programming languages.
  • Strong analytical skills, a focus on quality and detail, and a proven ability to solve problems in a structured way.
  • Preferably some experience with DevOps practices such as CI/CD, IaC, and test automation.
  • A positive, team-oriented mindset and a hunger for learning new technologies.
  • Excellent communication skills and an ability to express yourself clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.


Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.


What we can offer you

We highly appreciate the variation in knowledge, experience, and perspectives our consultants bring to the table. In exchange, we make sure that you develop professionally and are supported and encouraged to meet your career goals‚Äîfor example, we offer our consultants:

  • Enrolment in the Consultant Academy, which is our training program for building the essential Consultant skills. The Academy takes you to exciting locations to learn from leading professionals in their respective fields.
  • Focused career development by assigning you a talent manager who acts as your mentor and guides you in your professional journey at Deloitte.
  • Continuous learning opportunities within Software Engineering, Cloud, and Agile Ways of Working, for example, through certification courses.
  • The opportunity to participate in projects and internal work with our different market offerings to find the right fit for you.


On the social aspect, Deloitte Technology & Transformation is second to none. We offer everything from various sports communities to dinners and parties all year round, as well as a yearly trip where all our colleagues come together off-site to create lasting memories. We have a strong culture and community in Engineering, and we support each other every day to make an impact with our clients and to promote our personal and professional development.

Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
Job Description

The Agentic Tribe is revolutionizing the chatbot and voice assistance landscape with Gen3, a cutting-edge AI Agent system that's pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. Gen3 is not your typical chatbot; it's a goal-oriented, dynamic, and truly conversational system capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting to user needs in real-time. By leveraging a multi-agent architecture and advanced language models, Gen3 delivers personalized and engaging user experiences, moving beyond scripted interactions to handle complex tasks and "off-script" inquiries with ease.

We are delighted to be hiring a Senior Machine Learning Scientist for the AI Agent product at Zendesk. You will own a designated product area and revolutionize how our customers experience our products. This is an exciting opportunity to bridge the gap between cutting-edge ML research and real-world impact. You'll have the freedom to shape the product roadmap, discover innovative ML applications, and collaborate with a talented cross-functional team.

Key Responsibilities


You'll be part of a team responsible for designing and testing novel AI solutions for real business problems
You'll own the full research projects end-to-end from understanding business requirements to design, implementation, experimentation and reporting
You'll discuss your and others ideas in the research team regularly and provide peer review for your colleagues work
You'll keep up with the NLP and ML fields and literature and introduce new concepts discovered as potential solutions to our business problems
You'll work closely with machine learning engineers helping them implement your designs into our production system
You'll use suitable tools and technologies for rapid implementation and quickly testing your hypotheses while keeping in mind the requirements of future production implementation
You‚Äôll collaborate with Product managers and other non technical stakeholders to discover product roadmap.


Who You Are


Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.
Proven record of Machine Learning or NLP research, ideally in industry.
Knowledge of building deep learning neural network architectures, ideally with focus on NLP.
Ability to implement ideas from research literature into proof-of-concept models.
Practical approach for researching machine learning solutions to business problems.
Huge bonus if you have experience with conversational AI.
A positive, pro-active team player who is passionate about their craft, is keen to take part in product discussions and cares about helping the team deliver.
Great communication skill and fluency in English.


How do we measure success in this role?


How well your work aligns with the overall product roadmap and strategic goals.
Effectiveness in collaborating with product managers, engineers, designers, and other stakeholders
Discovery and Ideation - ability to identify new opportunities within the product area, as well as their ability to prioritize and champion these ideas.


About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk‚Äôs use of your personal information.

Hybrid: In this role, our hybrid experience is designed at the team level to give you a rich onsite experience packed with connection, collaboration, learning, and celebration - while also giving you flexibility to work remotely for part of the week. This role must attend our local office for part of the week. The specific in-office schedule is to be determined by the hiring manager.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.
