Title: ML/AI Engineer - Tax Automation & Agentic Platform
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At EY, we‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.

We‚Äôll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

About The Job

At the EY‚Äôs digital product organization, you will be building intelligent tax automation tools and agentic AI platforms for increased efficiency, quality, and joy in tax and compliance workflows.

We help thousands of clients with services such as producing correct and compliant tax filings, and consulting multinational companies on how to navigate the international tax landscape.

To do those jobs with the highest degree of accuracy and efficiency, intelligent automation and great AI-powered software play key roles.

We operate across the Nordics (DK, FI, SE, NO) with a small, flat, and informal organization of ~40 engineers, designers, researchers, and PMs. In a distributed setup across all countries where we work from home and offices depending on preferences and needs.

Tax? Yes, tax filings and tax law are the domains we design and build for, so having an interest in those areas would be good. Actual experience and domain knowledge is of course a plus, but certainly not a requirement. It's a pretty small Venn diagram of ML engineers who also have professional tax experience.

Above all, we value working with good all-round people. People who are both highly specialized but are capable of collaborating across disciplines.

About You

As an ML/AI engineer, you will be entrusted with building intelligent automation systems and agentic AI platforms across several business-critical tax products.

As a master of your craft, you will develop production-ready ML models, NLP pipelines, and AI agents using Python, Langchain, and modern transformer architectures.

Solutions that are well-tested, documented, optimized for performance, and easy to maintain.

You have honed those skills by working on ML applications in cross-functional product teams, where you have shown yourself as a wonderful collaborator who can translate business requirements into intelligent technical solutions.

You have likely also done many model reviews and taken initiative to question AI approaches suggested by people more senior in the company than yourself. And challenged product decisions that didn't make technical sense from an ML perspective.

If that sounds like you, we should talk. In the meantime, here's more information about the work and our team.

Your Key Responsibilities


Building intelligent tax automation systems using ML/AI technologies
Developing agentic AI platforms for Nordic tax regulations and compliance
Close collaboration with tax professionals, designers, product managers, and fellow engineers
Spending time, occasionally, with users and domain experts to understand tax workflows in detail
Working across a range of products and problem spaces in the tax domain
Freedom to work remotely or in our Copenhagen or Stockholm office


Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role, you should have:


ML/AI Fundamentals: Experience with supervised/unsupervised learning, classification, entity extraction, document processing, and time-series analysis
NLP Expertise: Proficiency with transformer models, embeddings, document analysis, and Named Entity Recognition
Python Stack: Strong experience with Langchain, Ragas, OpenAI API, and modern ML frameworks
Production Experience: 2+ years deploying ML models as REST APIs with async processing capabilities
Database Skills: Experience with MongoDB and vector databases, particularly for document and financial data modeling
Cloud Platforms: Familiarity with Azure AI Foundry or similar cloud ML platforms
Security Awareness: Understanding of data privacy, security requirements, and compliance frameworks (SOX, PCI)
Easy access to Copenhagen, Helsinki, or Stockholm. You can work remotely most of the time, but we meet up in person weekly
Really good English speaking and writing skills. That's our work language
An interest in tax law and financial regulations


What We Look For

We obviously want you to be a skilled ML engineer, but we believe that a engineer is so much more than that. We are looking for a colleague who is‚Ä¶


A real craftsperson and a stickler for technical details
Delightful to be around and able to communicate ML concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A clear communicator who can translate between tax domain experts and technical teams
Supportive and helpful in cross-functional collaboration
Quick to solve complex problems with practical engineering solutions
Questioning AI approaches and decisions before committing to implementation
Eager to learn about both advancing ML techniques and tax domain complexities
Comfortable working in 6-week Shape Up cycles with autonomous project ownership


What We Offer


A tech product team: Digital product organization as a unit operates mostly product- and user-driven, even though we are situated within a large consultancy organization
Direct access to domain experts: Your ML models will directly impact tax professionals who are quite literally right next to you, providing immediate feedback and domain insights
Cutting-edge AI challenges: Work on agentic AI platforms and intelligent automation in a regulated, high-stakes environment
Shape Up methodology: Work in focused 6-week cycles with clear scope and autonomy
Good food and good times: We take good care of the people who dedicate their working hours to our cause
Diverse and inclusive culture: You'll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs


To learn more about EY and what it's like to work here, please follow us on EY Careers, Career blog and social media.

Apply now

Please apply with your CV and Cover Letter. We review applications on a continuous basis so please apply right away, but no later than 11.8.2025. For questions regarding the role, do not hesitate to contact brian.groth@dk.ey.com For any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Jakob.Damsted@dk.ey.com.

We look forward to your application.

At EY, we‚Äôll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We‚Äôll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.

To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

Title: Hearing Research Scientist
Description:
The audio team within RL Research is looking for a Research Scientist with a specialty in audio processing to join our growing team. You will be doing applied research and applied engineering in technologies that improve listener‚Äôs hearing abilities under challenging listening conditions alongside a team of dedicated research scientists, developers, and engineers. This role requires skills in signal processing for hearing enhancement and a passion for improving users‚Äô ability to experience the world around them. In this position, you will collaborate closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, research scientists, and designers to develop novel hearing enhancement technologies. You will focus on designing and integrating state-of-the-art hearing enhancement algorithms to AR/VR products to create new experiences beyond what traditional consumer devices are capable of.

Hearing Research Scientist Responsibilities:


Research and design DSP and ML solutions for hearing features such as Conversation Focus and Hearing Correction on smart glasses. The work may include using both signal processing & ML techniques to solve problems in hearing enhancement (dynamic range compression, feedback management, adaptive filtering, noise suppression, dereverberation etc) and speech enhancement (adaptive beamforming, ML noise suppression, voice detection)
The key focus in this role is to bring previous experience of developing such solutions for hearing aids or other hearables and apply such experience to the smart glasses form factor
Design and implement hearing enhancement algorithms for wearable audio devices
Develop solutions that solve complex problems at the intersection between beamforming, machine learning, acoustics and signal processing for applications in AR/VR
Develop algorithms that meet system-level acoustic, compute, and memory constraints for wearable audio devices
Collaborate with teams in the larger Reality Labs audio team to deploy new technologies in AR/VR products


Minimum Qualifications:


PhD degree or equivalent in Applied Mathematics, Audio Engineering and Signal Processing, Acoustics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
3+ years experience developing, implementing and evaluating algorithm and signal processing techniques for audio processing
3+ years experience in programming in C++, MATLAB, or Python
Experience with cross-group collaboration


Preferred Qualifications:


Expertise in hearing enhancement signal processing and auditory perception
2+ years of experience in speech, hearing and audio perception research & technology development
3+ years experience developing, implementing and evaluating algorithm and signal processing techniques for speech enhancement solutions
Experience with application of machine learning techniques to speech enhancement algorithms
Experience and proven track record of developing and productizing speech enhancement solutions


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Software Engineer, AI & Data Pipelines (Python/C++)
Place: H√∏rsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to build the intelligent software that powers the future of sports coaching? Are you passionate about transforming raw data and AI model predictions into meaningful, real-world metrics for top athletes? Then come and join our ambitious and collaborative product team!

We are looking for a software engineer to help us build and scale the complete pipeline for our AI-driven biomechanics products. You won't just be working with models; you'll be engineering the entire framework around them to ensure our users get the most accurate and intuitive feedback possible.

As a member of our team, you will play a significant role in developing the software systems that make our advanced AI accessible and useful. We believe that good AI models need solid software supporting it to make outputs robust and actionable. You will work in a fast-paced, agile environment with a high degree of ownership, seeing your work move from prototype to production and having a direct impact on our products.

Your primary responsibilities will include:


Designing and building the complete software pipeline around our deep learning models, to deliver accurate and understandable biomechanical metrics.
Deploying efficient embedded AI models using frameworks like ONNX and TensorRT .
Developing and maintaining APIs (using FastAPI) that serve the entire data pipeline to our applications.
Taking end-to-end ownership of features, from brainstorming and architectural design to implementation, testing, and deployment.
Playing a key role in the challenge of porting and optimizing our data pipelines for efficient execution on mobile devices (iOS).


Requirements


A Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
You have an entrepreneurial mindset and thrive on taking an idea from concept to a polished implementation.
Strong software development and programming skills in Python. Experience with C++ is a significant plus.
Experience deploying software systems that incorporate machine learning models as a component.
Solid understanding of software engineering fundamentals, including system architecture, API design, and testing.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a fast-paced team.


Preferably:


Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines.
Hands-on experience with API frameworks like FastAPI.
Experience with ML model deployment frameworks such as ONNX or TensorRT.
Knowledge of mobile development, especially deploying computational pipelines to iOS (Core ML).
You have a genuine passion for applying state-of-the-art technology to solve real-world challenges.
An interest in sports like golf, baseball, or others is a bonus!


The Office

We have just moved to our state-of-art HQ in H√∏rsholm, located at DTU Science Park. We take great pride in the building we designed! The office features bright meeting rooms, coffee areas to catch up with colleagues, a large testing arena with simulators available for employees and a fitness centre, everything surrounded by a beautiful forest and respecting the environment. We made sure to utilize the newest technologies to be energy efficient and be mindful of ventilation and sound propagation.

The cherry on top is our canteen: with an indoor and outdoor area to enjoy the fresh food prepared by our own kitchen staff.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman‚Äôs blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work.

Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud to work in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race.

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarters located in Denmark (H√∏rsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Seoul and Tokyo. We employ over 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where most hardware and software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At Trackman, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive, and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody‚Äôs voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of exceptional solutions. This mix makes Trackman an inspiring company ‚Äì for our customers and colleagues.

Share our Passion!

Applications are continuously assessed, so please send your application as soon as possible to join a company with great technologies, passionate colleagues, and great opportunities to grow. The application deadline is August 31st, 2025.

Contact Steen Lyng√∏ S√∏rensen at steen@trackman.recruitee.com for further information.

Apply now

Title: IT Platform Engineer for MLOps (Machine Learning) Area
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for hosting Python statistical and machine learning models, primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop these models on behalf of various enterprise domains within the bank. We manage AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud), which works alongside CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) to execute machine learning models for scoring payment transactions for fraud, including e-banking domestic/international and District International models deployed in CMDEP. Additionally, we are tasked with transforming the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.

As a MLOps IT Platform Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a ‚Äú2 in a box‚Äù model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:


Implement automated pipelines for model training, validation and inference
Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and deployment
Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models


About you:


Minimum of 2 years of practical experience in MLOps platform to build model development deployment, execution and maintenance of ML pipelines
Hands-on experience in ‚Äì Databricks asset bundles, Databricks MLFlow, Databricks MLOps stack customization, GitHub Actions for Databricks model deployments, Data bricks Unity Catalog
Experience in Python, Pyspark
Experience in Github tools Terraform and container orchestration, YAML
Understanding of Leveraging docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models
Problem-solving and debugging skills
Upper-Intermediate English skills


‚ÄúWe believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.‚Äù

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk , and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for hosting Python statistical and machine learning models, primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop these models on behalf of various enterprise domains within the bank. We manage AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud), which works alongside CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) to execute machine learning models for scoring payment transactions for fraud, including e-banking domestic/international and District International models deployed in CMDEP. Additionally, we are tasked with transforming the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.

As a MLOps IT Platform Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a ‚Äú2 in a box‚Äù model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:

  • Implement automated pipelines for model training, validation and inference
  • Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
  • Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and deployment
  • Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
  • Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models

About you:

  • Minimum of 2 years of practical experience in MLOps platform to build model development deployment, execution and maintenance of ML pipelines
  • Hands-on experience in ‚Äì Databricks asset bundles, Databricks MLFlow, Databricks MLOps stack customization, GitHub Actions for Databricks model deployments, Data bricks Unity Catalog
  • Experience in Python, Pyspark
  • Experience in Github tools Terraform and container orchestration, YAML
  • Understanding of Leveraging docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models
  • Problem-solving and debugging skills
  • Upper-Intermediate English skills

‚ÄúWe believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.‚Äù

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:

  • Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
  • Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
  • Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
  • Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
  • Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.

See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk , and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Senior AI Agent Engineer (Machine Learning)
Description:
Job Description

About The Agentic Tribe:

The Agentic Tribe is revolutionizing the chatbot and voice assistance landscape with Gen3, a cutting-edge AI Agent system that's pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. Gen3 is not your typical chatbot; it's a goal-oriented, dynamic, and truly conversational system capable of reasoning, planning, and adapting to user needs in real-time. By leveraging a multi-agent architecture and advanced language models, Gen3 delivers personalized and engaging user experiences, moving beyond scripted interactions to handle complex tasks and "off-script" inquiries with ease.

About The Role

We are seeking a passionate and experienced AI Agent Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will be dedicated to innovating at the forefront of AI technology, with a focus on designing, developing, and deploying intelligent, autonomous agents that leverage Large Language Models (LLMs) to streamline operations. You will be a key player in building the cognitive architecture for our AI-powered applications, creating systems that can reason, plan, and execute complex, multi-step tasks. You‚Äôll effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including those outside your immediate team.

What You Will Do (Responsibilities)


Design and develop robust, stateful, and scalable AI agents using Python and modern agentic frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex).
Integrate AI agent solutions with existing enterprise systems, databases, and third-party APIs to create seamless, end-to-end workflows.
Evaluate and select appropriate foundation models and services from third-party providers (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic, Google), analyzing their strengths, weaknesses, and cost-effectiveness for specific use cases.
Drive the entire lifecycle of AI Agent deployment‚ÄîCollaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, ML scientists, and software engineers, to understand user needs and deliver effective, high-impact agent solutions.
Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize complex AI systems to ensure optimal performance, reliability, and scalability in production environments.
Establish and improve platforms for evaluating AI agent performance, defining key metrics to measure success and guide iteration.
Document development processes, architectural decisions, code, and research findings to ensure knowledge sharing and maintainability across the team.


Core Technical Competencies


LLM-Oriented System Design: Designing multi-step, tool-using agents (LangChain, Autogen). Deep understanding of prompt engineering, context management, and LLM behavior quirks (e.g., hallucinations, determinism, temperature effects). Implementing advanced reasoning patterns like Chain-of-Thought and multi-agent communication.
Tool Integration & APIs: Integrating agents with external tools, databases, and APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic) in secure execution environments.
Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG): Building and optimizing RAG pipelines with vector databases, advanced chunking, and hybrid search.
Evaluation & Observability: Implementing LLM evaluation frameworks and monitoring for latency, accuracy, and tool usage.
Safety & Reliability: Defending against prompt injection and implementing guardrails (Rebuff, Guardrails AI) and fallback strategies.
Performance Optimization: Managing LLM token budgets and latency through smart model routing and caching (Redis).
Planning & Reasoning: Designing agents with long-term memory and complex planning capabilities (ReAct, Tree-of-Thought).
Programming & Tooling: Expert in Python, FastAPI, and LLM SDKs; experience with cloud deployment (AWS/GCP/Azure) and CI/CD for AI applications.


Bonus Points (Preferred Qualifications)


Ph.D / Masters in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, NLP).
Deep understanding of foundational ML concepts (attention, embeddings, transfer learning).
Experience adapting academic research into production-ready code.
Familiarity with fine-tuning techniques (e.g., PEFT, LoRA).


The Interview Process

We are excited to learn more about you, so we want to be transparent about what you can expect from our interview process:


Initial Call with Talent Team - 15 mins
Interview with one member of the Hiring Team - 45 minutes
Take-home technical challenge
A technical interview with two of our developers to talk more in-depth about your technical experience and answer any questions you might have - 1 hour
Final interview with 2 of the following: CTO or Engineering Manager/Director - 45 minutes


About Zendesk

Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.

More than 100,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.

Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster diversity & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk‚Äôs use of your personal information.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we‚Äôre proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.

Title: Student Assistant - Machine Learning
Place: K√∏benhavn SV, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
In this role, you will be an integral part of our Data Insights and AI team, working closely on real-world projects that drive data-driven innovation. You‚Äôll be involved in both the development and ideation of Machine Learning solutions, contributing to projects such as healthcare demand forecasting, staff allocation optimization, and service/vehicle demand prediction.


About The Job


Key Responsibilities:



ML Solutions Development: Assist in designing, implementing, and testing machine learning models for business applications including time-series forecasting, demand prediction, and resource optimization. Use Python libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, Prophet, and TensorFlow to build robust ML solutions.
Model Development: Conduct comprehensive analysis on historical patterns, resource utilization, and operational metrics. Develop and validate predictive models that directly impact business decision-making and operational efficiency.
End-to-End ML Pipeline: Participate in the full ML lifecycle from data pre-processing and feature engineering to model training, validation, and deployment. Create interactive dashboards and applications to visualize predictions and insights.
Collaboration & Continuous Improvement: Work as part of a multidisciplinary team to integrate ML solutions. Propose innovative solutions to complex technical challenges while contributing to improving patient care and operational efficiency.


What We Offer:


Real-World Experience: Work on diverse projects that provide practical exposure to cutting-edge technologies.
Professional Development: Enjoy mentorship, regular feedback, and opportunities to boost your technical and soft skills.
Innovative Environment: Join a supportive team that values creativity, collaboration, and fresh perspectives.
Flexible Scheduling & Competitive Compensation: Gain valuable work experience while balancing your academic commitments.
Career Growth: Our Student Assistants have a proven pathway to transition into full-time roles within our organization.



About You


Qualifications:


Currently enrolled in a master‚Äôs program with a focus on Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.
Proficiency in Python with experience in ML libraries such as XGBoost, PyTorch, Tensorflow/Keras, Prophet, etc.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Exceptional problem-solving skills, a keen curiosity about recent advances in the field, and the ability to apply innovative solutions to real-world problems.


Preferred Skills:


Experience with Databricks platform for collaborative ML development and data engineering.
Experience with MLOps practices, model monitoring, and CI/CD for ML projects.
Demonstrated Projects & Contributions - a portfolio showcasing examples of your work is highly valued.



About Us


Our team is at the forefront of digital transformation, heading initiatives such as Falck Data Platform and FalckGPT (our internal LLM powered platform). We believe in fostering talent and building a strong pipeline of future leaders. Join us and be part of a team where your ideas and skills can make a significant impact.

Title: Nyuddannet Data Scientist med Fokus p√• udvikling af Modeller
Place: Br√∏ndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Du elsker data. Det g√∏r vi ogs√•. Skal vi n√∏rde sammen?

Perfekt. S√• er du scrollet til det helt rigtige sted i dit feed. Vi vil gerne l√•ne 2 min af din tid til at overbevise dig om, at du skal v√¶re vores nye Data Scientist i Danske Spil.

‚ÄùVi v√¶lger at g√• p√• arbejde hver dag, ikke bare fordi vi skal, men fordi vi oprigtigt kan lide hinanden og trives i hinandens selskab. Vi er fagligt ambiti√∏se og fokuserede, men vi har ogs√• masser af grin og et fantastisk sammenhold. Vores dygtige Data Engineers s√∏rger for al data tilrettel√¶ggelse, s√• vi i Data Science kan fokusere p√• de reelle data science opgaver og skabe v√¶rdi gennem vores arbejde og ekspertise.‚Äù ‚Äì Trine Brandt, Leder af BI&Data Science




Velkommen til Data Science i Danske Spil

I vores Data Science afdeling arbejder vi m√•lrettet p√• at udvikle og forbedre vores modeller og infrastruktur for at sikre, at vi kan levere de bedste spil- og underholdningsoplevelser til vores kunder. Data Science er et team best√•ende af i alt seks Data Scientists (inklusive dig) samt en Product Owner. Vi er en del af BI & Data Science afdelingen med i alt 20 kollegaer, der alle er bundet sammen af vores passion for data. Vores ambition er at levere de bedste machine learning l√∏sninger inden for anti-hvidvask, identifikation af problematisk spilleadf√¶rd og personaliserede brugerrejser i vores produkt- og marketing afdelinger. Vi har et unikt datas√¶t b√•de i omfang og kvalitet, og vi br√¶nder for at bruge det aktivt til ansvarlige og fornuftige forretningsbeslutninger.




Lidt om dig, dit ansvar og dine opgaver.

Vi s√∏ger en nyuddannet og samarbejdende Data Scientist, der sammen med gode kollegaer kan tage ansvar for vores udvikling af modeller i et scrum setup. Du trives med at samarbejde og er ikke bange for at dele din viden og stille sp√∏rgsm√•l. Kendskab til vores produkter er ikke et krav, men det vil v√¶re en fordel, da det kan hj√¶lpe med at g√∏re din l√¶ringskurve en smule mindre stejl.

Din profil:

Du har en relevant uddannelse inden for data science og modellering f.eks Matematik, Statistik, Datalogi, Data Science, Machine Learning eller lignende.
Du har gode samarbejdsevner og en god portion nysgerrighed i forhold til at arbejde i scrum setup.
Du har lyst til at arbejde med machine learning i et cloud setup (Azure og/eller Databricks).
Du er st√¶rk p√• pr√¶diktive modeller og har eventuelt stiftet bekendtskab med generativ AI.
Du er en profil der √∏nsker at drive leverancer.
Du har indsigt eller interesse i sportsspil, casino, skrabespil, poker og/eller lotterier.

Dine opgaver:

Indg√• i teamets arbejde med udvikling, implementering, drift og eventuelle bugs p√• vores pr√¶diktive og generative modeller.
Indg√• i t√¶t dialog med forretningen og tekniske specialister om anvendelsen af modeller, og sikre et effektivt feedback-loop, der underst√∏tter l√∏bende gentr√¶ning og remodellering af l√∏sninger.
Arbejde iterativt og agilt med et ‚ÄùFail fast‚Äù-mindset.
Bidrage til optimering og effektivisering af vores data science processer.




Vil du v√¶re med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi l√¶ser ans√∏gninger igennem l√∏bende, men deadline for at s√∏ge er den 15. august. Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt p√• tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har sp√∏rgsm√•l til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Mette Overgaard Holm p√• meho@danskespil.dk.




Stillingen er placeret i en afdeling, hvor fremvisning af straffeattest er p√•kr√¶vet for at overholde reglerne om forebyggelse af hvidvask og terrorfinansiering. N√•r du indkaldes til samtale, skal straffeattesten derfor indhentes og uploades i rekrutteringssystemet inden 1. samtale.




Vi gl√¶der os til at m√∏de dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Pia, Philip, Tryggvi, Marie Louise, Johan og Trine

  • Du har gode samarbejdsevner og en god portion nysgerrighed i forhold til at arbejde i scrum setup.
  • Du har lyst til at arbejde med machine learning i et cloud setup (Azure og/eller Databricks).
  • Du er st√¶rk p√• pr√¶diktive modeller og har eventuelt stiftet bekendtskab med generativ AI.
  • Du er en profil der √∏nsker at drive leverancer.
  • Du har indsigt eller interesse i sportsspil, casino, skrabespil, poker og/eller lotterier.

Dine opgaver:

  • Indg√• i teamets arbejde med udvikling, implementering, drift og eventuelle bugs p√• vores pr√¶diktive og generative modeller.
  • Indg√• i t√¶t dialog med forretningen og tekniske specialister om anvendelsen af modeller, og sikre et effektivt feedback-loop, der underst√∏tter l√∏bende gentr√¶ning og remodellering af l√∏sninger.
  • Arbejde iterativt og agilt med et ‚ÄùFail fast‚Äù-mindset.
  • Bidrage til optimering og effektivisering af vores data science processer.


Vil du v√¶re med til at underholde danskerne?

Vi l√¶ser ans√∏gninger igennem l√∏bende, men deadline for at s√∏ge er den 15. august. Har du sp√∏rgsm√•l til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Data Science Trine Brandt p√• tbra@danskespil.dk. Hvis du har sp√∏rgsm√•l til rekrutteringsprocessen, er du velkommen til at kontakte HR Business Partner, Mette Overgaard Holm p√• meho@danskespil.dk.


Stillingen er placeret i en afdeling, hvor fremvisning af straffeattest er p√•kr√¶vet for at overholde reglerne om forebyggelse af hvidvask og terrorfinansiering. N√•r du indkaldes til samtale, skal straffeattesten derfor indhentes og uploades i rekrutteringssystemet inden 1. samtale.


Vi gl√¶der os til at m√∏de dig,

Hilsen dine nye teammedlemmer Pia, Philip, Tryggvi, Marie Louise, Johan og Trine

Title: Research Scientist, Liquid Products Development & Innovation, Bagsv√¶rd
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity‚Äôs biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It‚Äôs how we've gotten so far. And it‚Äôs how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We‚Äôre here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Research Scientist

In Product and Process Development we have the responsibility to make the products and processes for our worldwide production sites. You will be in a cross-functional agile team (with members of fermentation, recovery and formulation departments) with a primary focus to create new BioSolutions that excite our customers, including enzymes and advanced proteins.

Your role will be to develop liquid enzyme/protein formulations and design new product formats, using existing or new technologies. To succeed you will combine insights of enzyme/protein processing with protein stabilization, and together with your agile team you will select the optimal solutions both for customer value and product quality.

You will be in direct contact with our colleagues in marketing, production, pilot plants, application and R&D departments in Novonesis as well as external customers. You will drive results on your own and together with other highly skilled scientists and lab technicians. Furthermore, you will support the advancement of the digital transformation agenda in the department developing Apps and taking advantage of data models, AI and LLMs, to unlock the value in our data and increase productivity.

Welcome to Liquid Products Development & Innovation (LPDi)

We are part of Formulation Development, where we are responsible for the development of enzyme and other protein products and production processes, upscaling of new products and technologies, as well as supporting and improving our existing product range.

In LPDi we are a team of highly engaged, multicultural scientists, with a passion for enzyme/protein formulation and product innovation. We cooperate with many of Novonesis‚Äô functions locally and internationally. We have a strong digitalization team in the department that combines product and process development tasks with the development of digital and automation solutions.

In This Role You‚Äôll Make An Impact By


Developing and optimizing formulations with focus on quality, stability and optimal format for the final commercial products
Improving the way we work, for example by taking advantage of digitalization and automation, modeling, machine learning, AI and LLMs in our development work
Working independently as well as taking the responsibility as project leader and as a team player, contributing to a high performing cross-functional Agile Team
Supporting customers, doing production troubleshooting and scaling up to our global production plants


To Succeed You Must


Hold a Master‚Äôs degree or PhD in chemical/biochemical engineering, biotechnology, bioinformatics or related fields
Have familiarity and passion for programming, modeling and advanced statistics, machine learning, AI and LLMs
Experience within protein stability and formulation is an advantage
Enjoy project management and taking a role as project leader
Have experience with planning and executing experiments and enjoy day to day collaboration with laboratory technicians


Location:

This job is located in Bagsv√¶rd, Copenhagen, Denmark. In this job role, it will be a benefit to be mostly physically present in Bagsv√¶rd, but there is some flexibility to work partly from home.

Application deadline: Friday 29th of August, 2025.

Contact details: Albert E. Cervera-Padrell, Head of Liquid Products Development and Innovation, acep@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is dedicated to fostering a unique community by embracing and respecting differences. We make all employment decisions based on business needs, ensuring that every individual can thrive, regardless of identity or background such as ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Stay alert: Avoid recruitment scams

At Novonesis, We Are Committed To Maintaining a Safe And Transparent Recruitment Process. Please Be Aware Of Potential Scams Targeting Job Seekers And Take Note Of The Following


Novonesis will never ask for sensitive personal information, such as bank account details, Social Security numbers, or passwords, at any stage of the hiring process.
Novonesis does not make employment offers without conducting interviews with candidates.


If you receive suspicious communication claiming to be from Novonesis, please do not share any personal or financial information. We encourage you to verify the legitimacy of the message by contacting us directly through our official channels.
Show more

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Full Stack Engineer - Python / React - Copenhagen




We‚Äôre delighted to be working with one of Europe‚Äôs most exciting tech startups, as they continue their mission to become the leader in their market.




They‚Äôre looking to onboard an experienced engineer, to join one of their internal teams.




The Role




In this role, you'll be working as part of the Business Ops team - which focuses on internal processes, developer tools & creating the best possible work environment for both technical & non-technical team members.




You'll work closely with a team of engineers as well as non-technical stakeholders, before crafting innovative solutions to every day problems.




You'll be using Python, Django, TypeScript, React, AWS etc - as you work on both new features being built from the ground up, as well as a range of existing platforms that need some love.




What You‚Äôll Bring




5+ years of commercial software engineering experience
3+ years of experience working with Python
Experience working full stack - ideally with React
Demonstratable experience of working with internal teams with non-technical staff




The Company




With a current team of over 400 and huge growth planned in the next few years, this is an opportunity to get in while the rocket ship‚Äôs still near the launchpad.




Their tech is used by tens of thousands of teams across the globe every week‚Äîhelping analysts record, analyse, and improve performance with ease.




The company‚Äôs mission is a positive and inclusive one: to ensure access to performance tools, regardless of background, budget, or location.




Their Copenhagen HQ is the coolest office I‚Äôve ever visited, so I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll agree. Most of their team are onsite between 3-5 days a week. They offer flexibility on remote working, but their staff like being in the office more often than not.

Show more

Title: Cloud & AI Solution Engineer ‚Äì Data Platform
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you insatiably curious, deeply passionate about the realm of databases and analytics, and ready to tackle complex challenges in a dynamic environment in the era of AI? If so, we invite you to join our team as a Cloud & AI Solution Engineer in Data Platform for commercial customers at Microsoft. Here, you'll be at the forefront of cutting-edge projects that leverage the latest technologies to drive meaningful impact. Join us and be part of a team that thrives on collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning.

Databases & Analytics is a growth opportunity for Microsoft Azure, as well as its partners and customers. It includes a rich portfolio of products including IaaS and PaaS services on the Azure Platform in the age of AI. These technologies empower customers to build, deploy, and manage database and analytics applications in a cloud-native way.

As a Data Platform Solution Engineer (SE), you will play a pivotal role in helping enterprises unlock the full potential of Microsoft‚Äôs cloud database and analytics stack across every stage of deployment. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with engineering leaders and platform teams to accelerate the Fabric Data Platform, including Azure Databases and Analytics, through hands-on engagements like Proof of Concepts, hackathons, and architecture workshops. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth, develop deep business acumen, hone your technical skills, and become adept at solution design and deployment. You‚Äôll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate database and analytics migration into their deployment workflows. In summary, you‚Äôll help customers modernize their data platform and realize the full value of Microsoft‚Äôs platform, all while enjoying flexible work opportunities.

As a trusted technical advisor, you‚Äôll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate database and analytics migration into their deployment workflows. In summary, you‚Äôll help customers modernize their data platform and realize the full value of Microsoft‚Äôs platform.

Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities


Drive technical sales with decision makers using demos and PoCs to influence solution design and enable production deployments.
Lead hands-on engagements‚Äîhackathons and architecture workshops‚Äîto accelerate adoption of Microsoft‚Äôs cloud platforms.
Build trusted relationships with platform leads, co-designing secure, scalable architectures and solutions
Resolve technical blockers and objections, collaborating with engineering to share insights and improve products.
Maintain deep expertise in Analytics Portfolio: Microsoft Fabric (OneLake, DW, real-time intelligence, BI, Copilot), Azure Databricks, Purview Data Governance and Azure Databases: SQL DB, Cosmos DB, PostgreSQL.
Maintain and grow expertise in on-prem EDW (Teradata, Netezza, Exadata), Hadoop & BI solutions.
Represent Microsoft through thought leadership in cloud Database & Analytics communities and customer forums


Qualifications

Required Qualifications (RQs)


Proven years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND a few years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND a couple year(s) technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience OR equivalent experience
Azure Databases (SQL DB, Cosmos DB, PostgreSQL) from migration & modernize and creating new AI apps OR Equivalent experience.
Azure Analytics (Fabric, Azure Databricks, Purview) OR competitors (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake) in data warehouse, data lake, big data, analytics, real-time intelligent, and reporting using integrated Data Security & Governance.
Proven ability to lead technical engagements (e.g., hackathons, PoCs, MVPs) that drive production-scale outcomes.


Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Several years technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or technology delivery, or related experience OR equivalent experience
A few years experience with cloud and hybrid, or on premises infrastructure, architecture designs, migrations, industry standards, and/or technology management
Proficient on data warehouse & big data migration including on-prem appliance (Teradata, Netezza, Oracle), Hadoop (Cloudera, Hortonworks) and Azure Synapse Gen2.
Proficiency in Danish is Preferred


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: AI Solutions & Automation Internship In Bali
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI Solutions & Automation Intern (Technical Business Development)

Location: Bali, Indonesia (Relocation Required)

Unpaid Internship

Start Date: ASAP

The Un-Job Opening Hook: Are you a technical visionary with a business mind, eager to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI and real-world impact? This isn't just an internship; it's an invitation to engineer the future, integrating AI solutions and automation for a $90M USD portfolio of deep tech ventures. If you're ready to build, deploy, and transform industries from paradise, your journey starts here.

The Visionary "Why": At EX Venture, we are pioneers in human-AI collaboration, leveraging AI to bring companies to the next level. You will be at the forefront of this transformation, working directly with our portfolio companies to identify opportunities for AI integration, develop custom software, and implement automation solutions that drive efficiency and innovation. This is your chance to apply your technical skills to solve complex business problems with tangible, high-impact results, supported by a significant fund dedicated to innovation.

The "Contrarian Mind" Profile: You are a technically proficient individual with a strong understanding of AI/ML concepts and a keen interest in their business applications. You possess excellent problem-solving skills, a proactive approach to identifying opportunities, and the ability to communicate complex technical ideas to non-technical stakeholders. You are adaptable, eager to learn, and thrive in a fast-paced, project-driven environment. Experience with programming (Python preferred), data analysis, or AI/ML frameworks is highly valued.

The "Real-World Impact" Promise: Your technical expertise will directly accelerate the growth and efficiency of groundbreaking companies. You will be instrumental in:


AI Solution Design & Integration: Collaborating with business teams to identify pain points and design AI-powered solutions, then integrating them into existing workflows.
Custom Software Development: Developing bespoke AI software tools and scripts to automate processes and enhance operational capabilities.
Automation Implementation: Implementing automation strategies across various business functions to improve efficiency and reduce manual effort.
Technical Consulting: Providing technical insights and support to clients and internal teams on AI capabilities and best practices.
Project Support: Assisting in the technical aspects of project management, ensuring the successful deployment and adoption of AI solutions.


The "Paradise & Purpose" Lifestyle: Imagine your morning commute being a walk to the beach, your lunch break a paddle session, and your evenings filled with inspiring conversations under the Balinese stars. Our campus in Bali offers a unique blend of professional intensity and unparalleled personal well-being. You'll relocate to and live

within a vibrant international community, accelerating your growth through cultural immersion. Integrate work and life to fuel creativity and peak performance.

The "Meritocratic Ascent" Pathway: Your technical ingenuity and problem-solving capabilities will define your trajectory. Exceptional performance in this role can lead to accelerated growth, specialized technical leadership positions, and potential full-time roles within our portfolio companies, all while living and working in an environment that fosters peak performance.

The "AI-First Immersion": You will be at the forefront of AI innovation, not just learning about it, but actively building and deploying AI solutions for real-world problems. Our curriculum is rebuilt weekly with the newest AI agents, ensuring you are always working with cutting-edge tools and methodologies.

Call to Action: If you're ready to engineer the future with AI, embrace a global adventure, and build an extraordinary career from paradise, apply now. This is your moment to join the revolution. We are specifically looking for talent ready to make the move and thrive in our unique ecosystem. Your journey starts here.
Show more

Exceptional performance in this role can lead to accelerated growth, specialized technical leadership positions, and potential full-time roles within our portfolio companies, all while living and working in an environment that fosters peak performance.

The "AI-First Immersion": You will be at the forefront of AI innovation, not just learning about it, but actively building and deploying AI solutions for real-world problems. Our curriculum is rebuilt weekly with the newest AI agents, ensuring you are always working with cutting-edge tools and methodologies.

Call to Action: If you're ready to engineer the future with AI, embrace a global adventure, and build an extraordinary career from paradise, apply now. This is your moment to join the revolution. We are specifically looking for talent ready to make the move and thrive in our unique ecosystem. Your journey starts here.

Title: Research Scientist
Place: H√∏rsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Research Scientist ‚Äì Bioanalytical Team

Location: H√∏rsholm, Denmark

We are seeking an experienced Research Scientist to join the Bioanalytical Team at FMC‚Äôs European Innovation Centre in H√∏rsholm.

You will be a key member in our natural product development projects working closely together with microbiology, fermentation, formulation and field experts. You will perform chemical analysis on conventional products as well as produce, isolate, purify and characterise new and known natural products for testing as agrochemicals using advanced instruments such as HPLC, LC-QTOF, LC-MS/MS and prep flash chromatography system.

Key Responsibilities


Preparation of selected natural products. This includes arranging source material, crude material extraction and isolating, purifying and characterising the desired compounds.
Chemical analysis of known targets in samples deriving from R&D teams
Manage collaborations with internal/external partners for additional sample preparation and chemical characterisation
Support members of the team with instrument troubleshooting and development of analytical methods
Routine maintenance and qualification of laboratory instruments
General housekeeping, and contributing to safety activities


About You

You are a proactive and collaborative scientist who thrives in a dynamic environment and in a job that requires hands on lab work. You have strong communication skills and the ability to build good relationships with people around you.

You Bring


PhD and 3+ years of experience working with natural product chemistry
Experience in analysis of complex mixtures and isolation and purification of milligram amounts using LC-QTOF, Prep HPLC and flash chromatography
Familiar with techniques used for structure elucidation
Knowledge of natural product literature and technologies
Excellent communication and collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team environment
Confidence working in English, our primary business language


Why FMC?

At FMC, you'll join a supportive, purpose-driven team committed to innovation in sustainable agriculture. We invest in our people and encourage continuous learning and career development.

FMC Corporation is a global agricultural sciences company developing advanced solutions that combine synthetic and biological crop protection, plant health, and precision agriculture technologies.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and will close the vacancy once the right candidate is found.

Interested? We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you‚Ä¶


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You‚Äôll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion ‚Äì your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux‚Äô products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world‚Äôs 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: We are hiring an Omics Scientist and Scientific Customer Consulting
Place: Aalborg Municipality, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
We are hiring an Omics Scientist and Scientific Customer Consulting




Dated August 7, 2025 |¬†Expires September 1, 2025

¬†#Omics #Multiomics #Bioinformatics #CustomerConsultant







Biogenity is looking for a new Omics Scientist and Customer Consultant.




The job description

We are seeking a new colleague to join us in supporting scientists from various industries, including pharmaceutical, biotech, food technology, and academia, in their omics research projects.

¬†

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated individual with a passion for Omics and customer consulting. The role requires you have experience within at least one of following areas: transcriptomics, metabolomes or proteomics. This includes knowledge of sample requirements, different approaches to sample analysis, and hands-on experience with data interpretation and analysis. You also need to be experienced R user, as the work include execution, optimization and development of analytical pipelines in R or python.¬†

The role includes regular client meetings, where you will help identify needs, present suitable analysis strategies, and guide customers toward a decision. You should be motivated to grow in a role that combines scientific expertise with structured client dialogue and responsibility for incoming projects.

Your work will primarily consist of consultating and analysing omics data.

¬†

Your primary tasks will include:

Customer Communication
Communication with Subcontractors¬†
Participation in scientific discussions
Bioinformatics support
Staying √† jour with the latest trends within omics







Our expectations of you

To be considered for this position, you should hold an MSc or Ph.D. in a relevant field such as biotechnology, molecular biology, or bioinformatics. You shall be comfortable working independently and as a part of a team and should have excellent organizational skills, as you will be a part of multiple projects simultaneously. Proficiency in English is also necessary, as Biogenity operates in the global market, and English is the main language used in the office.

You should be motivated to develop your skills in scientific consultation and sales, including structured dialogue and client relationship management. No prior experience in sales is required ‚Äì what matters most is your motivation to grow into a customer-facing role and your willingness to learn.

¬†¬†




You can expect

You will be joining a passionate work environment, working closely with other experts and project managers in an innovative SME where there is a passion for moving science forward. As a member of a growing company, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills in omics, bioinformatics, and customer consulting while contributing to the expansion of the business.

¬†

You will gain experience in client meetings, project scoping, and solution-oriented dialogue. The position offers a high degree of autonomy and influence on how customer projects are shaped and delivered, within a collaborative and transparent team culture.




We value initiative, scientific curiosity, and open collaboration. Our team thrives in a transparent and feedback-driven environment where everyone has a say.

¬†




An introduction to Biogenity

Biogenity is Contract Research Organization¬†specializing in various life science research and discovery fields in diagnostics and therapeutics. Our mission is to assist omics-based discovery by empowering researchers with our expertise to get the most out of the omics analysis.

Today, Biogenity has a series of omics fee-for-service. Here, we offer research analysis to identify, list, and characterize proteomes, metabolomes, and transcriptomes.¬†







About the position

The position is a full-time role (funktion√¶rans√¶ttelse) with a weekly requirement of 37 hours. It is set to begin on October 1, 2025, and you will be working at our Aalborg office.

¬†

Niels Jernes Vej 10

9220, Aalborg √òst

Denmark




To learn more about the position, you can reach us at (+45) 71110509.

¬†




How to apply

The application deadline is September 1, 2025, at 12:00 a.m.

Please apply here on LinkedIn or send your application to the following email address: job@biogenity.com.

HTML:
We are hiring an Omics Scientist and Scientific Customer Consulting


Dated August 7, 2025 | Expires September 1, 2025

 #Omics #Multiomics #Bioinformatics #CustomerConsultant



Biogenity is looking for a new Omics Scientist and Customer Consultant.


The job description

We are seeking a new colleague to join us in supporting scientists from various industries, including pharmaceutical, biotech, food technology, and academia, in their omics research projects.

 

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated individual with a passion for Omics and customer consulting. The role requires you have experience within at least one of following areas: transcriptomics, metabolomes or proteomics. This includes knowledge of sample requirements, different approaches to sample analysis, and hands-on experience with data interpretation and analysis. You also need to be experienced R user, as the work include execution, optimization and development of analytical pipelines in R or python. 

The role includes regular client meetings, where you will help identify needs, present suitable analysis strategies, and guide customers toward a decision. You should be motivated to grow in a role that combines scientific expertise with structured client dialogue and responsibility for incoming projects.

Your work will primarily consist of consultating and analysing omics data.

 

Your primary tasks will include:

  • Customer Communication
  • Communication with Subcontractors 
  • Participation in scientific discussions
  • Bioinformatics support
  • Staying √† jour with the latest trends within omics



Our expectations of you

To be considered for this position, you should hold an MSc or Ph.D. in a relevant field such as biotechnology, molecular biology, or bioinformatics. You shall be comfortable working independently and as a part of a team and should have excellent organizational skills, as you will be a part of multiple projects simultaneously. Proficiency in English is also necessary, as Biogenity operates in the global market, and English is the main language used in the office.

You should be motivated to develop your skills in scientific consultation and sales, including structured dialogue and client relationship management. No prior experience in sales is required ‚Äì what matters most is your motivation to grow into a customer-facing role and your willingness to learn.

  


You can expect

You will be joining a passionate work environment, working closely with other experts and project managers in an innovative SME where there is a passion for moving science forward. As a member of a growing company, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills in omics, bioinformatics, and customer consulting while contributing to the expansion of the business.

 

You will gain experience in client meetings, project scoping, and solution-oriented dialogue. The position offers a high degree of autonomy and influence on how customer projects are shaped and delivered, within a collaborative and transparent team culture.


We value initiative, scientific curiosity, and open collaboration. Our team thrives in a transparent and feedback-driven environment where everyone has a say.

 


An introduction to Biogenity

Biogenity is Contract Research Organization specializing in various life science research and discovery fields in diagnostics and therapeutics. Our mission is to assist omics-based discovery by empowering researchers with our expertise to get the most out of the omics analysis.

Today, Biogenity has a series of omics fee-for-service. Here, we offer research analysis to identify, list, and characterize proteomes, metabolomes, and transcriptomes. 



About the position

The position is a full-time role (funktion√¶rans√¶ttelse) with a weekly requirement of 37 hours. It is set to begin on October 1, 2025, and you will be working at our Aalborg office.

 

Niels Jernes Vej 10

9220, Aalborg √òst

Denmark


To learn more about the position, you can reach us at (+45) 71110509.

 


How to apply

The application deadline is September 1, 2025, at 12:00 a.m.

Please apply here on LinkedIn or send your application to the following email address: job@biogenity.com.
