Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc Gr√ºn, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

Arbejdssted: Arne Jacobsens Alle 12, K√∏benhavn S 2300 DNK

Leder i butikken: Delacksan Amalathas - mail: deam@yousee.dk

Nuuday ‚Äì We make sense with technology

Hos Nudaay er vi 3.000 dedikerede medarbejdere, der p√• tv√¶rs af vores seks brands ‚Äì YouSee, TDC Erhverv, Telmore, Hiper, eesy og Relatel ‚Äì arbejder m√•lrettet p√• at s√¶tte retningen for Danmarks digitale fremtid. Vi befinder os midt i en sp√¶ndende transformation, hvor vi ikke blot revolutionerer vores IT-systemer, men ogs√• skaber innovative digitale kundeoplevelser, der s√¶tter nye standarder for, hvordan danskere, virksomheder og samfundet interagerer med teknologi i hverdagen. kunder, og vi ser fremtiden som en mulighed for konstant at udvikle og forbedre os. Vi tror p√•, at et st√¶rkt f√¶llesskab l√¶gger fundamentet til store resultater, og hos os er der altid plads til dem, der t√∏r t√¶nke nyt, tage ansvar og v√¶re med til at bane vejen. Vil du v√¶re med?

Title: Alcohol-Free Beer (AFB) Director
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Alcohol-Free Beer Director

Are you ready to lead the most transformative and fast-growing category in the beer industry? We‚Äôre looking for a visionary Alcohol-Free Beer (AFB) Director to drive innovation, challenge norms, and unlock new growth opportunities beyond traditional beer.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Alcohol-Free Beverages are redefining the beer landscape. As AFB Director, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of this revolution ‚Äî accelerating brand portfolios, pioneering new spaces and inspiring change across the organization.

Your primary tasks and responsibilities include:


Lead the Category: Champion AFB with bold ambition and strategic vision.
Accelerate Innovation: Partner with brand teams to expand AFB offerings and identify white space opportunities.
Disrupt & Inspire: Drive disruptive thinking from concept to route-to-market (RTM).
Evangelize: Be the passionate voice of AFB internally and externally.
Lead & Collaborate: Manage a small, agile team and work cross-functionally with marketing, R&D, commercial, and local markets.


What We‚Äôre Looking For


Proven experience in category development, brand innovation, or commercial leadership in FMCG or beverages.
A track record of launching and scaling new products or categories.
Strategic and creative mindset with a bias for action and experimentation.
Exceptional communication and influencing skills.
A true believer in the potential of AFB, with the charisma and conviction to bring others along.
Constantly curious, with a drive to challenge the status quo
Skilled at building bridges across functions and geographies
Passion for health, wellness, and consumer trends.
Comfortable navigating ambiguity and delivering tangible results


What You Can Expect

In Carlsberg, we are brewing for a better today and tomorrow and what we can offer you is an equal opportunity to grow across our company.

All of this is taking place in culturally diverse environment, where we celebrate our successes together and where no matter where you are from, who you are, or what experiences you bring to the table, all we say is: WELCOME YOU!



If you join our team, some of the benefits you‚Äôll enjoy are:


Flexible, hybrid work model
Annual bonus based on company and individual performance
Unlimited soft and coffee drinks in the office
Monthly beer and soft drink allowance
Well-equipped and comfortable office in the heart of Carlsberg City District in Valby, Copenhagen
Opportunities to have fun together during regular Friday


Interested?

Apply through the link. Please notice that this is the only way we accept applications.

The deadline for applying is the 27th of August. We read applications continuously, and vacancies may be filled sooner than the deadline, so we encourage you to apply as early as possible.

We look forward to receiving your application.

Carlsberg Group: Brewing for a better today and tomorrow

For us success has always been in the diverse mix of our people, our beers and our brands. At Carlsberg, we want to recruit and develop people with a global mindset, cultural understanding, and international experience to ensure that our organization stays agile, inclusive and prepared for future growth. Only by acknowledging and harvesting from different perspectives and experiences, will we gain competitive advantage and leverage the effect of diversity for business growth. Carlsberg aims to create equal access to opportunity regardless of social identity, and we encourage everyone to apply regardless of gender, nationality, race, religion or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you curious about modern software development and looking for your next challenge? At Deloitte Engineering, we are seeking recent graduates and candidates with up to two years of full-time experience in software engineering who want to take an active role in improving their technical and problem-solving competencies while growing our Engineering practice.




With more than 3,000 employees, Deloitte is the largest audit and consultancy firm in Denmark. We tailor solutions across Audit, Tax, Financial Advisory Services, Enterprise Risk Services, Technology, and Transformations.




About the team

We, the Engineering offering of Deloitte Technology & Transformation Denmark, are on the lookout for additional team players for our quickly growing practice of software engineers, architects, cloud consultants, and IT management consultants. We assist our clients, some of the largest companies, agencies, and organizations in Denmark and the Nordics, on the implementation of new cloud-native systems as part of their digital transformation, and we need you to help build their opportunities and meet their challenges!




Together, we will accelerate your career towards becoming a proficient software engineer. At Deloitte, we are committed to empowering you throughout your career development. As a new employee, you are assigned a talent manager to support your career aspirations and development. You will also be part of a tech community with monthly meetings in which we share knowledge, investigate new topics, and upskill within relevant technologies and methodologies.




Job Description

As a Junior Software Engineer in Deloitte Engineering, you will work with the full software lifecycle, all the way from architecting the solution and writing code to integrating and deploying the solution. You will work closely with both clients and internal stakeholders to ensure that our solutions meet their business needs and their technical requirements. Our client assignments can vary greatly, but common to all of them is that we strive to work with the technologies that the client prefers. Regardless of the technology, we provide you with the opportunity and tools needed to learn and grow within all of them.




In this role, you will make an impact by:

Developing applications and solutions of all sizes, frequently in Agile settings (SAFE/Scrum). This includes both backend and frontend development.
Assisting in designing and architecting solutions, often in a Cloud context.
Assisting in the implementation of CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and adopting DevOps practices to streamline development workflows.
Building internal capabilities through community tasks, maybe within new business areas.
Joining in on workshops, sales pitches, and contributing to proposals for new client projects.




Qualifications

You hold a Master‚Äôs degree, preferably with a focus on Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other relevant fields such as Information Technology or Software Design. You have either:

Recently graduated (or expect to graduate in the summer of 2025) and have relevant experience from part-time positions, utilizing your analytical and problem-solving skill set, or
You have up to two years of full-time experience in software engineering positions, preferably working closely with business stakeholders.




Furthermore, you are either a native Danish speaker or highly proficient in written and spoken Danish.

What you bring to the team:

Experience in Java, C#/.NET, JavaScript, TypeScript, or one or more other widely used programming languages.
Strong analytical skills, a focus on quality and detail, and a proven ability to solve problems in a structured way.
Preferably some experience with DevOps practices such as CI/CD, IaC, and test automation.
A positive, team-oriented mindset and a hunger for learning new technologies.
Excellent communication skills and an ability to express yourself clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.




Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.




What we can offer you

We highly appreciate the variation in knowledge, experience, and perspectives our consultants bring to the table. In exchange, we make sure that you develop professionally and are supported and encouraged to meet your career goals‚Äîfor example, we offer our consultants:

Enrolment in the Consultant Academy, which is our training program for building the essential Consultant skills. The Academy takes you to exciting locations to learn from leading professionals in their respective fields.
Focused career development by assigning you a talent manager who acts as your mentor and guides you in your professional journey at Deloitte.
Continuous learning opportunities within Software Engineering, Cloud, and Agile Ways of Working, for example, through certification courses.
The opportunity to participate in projects and internal work with our different market offerings to find the right fit for you.




On the social aspect, Deloitte Technology & Transformation is second to none. We offer everything from various sports communities to dinners and parties all year round, as well as a yearly trip where all our colleagues come together off-site to create lasting memories. We have a strong culture and community in Engineering, and we support each other every day to make an impact with our clients and to promote our personal and professional development.




Additional Information




Do you want to be part of our team?




Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.




Send your application, CV, grade transcripts from both Bachelor‚Äôs and Master‚Äôs studies, and other relevant documents by 30.09.2025. We process applications and arrange interviews continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible.




Please note that it is a requirement to have a Danish work permit to be considered for this position.




Expected start date: 01.11.2025




Please do not hesitate to contact Sophus Benee Olsen at +45 30 93 61 88 if you have any questions about the position.




We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.

By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.




We look forward to connecting with you!




In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths ‚Äì because that is how we can make a difference.

  • Developing applications and solutions of all sizes, frequently in Agile settings (SAFE/Scrum). This includes both backend and frontend development.

  • Assisting in the implementation of CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and adopting DevOps practices to streamline development workflows.
  • Building internal capabilities through community tasks, maybe within new business areas.
  • Joining in on workshops, sales pitches, and contributing to proposals for new client projects.


Qualifications

You hold a Master‚Äôs degree, preferably with a focus on Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other relevant fields such as Information Technology or Software Design. You have either:

  • Recently graduated (or expect to graduate in the summer of 2025) and have relevant experience from part-time positions, utilizing your analytical and problem-solving skill set, or
  • You have up to two years of full-time experience in software engineering positions, preferably working closely with business stakeholders.


Furthermore, you are either a native Danish speaker or highly proficient in written and spoken Danish.

What you bring to the team:

  • Experience in Java, C#/.NET, JavaScript, TypeScript, or one or more other widely used programming languages.
  • Strong analytical skills, a focus on quality and detail, and a proven ability to solve problems in a structured way.
  • Preferably some experience with DevOps practices such as CI/CD, IaC, and test automation.
  • A positive, team-oriented mindset and a hunger for learning new technologies.
  • Excellent communication skills and an ability to express yourself clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.


Even if you do not see yourself in all the bullets above, we still encourage you to apply if you believe your skills can make an impact on our team.


What we can offer you

We highly appreciate the variation in knowledge, experience, and perspectives our consultants bring to the table. In exchange, we make sure that you develop professionally and are supported and encouraged to meet your career goals‚Äîfor example, we offer our consultants:

  • Enrolment in the Consultant Academy, which is our training program for building the essential Consultant skills. The Academy takes you to exciting locations to learn from leading professionals in their respective fields.
  • Focused career development by assigning you a talent manager who acts as your mentor and guides you in your professional journey at Deloitte.
  • Continuous learning opportunities within Software Engineering, Cloud, and Agile Ways of Working, for example, through certification courses.
  • The opportunity to participate in projects and internal work with our different market offerings to find the right fit for you.


On the social aspect, Deloitte Technology & Transformation is second to none. We offer everything from various sports communities to dinners and parties all year round, as well as a yearly trip where all our colleagues come together off-site to create lasting memories. We have a strong culture and community in Engineering, and we support each other every day to make an impact with our clients and to promote our personal and professional development.


Additional Information


Do you want to be part of our team?


Click the "I am interested" button above if you are ready to join our team.


Send your application, CV, grade transcripts from both Bachelor‚Äôs and Master‚Äôs studies, and other relevant documents by 30.09.2025. We process applications and arrange interviews continually, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible.


Please note that it is a requirement to have a Danish work permit to be considered for this position.


Expected start date: 01.11.2025


Please do not hesitate to contact Sophus Benee Olsen at +45 30 93 61 88 if you have any questions about the position.


We encourage all candidates to apply for the position regardless of, e.g., age, gender (gender identity and gender expression), sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, nationality, or disability.

By applying for this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We have designed these standards to provide a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.


We look forward to connecting with you!


In Deloitte, you will find passionate, caring people who are curious by nature and striving to evolve. We value our different skills, perspectives and experiences and foster an environment where innovative powers thrive. To us, success is the feeling that the work we are doing will outlast us. The impact we make is not about what we achieve as individuals, but how we enable those around us to be their very best. From professional development to leadership opportunities, we empower our people to be extraordinary by playing to their strengths ‚Äì because that is how we can make a difference.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Senior Data Scientist

We are seeking an exceptional Senior Data Scientist to join our highly skilled team in Copenhagen. You will play a pivotal role in developing a state-of-the-art system that leverages Bayesian statistics and advanced theoretical concepts to estimate and understand the size of marketing and advertising audiences. This initiative is a cornerstone of Choreograph‚Äôs broader mission to revolutionise analytics capabilities across the organisation using AI and data science.

You will thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment where objectives evolve rapidly and complex, abstract problems are the norm. If you are passionate about tackling challenging statistical and mathematical problems, and enjoy working collaboratively with other experts, we want to hear from you.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and implement Bayesian statistical models and other advanced analytical methods to estimate audience sizes and characteristics.
Collaborate closely with a multidisciplinary team to design, build, and refine data-driven solutions.
Write high-quality, production-ready Python code including package development, unit testing, and documentation.
Work independently to solve complex mathematical and conceptual problems with minimal supervision.
Engage in productive, abstract discussions with team members to untangle nuanced issues and arrive at robust solutions.
Contribute to code repositories using Git and participate in code reviews and version control best practices.
Utilize cloud computing resources for scalable data processing and model deployment.
Handle diverse data formats and ensure data integrity throughout the analytics pipeline.
Adapt quickly to changing project requirements and priorities.


Must-Have Qualifications & Skills


Postgraduate-level knowledge in probability and statistics, with a strong foundation in Bayesian methods.
Advanced Python programming skills, including experience with building packages, unit testing, and handling multiple data formats.
Demonstrated ability to solve complex mathematical and statistical problems.
Resilience and confidence in facing difficult, open-ended challenges.
Adaptability to dynamic, fast-changing environments, ideally with experience in startup-like or high-pressure settings.
Ability to work independently and creatively, finding solutions to novel problems with minimal supervision.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in discussing and resolving abstract or conceptual issues.
Familiarity with Git and repository management.
Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).


Nice-to-Have Skills & Experience


Programming experience in Scala and understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
Knowledge of set theory and propositional logic.
Background in media, advertising, or digital advertising analytics.
Familiarity with the unique challenges of audience measurement and marketing analytics.


What We Offer


The opportunity to work on cutting-edge analytics projects with global impact.
A collaborative, intellectually stimulating environment with leading experts.
Flexible, fast-moving work culture similar to a startup, within the stability of a global organization.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Access to world-class resources and professional development opportunities.


We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we‚Äôve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram,‚ÄØLinkedIn, and‚ÄØX.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.
Show more

Title: Senior Consultant, Strategy & Transformation
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for ambitious and passionate consultants with solid experience in project and change management within the field of data & analytics. More specifically, we seek a Senior Consultant to join our fast-growing Copenhagen office.

Are you our new Senior Consultant?

Do you want to be part of an exciting journey where you will get plenty of responsibility and influence? Then you need to read on!

We are looking for passionate and curious people that want to drive and execute projects within the field of data & analytics. Our portfolio of customers is diverse from the life science industry to the entertainment industry ‚Äì and still expanding. No project is the same, and the energy is high. You will have a dynamic work week where you will be responsible for driving projects, setting the agenda for our customers, and playing a pivotal role in executing project deliveries. We are a family of over 60 Intellishorians who typically work in teams and thrive on each other‚Äôs energy.

Development is at the core of Intellishore, and we have dedicated plans for each Intellishorian and internal academy sessions for upskilling and knowledge sharing. You will also get the opportunity to influence and drive the development of Intellishore to ensure we deliver value to our clients across different industries and business areas.

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore was founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical support. Today, we are more than 60 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; engineers, economists, marketers, and software developers.

We are Intellishorians; a family, a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.

What are we looking for in a Senior Consultant?

We Are Looking For An Experienced Individual With The Competencies And Professional Mindset To Lead Large Strategic & Technical Projects. If You Can Nod Your Head At Some Or All Of The Following Attributes, Then You Could Be The Person We Are Looking For


A proven track record for driving data & analytics projects
Natural flair for relation-building, stakeholder management, and communication
Proven experience in strategic consulting and project management (Experience with agile and design thinking is a +)
Is PowerPoint one of your best friends, and do you like hanging out on a regular ‚Äì Then this is a job for you!
We take great pride in our slides ‚Äì and this is not just slides. But it is conveying complex things in structured ways and frameworks that have the customer at the center
Academic background in IT, engineering, economics, or management from, e.g., CBS, ITU, DTU, KU
Energetic, outgoing, and ambitious personality with strong communication skills (preferably in English and Danish)



And do not worry about whether you have too much or too little experience. We are always looking for curious and passionate people to join our family, and your title will be matched your level of seniority and expertise.

What can we offer you?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging project manager role in strategic & technical data & analytics projects

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

An entrepreneurial work environment with ambitious and innovative colleagues

3 | Influence

Unique opportunity for influencing and directing Intellishore's strategic journey

4 | Strategic seminars

A yearly strategic seminar where all Intellishorians spend time strategizing and team-building (in previous years, we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, Iceland, & Germany)

5 | Sustainable consulting

A consulting career with high levels of flexibility allowing for work-life balance

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & analytics, and we are constantly expanding our reach

"At Intellishore, it's not about doing a lot of client projects but about enhancing our client's capabilities to make better and more informed decisions so they can proceed with their data & analytics journey themselves."

Kasper Nyvold

Senior Manager, Intellishore

Apply now

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the formula below. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to David Andreasen Lyngh: dly@intellishore.dk / +45 28 59 42 76.

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside of the EU or the Nordics.
Show more

Kasper Nyvold

Senior Manager, Intellishore

Apply now

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the formula below. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to David Andreasen Lyngh: dly@intellishore.dk / +45 28 59 42 76.

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside of the EU or the Nordics.

Title: Technology Development Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
SLB Capturi Is a Leading Carbon Capture Technology Company.‚ÄØ

We serve a range of carbon-emitting industries including cement, blue hydrogen, bio/waste-to-energy, and gas-to-power among others. Through our portfolio of projects, we are mitigating the environmental cost of industrial activity for a cleaner, more sustainable future. We see a daily growth in our market potential as a rising number of customers look to carbon capture utilization and storage (CCUS) and our company to solve their emissions challenges.

SLB Capturi is one of the leading companies globally that has extensive knowledge of the entire CCUS value chain. We have many ongoing projects, from research and innovation, including pilot plant testing, to concept studies and to large EPC projects, both in Europe and in the United States. Today, we are delivering seven carbon capture units in Europe, with an accumulated capture capacity of 1 million tonnes of CO2. In Denmark, we are delivering five Just Catch 100 units to √òrsted, in the Netherlands one Just Catch 100 unit to Twence, and in Norway a Big Catch to Heidelberg Materials.

Are you ready to work with us to realise the potential CCUS has in making a lasting, positive impact on our environment?

As SLB Capturi's Technology Development Manager, you will be at the forefront of shaping the next generation of carbon capture solutions.

You will lead high-impact R&D programs and technology qualification projects, ensuring our most important technology initiatives move from concepts to real-world applications.

This is a role for someone who thrives at the intersection of deep technical expertise and strategic and innovative thinking.

You will combine a strong foundation in process systems and chemical engineering with the ability to align complex projects to business objectives.

Experience with carbon capture processes is a plus, but your ability to see the bigger picture, connect the dots, and drive innovation across multiple stakeholders is what will set you apart.

Expect to work closely with senior technical leaders, subject matter experts, and external research partners, influencing the direction of our technology for years to come.

Responsibilities:


Initiate and lead R&D projects on carbon capture technology
Plan and execute large-scale technology qualification programs
Contribute to the development of the technology strategy and roadmap for carbon capture
Maintain a holistic overview of all ongoing R&D and technology qualification activities to ensure alignment and efficiency
Drive progress in R&D and technology qualification
Manage budgets and schedules for all assigned R&D and technology qualification activities


Requirements


Master's or PhD in Chemical, Process, or Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent experience.
Proven experience leading R&D programs and technology qualification projects in process industries
Knowledge of carbon capture processes is a plus
Strong technical understanding of process systems and ability to connect technology with business impact
Hands-on experience with technology qualification, validation, or demonstration activities


Personal attributes:


Excellent coordination, communication, and stakeholder management skills
Strategic mindset with the ability to maintain a holistic view across multiple programs
Proactive, results-driven, and comfortable making decisions in complex environments


This Is What We Offer

Not just a job, but a career you can take an active role in the industrial energy transition. We believe carbon capture is essential to reach the goals of the Paris Agreement. We value the feeling of belonging, and this role will be crucial in supporting SLB Capturi to help the industry meet its carbon capture obligations. As our colleague, you will be given opportunities and responsibility to develop with our company. We can offer a dynamic and challenging environment in a growing ESG company.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

Regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we will be conducting interviews with relevant candidates on a continuous basis.

Contact information

If you have any questions or would like some more information, please contact our recruiter: Julie Wannebo; julie.wannebo@nesadvantage.com.
Show more

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
üöÄ We're Hiring: MLOps Engineer | Copenhagen | Hybrid Work

Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)




Are you passionate about building reliable, scalable platforms for machine learning? We‚Äôre looking for an experienced IT Platform Engineer to help shape and support a cutting-edge MLOps environment that powers real-time model deployment and scoring across critical domains, including fraud detection and online payments.




üåç The Role

Join a collaborative squad focused on delivering a future-proof MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You'll take ownership of automating model life cycles‚Äîfrom development to deployment‚Äîand build CI/CD workflows, infrastructure as code, and robust ML pipelines that scale with enterprise needs.




üîß Tech You‚Äôll Use

Cloud: AWS (extensive use), Databricks
Languages: Python, PySpark
Infra: Terraform, Docker, GitHub Actions
Tools: MLflow for model tracking/versioning, container orchestration
Bonus: Experience with Kafka or Pub/Sub streaming is a big plus!




üéØ What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Develop and maintain automated pipelines for ML model training, validation, and inference
Build CI/CD workflows that seamlessly move models into production
Containerize ML workloads and manage infrastructure using best-in-class tools
Collaborate in an agile setup




üë§ About You

You bring at least 2 years of hands-on experience in MLOps, solid cloud knowledge, strong Python and infrastructure-as-code skills, and an eye for performance and reliability. You‚Äôre a proactive problem-solver, a team player, and passionate about scaling ML in production.




üíº What‚Äôs In It for You

A human-centred, inclusive work culture
Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)
Flexible hybrid working setup
Access to development programs and professional certifications
Comprehensive health, insurance, and well-being benefits
A competitive compensation package and extra leave options




üìçLocation: Copenhagen

üìÖ Apply now and help us transform how machine learning supports real-world impact.

#MLOps #Python #AWS #Databricks #Terraform #CI/CD #MachineLearning #TechJobs #CopenhagenJobs #HiringNow #CloudEngineering

  • Infra: Terraform, Docker, GitHub Actions
  • Tools: MLflow for model tracking/versioning, container orchestration
  • Bonus: Experience with Kafka or Pub/Sub streaming is a big plus!


üéØ What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Develop and maintain automated pipelines for ML model training, validation, and inference
  • Build CI/CD workflows that seamlessly move models into production
  • Containerize ML workloads and manage infrastructure using best-in-class tools
  • Collaborate in an agile setup


üë§ About You

You bring at least 2 years of hands-on experience in MLOps, solid cloud knowledge, strong Python and infrastructure-as-code skills, and an eye for performance and reliability. You‚Äôre a proactive problem-solver, a team player, and passionate about scaling ML in production.


üíº What‚Äôs In It for You

  • A human-centred, inclusive work culture
  • Flexible salary range but roughly 50,000 DKK - 75,000 DKK p/m (Some flexibility)
  • Flexible hybrid working setup
  • Access to development programs and professional certifications
  • Comprehensive health, insurance, and well-being benefits
  • A competitive compensation package and extra leave options


üìçLocation: Copenhagen

üìÖ Apply now and help us transform how machine learning supports real-world impact.

#MLOps #Python #AWS #Databricks #Terraform #CI/CD #MachineLearning #TechJobs #CopenhagenJobs #HiringNow #CloudEngineering

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
There‚Äôs no quality healthcare without a quality platform. And no powerful AI without a developer experience that just works.

Doctors and nurses are facing immense pressure: growing administrative burdens, tighter resources, and the risk of burnout. They deserve tools that restore their focus on care, not paperwork. Corti began by building the world‚Äôs leading AI assistant for healthcare, supporting clinicians in real time by listening, documenting, prompting, and safeguarding critical conversations.

Now, we‚Äôre opening up that intelligence through our API platform‚Äîenabling developers, partners, and providers to build with Corti‚Äôs AI in their own tools and workflows. From ambient scribing to clinical decision support, our infrastructure is unlocking new ways to scale healthcare excellence.

Entire health systems trust Corti. Millions of patient interactions have already been improved by our AI. With your help, we‚Äôll reach millions more.

At Corti, we are growing fast and always looking for skillful people to ensure we go in the right direction. If you enjoy working in an autonomous and collaborative team, guided by shared values and a willingness to act, iterate, and learn, then join us at Corti as a Senior Machine Learning Engineer

üìå As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be part of our machine learning R&D team and work closely with our product teams. The machine learning R&D team consists of seasoned engineers as well as several Ph.D. students and postdocs collaborating with Danish and international universities. Our product teams are cross-functional and own product discovery and delivery end-to-end.

You can read more about our research and publications here: https://corti.ai/company/research

Our vision, products, and solutions to enrich patient consultations are described here: https://corti.ai/

In this role, you will work alongside our other machine learning engineers and researchers, developing new models, implementing state-of-the-art research outputs, and translating those outputs into tangible product outcomes. For example, you might be involved in the prototyping a new machine learning-based product feature in collaboration with other teams. Or you might work independently on taking state-of-the-art research and assessing how well it works in Corti‚Äôs domain. There are many possibilities and plenty of room for creativity and bringing in your own ideas.

The impact you'll have


Develop prototypes based on cutting-edge applied machine learning working on audio, text, and structured data sources.
Own the technical translation of state-of-the-art machine learning innovations to inform the development of new product features.
Design and implement well-defined APIs for new machine learning tools to make them available for customers and across the organization.
Participate in research ventures and drive publication at top machine learning venues or impactful digital medicine journals.
Improve healthcare globally as part of your daily work.


You'll thrive in this role if you have the following


A higher university degree or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, or a related interdisciplinary field.
In-depth experience with Python and strong command of data structures and algorithms in order to contribute to production-grade code.
In-depth knowledge of one or more of the major machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow).
Experience building agents or agentic workflows
Ability to manage machine learning research projects and clearly communicate outcomes to technical and non-technical audiences.


Nice to have


Publication history at top machine learning venues (e.g., NeurIPS, ACL, or digital medicine journals) that shows that you can drive research projects.
Hands-on experience with automatic speech recognition or natural language processing.


Practicalities


The work location for this position is preferred in Copenhagen, but we can be flexible with the right candidate.
This is a full-time position, starting as soon as possible.


Ready to dive into the world of Corti? Hit that 'Apply' button, and let's start working together on reshaping the dialogue in healthcare, making a real difference for millions of patient outcomes around the world.

ü§ù Bringing in top talent from all backgrounds is crucial in our pursuit to improve the world of healthcare. We encourage applications from all people and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, and/or disability status.Ôªø

At Corti, experience comes in many forms, and we‚Äôre passionate about creating teams with a multitude of perspectives! If you believe your experience is close to what we‚Äôre looking for but not an exact match, we still hope you‚Äôll consider applying!

Title: Tutor
Description:
Filo is the world‚Äôs only live instant tutoring app where students are connected with expert tutors in less than 60 seconds for 1-1, interactive video sessions. Filo works 24*7 and the tutors are always available to explain, help, solve, in short, do whatever it takes to assist the student in that very moment. More than 1.5 million students across 15+ countries are using Filo to make their everyday learning better. Currently, there are 50,000+ tutors on Filo which makes it the largest community of tutors in the world.As a company, we are an emerging youth-oriented e-learning startup that thrives on problem-solving capability and a positive attitude. As a team, we are on a mission to democratise education and make quality learning accessible for every student around the world.

The Role

This is a part-time remote role for an Online Tutor at Filo. The Online Tutor will conduct interactive video tutoring sessions with students, assist in explaining concepts, solving problems, and ensuring students' understanding. Tutors will leverage Filo's platform to provide personalized support and guidance to students in various subjects.

Ideal Profile


Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Expertise in subject matter being taught
Experience in conducting online tutoring sessions
Ability to explain concepts clearly and effectively
Patience and adaptability in teaching methods
Comfortable with technology and online educational tools
Previous teaching or tutoring experience is a plus
Bachelor's degree in the relevant field


What's on Offer?


Flexible working options
Opportunity to make a positive impact
Excellent career development opportunities

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist (contract)

Location: London Hybrid. Travel to the London office on an adhoc basis

Duration: 6 months

Contract Start Date: 1 September 2025




Deloitte

Working with the Deloitte Associate (Contractor) Programme means we can offer you the opportunity to work on a variation of industry and client related projects. Our aim is to retain the best talent and so when your project end date nears our team of Talent Community Advisors will be working with you to look at alternative projects within the firm that suit your experience should you wish to continue with Deloitte.




The Role

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Data and AI Team supporting internal service delivery transformation projects across Tax and Legal. You will be a Python and Azure expert in designing and building cutting-edge generative AI solutions for complex challenges. You will report to the Technical Lead and collaborate with data scientists, software engineers and market specialists across the team to build and deliver high-impact solutions.




Essential Skills and Experience




Be an expert Python programmer proficient in frameworks/libraries such as: Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Langchain, Llamaindex, Azure AI Foundry amongst others.
Must have Azure and be an expert with R&D on generative AI techniques
Practical experience with GenAI techniques such as Finetuning, Prompt engineering, prompt orchestration, retrieval methods (RAG and Knowledge graph techniques), Agentic Systems etc.
Knowledge of Agentic frameworks such as LangGraph, Azure AI Foundry Agents, Semantic Kernel Agents etc.
Knowledge of prompt orchestration and optimisation techniques such as Azure Semantic Kernel, Prompt flow etc.
Skilled at working with AI engineers to write production ready python code and implementing robust quality control methods in solutions
Have knowledge of basic software engineering concepts and best practices for team-based programming, including versioning, testing, and deployment




Desirable:




Adept at creating highly optimised workflows and solutions
Deep knowledge of various Microsoft Azure AI services
Strong data analytics and visualisation skills specifically using tools like Excel and Alteryx
Knowledge of Responsible AI practices




Deliverables: Responsibilities but not limited to:

Build and deploy Python based AI applications
Research and design advanced experiments and prototypes using cutting edge techniques, specifically in GenAI
Develop various LLM assisted frameworks
Design and write clean, maintainable, auditable and well documented codebases
Implement testing pipelines and evaluation frameworks
Good documentation practices to ensure seamless operations
Exceptional teamwork and communication skills working in a cross functional environment with other data scientists, software engineers and T&L domain experts




IR35

As a means of managing tax, commercial and reputational risks, Deloitte prohibits the use of Associates through Personal Service Companies (‚ÄòPSCs‚Äô). All Associates must contract under PAYE arrangements through a Deloitte approved ‚ÄòEmployment Company‚Äô (aka ‚Äòumbrella company.‚Äô)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who We Are



Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.







We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!





Job Description



The Opportunity



As a Data Scientist at Cint you will have the opportunity to work alongside our Data Science and Analytics teams and collaborate with product and engineering teams to work on Identity and Data Solutions products. This includes vendor analysis and onboarding, establishing statistical methodology and modeling standards and development. The ideal candidate is a self-starter comfortable working with large datasets and knowledgeable in statistical and machine learning techniques, with an eagerness to learn and contribute to the development and validation of products that align Cint capabilities with the market.



What ou will do



Support research and discovery phase for new and existing products/models. The primary areas include Identity and Data Solutions.



Actively participate in the development and enhancement of our Identity Graph, utilizing statistical and machine learning techniques to improve accuracy.



Drive the onboarding and validation of new data vendors, by establishing statistical methodologies and conducting comprehensive analysis to ensure new data partners meet our quality standards.



Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, with an emphasis on data quality and reliability.



Respond to ad hoc requests from internal teams and clients, performing analyses and producing summary results.



Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver on broader project goals.



Participate in developing methodologies, model validation, and maintenance and enhancement of existing statistical and machine learning models.



Support evaluation and validation of both internal and external products to ensure Cint‚Äôs success.



Communicate insights and recommendations through visualizations and presentations that will resonate with a wide range of audiences.





Qualifications



What we are looking for



Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Statistics, Quantitative Sciences, Data Science, Operations Research or other quantitative fields.



2 years of experience in a data science and analytics capacity, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.



Ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large data sources independently.



Familiarity with core statistical concepts and techniques (e.g. properties of distributions, hypothesis testing, parametric/non-parametric tests, survey design, sampling theory, experimental design, regression/predictive modeling, stochastic modeling/simulation, and more).



Exposure to a variety of machine learning methods (clustering, regression, tree-based models, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.



Practical experience applying statistical and modeling techniques.



Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.



Comfortable with learning new methods, tools, and techniques.



Able to complete assigned tasks independently while collaborating on overall project direction and broader project goals



Proficiency in Python (as it relates to statistical analysis and implementing Machine Learning models)



Bonus points if you have



Experience with Identity vendors



Experience in online survey methodologies



Experience in Identity graph methodologies



Ability to write and optimize SQL queries



Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark)





Additional Information















Our Values



Collaboration is our superpower



We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.

Innovation is in our blood



We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.

We do what we say



We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.

We are caring



We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.





More About Cint



We‚Äôre proud to be recognised in Newsweek‚Äôs 2025 Global Top 100 Most Loved Workplaces¬Æ, reflecting our commitment to a culture of trust, respect, and employee growth.





In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.







Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)



Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
hackajob is collaborating with Verisk to connect them with exceptional tech professionals for this role.

Junior Data Scientist

Are you looking to kick-start your career in data science? Passionate about solving real-world problems using advanced analytics and machine learning? Join Verisk, a global leader in data analytics, and be part of a collaborative team that‚Äôs shaping the future of risk management.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As a Junior Data Scientist, you‚Äôll support the design and development of data-driven models that power our industry-leading insurance solutions. You‚Äôll get hands-on experience with projects ranging from supervised machine learning and clustering, to natural language processing and network analysis.

Responsibilities

This is an opportunity to:


Work on real-life projects with guidance from experienced data scientists
Explore and analyze complex datasets to extract actionable insights
Build and test models using techniques like GLM, GBM, Random Forests, and Neural Networks
Communicate your findings through clear reports and presentations
Help bring models from concept to production
Collaborate with a high-performing team that values curiosity, creativity, and learning


Qualifications

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

We‚Äôre seeking bright, enthusiastic individuals early in their careers who have:


Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal
A degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Physics)
Programming experience in Python and SQL
An understanding of data cleaning, manipulation, and basic statistical techniques
A keen eye for detail and a passion for solving problems
A desire to learn about the insurance and risk analytics space


Why Join Us?


Make a real impact from day one
Develop your skills in a supportive, team-oriented environment
Work on a variety of exciting and meaningful projects
Learn from some of the brightest minds in the industry
Enjoy great career progression opportunities


About Us

For over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.

At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.

For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work¬Æ for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work¬Æ Certification, we‚Äôve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companies and by Forbes as a World‚Äôs Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.

We‚Äôre 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions ‚Äî provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions ‚Äî supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions ‚Äî offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions ‚Äî provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions ‚Äî provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions ‚Äî delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Life Insurance Solutions - offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.

Verisk Maplecroft ‚Äî provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. Verisk‚Äôs minimum hiring age is 18 except in countries with a higher age limit subject to applicable law.

HTML:
hackajob is collaborating with Verisk to connect them with exceptional tech professionals for this role.

Junior Data Scientist

Are you looking to kick-start your career in data science? Passionate about solving real-world problems using advanced analytics and machine learning? Join Verisk, a global leader in data analytics, and be part of a collaborative team that‚Äôs shaping the future of risk management.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As a Junior Data Scientist, you‚Äôll support the design and development of data-driven models that power our industry-leading insurance solutions. You‚Äôll get hands-on experience with projects ranging from supervised machine learning and clustering, to natural language processing and network analysis.

Responsibilities

This is an opportunity to:

  • Work on real-life projects with guidance from experienced data scientists
  • Explore and analyze complex datasets to extract actionable insights
  • Build and test models using techniques like GLM, GBM, Random Forests, and Neural Networks
  • Communicate your findings through clear reports and presentations
  • Help bring models from concept to production
  • Collaborate with a high-performing team that values curiosity, creativity, and learning

Qualifications

What We‚Äôre Looking For:

We‚Äôre seeking bright, enthusiastic individuals early in their careers who have:

  • Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal
  • A degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Physics)
  • Programming experience in Python and SQL
  • An understanding of data cleaning, manipulation, and basic statistical techniques
  • A keen eye for detail and a passion for solving problems
  • A desire to learn about the insurance and risk analytics space

Why Join Us?

  • Make a real impact from day one
  • Develop your skills in a supportive, team-oriented environment
  • Work on a variety of exciting and meaningful projects
  • Learn from some of the brightest minds in the industry
  • Enjoy great career progression opportunities

About Us

For over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.

At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.

For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work¬Æ for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work¬Æ Certification, we‚Äôve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companies and by Forbes as a World‚Äôs Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.

We‚Äôre 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions ‚Äî provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions ‚Äî supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions ‚Äî offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions ‚Äî provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions ‚Äî provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions ‚Äî delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Life Insurance Solutions - offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.

Verisk Maplecroft ‚Äî provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. Verisk‚Äôs minimum hiring age is 18 except in countries with a higher age limit subject to applicable law.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We Are Redefining How People Approach Their Health

ZOE is the science and nutrition company leading a movement to transform the health of millions.

We exist because the food we eat is making us sick. Most of what we are taught about food is wrong.

ZOE runs the world‚Äôs largest nutrition science study to find scientifically proven solutions.

Our randomised controlled trial of ZOE proves that if you eat the right food for your body, you can feel healthier in weeks and be on track for more healthy years.

ZOE can change the way you eat, feel, and live. We host world-leading scientists on our podcast and bring proven science to your plate with Daily30+, our 30+ plant supplement.

Over 100,000 people rely on ZOE Membership, our personalised nutrition program, to make smarter food choices. ZOE Membership turns complex science into clear step-by-step actions, helping you improve your health with every meal.

ZOE means life ‚Äî and you can change your life with food.

Visit our career page and become a ZOEntist üöÄ

üöÄ The Role

As a Data Scientist at ZOE, you will partner with world-class nutrition scientists to turn cutting-edge research into robust scoring algorithms and science-driven features, and to build ML/AI models that leverage our extensive members‚Äô data to improve user experience and health outcomes.

This role is perfect for someone passionate about nutrition, health tech, or biology, or someone with the curiosity and drive to dive in and learn quickly.

Unlike a classical ‚Äúfit-the-model‚Äù data science role, you‚Äôll also engineer bespoke models that embed expert knowledge, validate them rigorously on real-world data, and ship production-ready code that powers the ZOE experience. You‚Äôll collaborate daily with scientists, engineers, and product teams‚Äîmoving fast and iterating quickly based on strong but not perfect evidence (:70 %) because speed beats perfection in a startup.

üë• The Team

You‚Äôll be joining the Data Science team at Zoe. The team spends most of its time embedded in stream-aligned product teams while regularly setting aside a smaller portion of its schedule to drive high-impact, cross-cutting data science initiatives for the wider organisation.

Your home base will be the Scoring team‚Äîa cross-functional team of product managers, engineers, scientists, and data scientists that sits at the nexus of research and product. You‚Äôll join a squad that prizes intellectual honesty, rapid experimentation, and our #ActFast ethos‚Äîworking hand-in-hand with PhD scientists to turn hypotheses into deployed models.

üéØ What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Design, iterate, and deploy scoring algorithms for foods, diets, metabolic responses, and microbiome profiles.
Translate expert food statements (e.g., ‚ÄòHigh-glycaemic foods raise blood glucose responses‚Äô) into model features and Python functions.
Build, test, and maintain clean, production-ready code in Python (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn), and SQL/DBT/BigQuery/Airflow.
Build ML/AI models to improve food coverage and categorisation, ingredients extraction, food recommendations, and more.
Design validation frameworks that blend scientific rigour (e.g., hold-out tests, bootstrapping, sensitivity analyses) with pragmatic speed.
Partner with engineers to shape data contracts and ensure pipelines deliver the granularity, latency, and quality your models require.
Present results using decks, dashboards, or Looms to support data-driven product decisions.
Take full ownership of your work, brining entrepreneurial spirit and work proactively.
Champion our scientific yet agile approach: start with a hypothesis, seek evidence, and iterate fast.



üß† What You‚Äôll Bring To The Table


3+ years of professional experience in data science, ML engineering, or quantitative research.
A degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Applied Maths, Physics, Biomedical Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science).
Solid grasp of machine learning (e.g. training and evaluating standard models) and statistical techniques (e.g. running hypothesis testing).
Experienced in contributing to production-level Python codebases, developing new components and features, writing moderately complex SQL queries, and using Git for version control.
Experience turning domain knowledge (rules, heuristics, scientific findings) into engineered model logic.
A track record of shipping production code and collaborating in cross-functional, fast-paced environments.
Comfort using AI tools to enhance day-to-day productivity‚Äîfrom IDEs with AI assistants to prompt engineering.
Strong communication and collaboration skills‚Äîfrom delivering clear presentations to stakeholders to conducting deep-dive code reviews and working collaboratively across functions.
Must have a passion for nutrition, health tech, biology, or a strong desire to dive in and learn quickly.
A commitment to our #ActFast value: optimise for reversible decisions, take smart risks, and move quickly with imperfect data.



üåü Bonus Points


Experience with causal inference and advanced statistical modelling.
Experience with building AI features using LLMs and evaluation frameworks.
Exposure to MLOps best practices.
Knowledge of microbiome data, ---omics pipelines, or biomarker analytics.



‚ú® Our Hiring Journey


üëã Stage 1: Talent Screening Interview ‚Äì 30 mins ‚Äì With Laia, Talent Acquisition Manager



A first conversation to learn more about your background, motivations, and interest in joining ZOE. We'll also give you an overview of the role, team, and what to expect from the process.


üí° Stage 2: Hiring Manager Interview ‚Äì 45 mins ‚Äì With Joan or Francesca, Data Science Leads



A deeper dive into your experience, technical strengths, and areas of interest. We‚Äôll explore the impact of your previous work, how you approach problem-solving, and what excites you about data science at ZOE.


üß™ Stage 3: Final Round Interviews



Technical Interview ‚Äì 60 mins

An interactive session to assess your data science skills. You might walk us through past work, discuss a technical challenge, or solve a problem live ‚Äî it‚Äôs all about understanding how you think and approach real-world problems.

Cross-Functional Interview ‚Äì 45 mins

You‚Äôll meet team members from other disciplines (like product, engineering, or nutrition science). We want to see how you collaborate across teams and communicate complex ideas in a clear, accessible way.

Leadership & Behavioural Interview ‚Äì45 mins

A behavioural-style interview focusing on how you lead projects (with or without a formal title), work under pressure, handle ambiguity, and contribute to team culture. We'll also take time to answer any remaining questions you have.


üéâ Offer



If everything clicks, we‚Äôll move to offer quickly and transparently. You'll always know where you stand and what comes next.

The experience, skills, and attributes listed above reflect what we believe will contribute to success in this role. If you're passionate about ZOE and the opportunity, but don't meet 100% of the criteria, we still encourage you to apply. We are committed to supporting growth and are happy to offer up-skilling opportunities where possible.

Remote Philosophy

ZOE is a remote-first company, meaning remote work isn‚Äôt just an option ‚Äî it‚Äôs how we work best. We are intentional about building a distributed, high-performing team where collaboration, trust, and flexibility thrive.

We design our workflows around asynchronous communication and shared documentation to support autonomy, focus, and cross-timezone collaboration. While our teams work independently, connection and teamwork remain central to how we operate ‚Äî through regular rituals, meaningful virtual interactions, and in-person gatherings every quarter. These include team offsites and a yearly company-wide retreat to build relationships, spark creativity, and have fun together.

Being remote-first also means we value outcomes over hours and trust our team members to manage their work in a way that suits their unique rhythm and responsibilities. This approach allows us to support a truly flexible work environment, while staying aligned with our mission and values.

At ZOE, working remotely doesn‚Äôt mean working alone ‚Äî it means being empowered, supported, and connected, wherever you are.

Compensation Philosophy

We are committed to offering competitive and equitable compensation that reflects the value of each role and aligns with regional labor market standards. Our approach to compensation goes beyond just base salary ‚Äî we offer a comprehensive package that includes base pay and stock options, ensuring that every team member is rewarded for their contributions to the company‚Äôs growth and success.

We believe that building a thriving team requires not only providing fair and competitive compensation but also fostering an environment where success is shared collectively. Our total compensation package is designed to support the well-being of our employees, recognise their individual contributions, and empower them to grow alongside ZOE.

Benefits & Perks

We understand the significant role our benefits play in motivating, inspiring and safeguarding our employees' well-being. Our benefits strategy is thoughtfully designed to echo our mission and values, recognising the diverse needs arising from different life stages of our ZOEntists.

Our approach to benefits takes an inclusive and flexible view of both personal and professional growth. From competitive health insurance and wellness packages to inclusive parental policies, building connection, and tailored professional development programs, we've got you covered.

At ZOE, we continue to build a benefits package that invests in our team members‚Äô long-term personal and professional growth and wellbeing, adding to this list as it evolves.

Equal opportunities

We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive team where every individual can bring their authentic self to work. We believe that this is key to our success and are dedicated to positively impacting the tech industry. As part of our commitment to equal opportunities, we encourage candidates from underrepresented backgrounds to apply. We ensure a respectful and inclusive environment for all and do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, marital status, disability, or age. If you require any accommodations during the interview process, please feel free to inform us, and we will make every effort to support your needs.
